events.id: Book Notes: Symphony of Queer Errands with the NZSO-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Book Notes: Symphony of Queer Errands with the NZSO
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Unity Books are proud to host New Zealand Symphony Orchestra members in the shop for a monthly series, Book Notes.
Symphony of Queer Errands is Rachel O'Neill's delightfully irreverent long-form narrative poem / concept album / queer masterwork - delivering a boundless ode to queer joy.
The book was published by local Pōneke publisher, Tender Press.
Bridget Douglas, Antonia Barnett-McIntosh and Rachel O'Neill have worked on this project together, and they will all be performing.
We can't wait to see you there and hear this wonderful book come to life.

events.venue: Orient, 29b College St
events.long_description:
Orient's bringing the charm of Japanese convenience store favourites to Wellington!

🍞 Fluffy Japanese sandwiches – from tamago to menchi and sweet fruit & cream.
🍵 Matcha & Hojicha specials – crafted for the ultimate tea lover.
🍡 Sweet matcha treats – the perfect balance of indulgence and tradition.
🥔 Korokke – golden, crispy, and utterly satisfying.

Come by and experience the simple joys of Japan at Orient.

events.id: The Love Ferry-Wellington Railway Station, Bunny Street-WOAP
events.name: The Love Ferry
events.venue: Wellington Railway Station, Bunny Street
events.long_description:
Interislander is docking onshore to bring burger lovers something truly special — The Love Ferry a spicy beef and pork patty with melted Kāpiti brie, caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket, truffle aioli, crispy Harringtons bacon and pickled jalapeños in a Poneke Bakery red brioche bun, with smoked paprika and sea salt sprinkled fries.
This gourmet tribute to the love of food is served straight from the iconic Interislander ship box. Back by popular demand, the Interislander pop-up burger truck is making waves once again, offering a taste of the Interislander experience without even setting sail.

events.id: Wellington Audio Tour: A Journey Through Culture, Governance, and Nature-Thistle Inn Mulgrave St Wellington,-Event Brite
events.name: Wellington Audio Tour: A Journey Through Culture, Governance, and Nature
events.venue: Thistle Inn Mulgrave St Wellington,
events.long_description:
Embark on the Wellington Wonders: A Journey Through Culture, Governance, and Nature – Your Personal Adventure in Wellington!
Step into the soul of Wellington with our immersive self-guided audio tour. Wander through historic streets, uncover hidden gems, and let the city's rich tapestry of stories unfold at your own pace. Whether you're a history enthusiast, a curious traveler, or someone seeking a unique experience, this tour is your perfect companion.
  🗺️ Tour Details
Duration: 1 hour 27 minutes
Distance: Around 4.2 km (2.6 miles)
Audio Content: up to 28min
Meeting Point: Start at Thistle Inn, only a 3 minute walk from Wellington Station
Stops: 11 captivating landmarks including Archives New Zealand, Radio New Zealand, Reserve Bank of New Zealand
Experience the charm of Wellington like never before. Dive deep into tales of yesteryears, marvel at architectural wonders, and feel the pulse of the city as you navigate through its vibrant streets.
  🎒 What's Included
Professionally narrated audio stories bringing Wellington's history to life
Interactive map to guide your journey seamlessly
Opportunities to explore and capture the city's most picturesque spots
Flexibility to start, pause, and resume the tour at your convenience
ℹ️ Important Info
This is a self-guided audio tour on your phone so no in-person guide.
You'll need a smartphone with Android 7.0+ or iOS 16+ (iPhone 8 or later).
You can start the tour at any time (the event time does not matter).
The tour will be available to you forever so you can explore on any day.
Bring headphones and make sure your phone is charged!
  📲 Getting Started is Easy!
Once you book the tour, you'll receive an email within 10 minutes containing your unique redemption code and simple instructions to download our app. Enter the code, and you're all set to explore Wellington on your terms. It doesn't matter which date or time you select, when you redeem the code, the audio tour will be available to you permanently so you can explore on any day.
  👥 Who's It For?
Whether you're a solo traveler, a couple seeking a romantic escapade, a family on an educational outing, or a group of friends eager for adventure, this tour caters to all. It's perfect for those who value flexibility, rich storytelling, and the freedom to explore without constraints.
  🎬 Tour Description
Embark on an enchanting journey through the heart of Wellington, where history and culture collide! Begin your exploration at Te Papa, New Zealand's national museum, where captivating exhibits bring the nation’s stories to life.

Stroll down vibrant Courtenay Place, the bustling hub of the city's nightlife, lined with eclectic eateries and chic boutiques beckoning you to taste local flavors. Next, immerse yourself in the serene beauty of the Basin Reserve, a historic cricket ground surrounded by lush greenery, ready to inspire with its rich sporting heritage.

Each location is a treasure trove of experiences waiting to be discovered, making your day in Wellington unforgettable! Join us and let the charm of this capital city sweep you off your feet!
  🎧 What is AllTours?
AllTours is your ultimate travel companion for immersive audio tours. Discover cities like never before as our app reveals the stories behind the sights. Just plug in your headphones and explore!
With AllTours, you'll experience:
Immersive Experiences: Our digital guides bring landmarks to life with captivating stories and historical insights
Offline Access: Download tours and maps for offline use – perfect for travelers concerned about data usage
Interactive Maps: Navigate effortlessly with our user-friendly interface showing the optimal route
Flexibility: Start, pause, and resume tours whenever you want – explore at your own pace
Multilingual Support: Enjoy tours in your preferred language with our extensive language options
AllTours transforms ordinary sightseeing into extraordinary adventures. From iconic landmarks to hidden gems, we help you explore like a local while learning fascinating stories along the way.
  📍 Tour Stops
You will visit the following locations:
    🏨  Thistle Inn (4min)
    📚  Archives New Zealand (4min)
    🪣  Old St Paul's, Wellington (4min)
    📍  Ministry of Education (New Zealand) (3min)
    ⛪  Wellington Cathedral of St Paul (2min)
    🏠  Premier House (2min)
    📍  Beehive (New Zealand) (3min)
    🏦  Reserve Bank of New Zealand (2min)
    📍  Radio New Zealand (2min)
    🌳  Te Ngākau Civic Square (2min)
    🐄  Bank of New Zealand Te Aro branch building (4min)
Each stop features engaging audio stories that bring the location's history and significance to life.
    🌍 Available Languages
Our tours are available in 30+ languages to ensure you have the best experience:
🇬🇧 English  •  🇫🇷 French  •  🇪🇸 Spanish  •  🇩🇪 German  •  🇮🇹 Italian  •  🇵🇹 Portuguese  •  🇷🇺 Russian  •  🇯🇵 Japanese  •  🇨🇳 Chinese  •  🇳🇱 Dutch  •  🇧🇷 Portuguese (Brazil)  •  🇸🇦 Arabic  •  🇰🇷 Korean  •  🇸🇪 Swedish  •  🇩🇰 Danish  •  🇫🇮 Finnish  •  🇵🇱 Polish  •  🇨🇿 Czech  •  🇭🇺 Hungarian  •  🇬🇷 Greek  •  🇹🇷 Turkish  •  🇮🇳 Hindi  •  🇦🇱 Albanian  •  🇪🇹 Amharic  •  🇦🇲 Armenian  •  🇧🇩 Bengali  •  🇧🇦 Bosnian  •  🇧🇬 Bulgarian  •  🇲🇲 Burmese  •  🇪🇸 Catalan  •  🇭🇷 Croatian  •  🇪🇪 Estonian  •  🇬🇪 Georgian  •  🇮🇳 Gujarati  •  🇮🇸 Icelandic  •  🇮🇩 Indonesian  •  🇮🇳 Kannada  •  🇰🇿 Kazakh  •  🇱🇻 Latvian  •  🇱🇹 Lithuanian  •  🇲🇰 Macedonian  •  🇲🇾 Malay  •  🇮🇳 Malayalam  •  🇮🇳 Marathi  •  🇲🇳 Mongolian  •  🇳🇴 Norwegian  •  🇮🇷 Persian  •  🇮🇳 Punjabi  •  🇷🇴 Romanian  •  🇷🇸 Serbian  •  🇸🇰 Slovak  •  🇸🇮 Slovenian  •  🇸🇴 Somali  •  🇰🇪 Swahili  •  🇵🇭 Tagalog  •  🇮🇳 Tamil  •  🇮🇳 Telugu  •  🇹🇭 Thai  •  🇺🇦 Ukrainian  •  🇵🇰 Urdu  •  🇻🇳 Vietnamese

events.id: Club Tropicana-Beach Babylon, 232 Oriental Pde-WOAP
events.name: Club Tropicana
events.venue: Beach Babylon, 232 Oriental Pde
events.long_description:
This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
events.description:
This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour.
Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington.
No passport required.
The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair.
Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry.

events.id: The Enchanted Ale Quarter-Little Beer Quarter, 6 Edward St-WOAP
events.name: The Enchanted Ale Quarter
events.venue: Little Beer Quarter, 6 Edward St
events.long_description:
Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.

events.id: Academy Prize for Visual Art-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Academy Prize for Visual Art
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.description:
A huge exhibition of national artists will be on display at Tākina in August.
Artists from every corner of New Zealand will be vying for a $25,000 grand prize.
The Wellington Sculpture Trust will mount a display celebrating 42 years creating and promoting public art in the city.
Finally, nine South Island artists sharing Netherlands heritage exhibit an irreverent show through a multicultural creative lens.
NZAFA President Wayne Newman says “Tākina is Wellington’s new heart of creativity, and we’re delighted to fill it with the vision, energy, and diversity of New Zealand art.

events.id: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Description Buying tickets to FLIGHT and SÉANCE?
Book your first experience and then wait to receive your confirmation email to access your unique discount code to book your second experience at a discounted rate.
FLIGHT is an unsettling journey in complete darkness, using DARKFIELD signature 360 degree sound design inside a custom-built shipping container.
The many worlds interpretation of Quantum Mechanics proposes all possible outcomes that could occur, are occurring in countless worlds of varying similarity.
Find comfort in knowing that however ill advised your life choices have been - there is a version of you who made better ones and is suffering less regret and embarrassment.

events.id: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Description Buying tickets to SÉANCE and FLIGHT?
A twist on a traditional séance relying on psychology and inclination towards superstition to alter your perception of reality.
Step inside, take a seat but don’t get comfortable.
Transforming a shipping container into a Victorian séance room, SÉANCE makes audiences question not just their beliefs, but also their own senses.
SÉANCE explores the psychology of a group of people who have been bombarded with suggestible material, and asks that they believe in what might be conjured up into the room with them.

events.id: Dope Lemon — Golden Wolf World Tour-Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Dope Lemon — Golden Wolf World Tour
events.venue: Shed 6, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Since his 2016 debut, Dope Lemon has cultivated a reputation for creating dreamy, laid-back grooves with introspective lyricism.
Now the Australian singer-songwriter is going on tour.
He’s traveling to Wellington to share his latest album, ‘Golden Wolf’.
His four previous albums have amassed over 700 million streams online.
‘Golden Wolf’ is the shimmering fifth album for Dope Lemon.

events.id: Visa Wellington On a Plate--Wellington NZ
events.name: Visa Wellington On a Plate
events.description:
New Zealand’s favourite foodie fest is back.
For the whole month of August, Visa Wellington On a Plate (VWOAP) brings culinary delights to hospitality venues across the city and region.
Expect everything from creative events, delicious pop-up restaurants, and the beloved Burger Wellington.
This year, the festival theme is ‘Food is love’.
It's a tribute to the joy of connecting over kai and the capital’s vibrant, resilient hospitality scene.

events.id: Wellington Opera — A Masked Ball-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wellington Opera — A Masked Ball
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Local opera company Wellington Opera presents a grand production.
‘A Masked Ball’ (Un Ballo in Maschera) is one of Giuseppe Verdi’s great masterpieces.
It contrasts the frivolity of a masquerade with high drama.
For this production, Wellington Opera has gathered a cast made exclusively of New Zealand opera singers.
Madeleine Pierard and Jared Holt return after headlining the 2024 production of ‘Tosca’.

events.id: Darkfield-Odlin’s Plaza, Wellington Waterfront-Wellington NZ
events.name: Darkfield
events.venue: Odlin’s Plaza, Wellington Waterfront
events.description:
Darkfield offers audiences a unique theatrical experience that blurs the line between reality and imagination.
From the outside they look like two simple shipping containers.
Each container takes you through two different experiences.
The special effects will transport you into ghostly séance where you’ll question your senses and beliefs.
In Flight you’ll encounter an airline cabin complete with seats, windows, a TV screen for in-flight announcements, and in-flight safety cards.

events.id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra.
Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods.
You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control.
Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

events.id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat.
The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years.
The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025.
First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’.
Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’.

events.id: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The NZSO’s reputation for artistic excellence attracts many of the world’s leading musicians, conductors, and soloists.
In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list.
At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO.
Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works.
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO.

events.id: Circa Theatre 2025 Season-Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Circa Theatre 2025 Season
events.venue: Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Inside Circa Theatre’s waterfront venue, you’ll find two performance spaces.
Both offer a smorgasbord of professional theatre throughout the year.
Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented.
It also includes programming from comedies and cabarets to contemporary dance and pantomime.
Called ‘Velarium’, it undulates in the wind mirroring the water in the harbour.

events.id: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Royal New Zealand Ballet 2025 Season
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The Royal New Zealand Ballet (RNZB) pushes boundaries with its 2025 programme.
Diverse and captivating works reflect the vision and influence of artistic director Ty King-Wall.

events.id: Santa Cipolla-Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St-WOAP
events.name: Santa Cipolla
events.venue: Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St
events.long_description:
“Holy Onion”. For the entire month, Cicio Cacio Osteria is getting brave and bold, celebrating the magic of vegetables in all their glory, especially the santa cipolla (aka the holy onion). 
Vegetables bring colour, life and joy. In Italy, they mark the rhythm of the seasons, stir up cherished memories and signal the excitement of fresh beginnings. Come along and experience vibrant flavours with playful snacks, fun street food, freshly baked breads, handmade pasta and a brand new range of dishes that celebrate the beauty, bounty and simplicity of Italian cuisine.

events.id: Dumpling Diaries-Chow, Level 1, 45 Tory St-WOAP
events.name: Dumpling Diaries
events.venue: Chow, Level 1, 45 Tory St
events.long_description:
An immersive three-course dumpling and cocktail experience that brings together the vibrant flavours of Asia in a fun, social setting. Each guest will enjoy three thoughtfully curated courses of dumplings, paired with five specially crafted mini-cocktails, enhancing the flavours and offering a unique twist on the traditional dining experience.

This event is all about celebrating the deep connection between food and love. From the care with which dumplings are made, to the joy of sharing them with others, food becomes a vehicle for connection, comfort, and passion. Whether you’re on a first date, catching up with friends, or enjoying a solo indulgence, each bite and sip tells a story of togetherness and fun.

The menu features dumplings inspired by the diverse culinary traditions of China, Japan, Thailand, Vietnam, Korea, and India. Each course is paired with a cocktail designed to complement and elevate the flavours of the dishes. Vegan and non-alc options are available, ensuring everyone can join in on the experience.

As the evening unfolds, a live DJ will spin soulful tunes to set the mood and enhance the vibrant atmosphere. Expect playful, creative touches throughout the event, including the Tinder-inspired cocktail, the "Swipe Right Spritz", because some matches, like good food and drink, are simply meant to be.

events.id: Lazy Susan Tacos-Taco Addicts @ tasteHQ, 386 Broadway-WOAP
events.name: Lazy Susan Tacos
events.venue: Taco Addicts @ tasteHQ, 386 Broadway
events.long_description:
Join Taco Addicts at their production headquarters for a shared taco dining experience. You and your friends, chosen family and/or whānau will create your own delicious tacos from baskets of hand-crafted tortillas, bowls of fillings and toppings. 
Taco Addicts premises were previously a Chinese Restaurant so they will be serving your taco delights on a 'Lazy Susan', so you'll be able to spin, pass, create and enjoy this family style shared dining experience. Taco Addicts owner Amber has fond childhood memories of such family taco nights in Austin, Texas and has designed this event to share them with you. 

Local wine and beer will be available for purchase. You'll enjoy a complimentary non-alcoholic drink to pair with your meal, and a sweet treat to finish.

Lazy Susans work best with more people, therefore bookings of two will be seated with another booking of 2 or 3 with similar dietary requirements. Please advise if you want to be seated with your friends when you book. The whole table will leave with something to taco 'bout for days to come.

events.id: Wagyu Flame Feast-The Dumpling Company (The Terrace Store), 44 The Terrace-WOAP
events.name: Wagyu Flame Feast
events.venue: The Dumpling Company (The Terrace Store), 44 The Terrace
events.long_description: This one-off event for The Dumpling Company promises premium New Zealand and Japan Wagyu. Sourced from the finest cuts, wagyu is known for its rich marbling, tenderness, and deep umami flavours. Every bite melts in your mouth, delivering the ultimate BBQ experience. Enjoy their signature house-made dipping sauces and a curated selection of fresh, traditional Asian side dishes. So you can curate your own perfect balance of flavours. With the grill right at your table you'll feel the warmth, hear the sizzle, and immerse yourself in the true essence of Asian barbecue.

Enjoy their signature house-made dipping sauces and a curated selection of fresh, traditional Asian side dishes.

events.id: The Boil Up-Everybody Eats at LTD., 60 Dixon St-WOAP
events.name: The Boil Up
events.venue: Everybody Eats at LTD., 60 Dixon St
events.long_description:
Join Josh Hunter from Whakapapa of your Kai for a special evening as we share a beloved Aotearoa tradition – the Boil Up. A common and comforting kai in many Māori households, the Boil Up is a hearty stew, rich with root vegetables, tender smoked  pork bones, ham hock dough boys , and nourishing pūhā. To complete this classic meal, he'll be serving a warm, comforting steam pudding for dessert with charcoal custard and black Dorris plums  

This kaupapa represents something Josh deeply believes in: providing for many and creating access to nourishing food from the heart. It’s kai born from resourcefulness, designed to feed whānau and community. 

This event is koha-based, honouring the principle of reciprocity and ensuring everyone can be a part of our table.

Nau mai, haere mai – come, gather, and eat with us.

events.id: Head Over Heels in Love-Homewood, 50 Homewood Ave-WOAP
events.name: Head Over Heels in Love
events.venue: Homewood, 50 Homewood Ave
events.long_description:
Love turns the world upside down. And sometimes, so does geography.

In a setting that’s rich with romance with candlelit tables and exquisite floral decorations, you will begin your evening with cocktails and canapés served in Homewood’s heritage setting. Then prepare to have your expectations flipped: this is a five-course dinner where nothing follows the usual script. Familiar dishes are turned on their head. Flavours play tricks. And every course is a playful celebration of the unexpected paths love— and life — can take.

Inspired by famous love stories and infused with the warmth of Palliser Estate wines, this is an evening of indulgence, romance, and connection — hosted in the elegant surrounds of Homewood, the official residence of the British High Commissioner.

Love is all around. And for one magical night, it turns us head over heels — in the best possible way.

events.id: Le Petit Chef-Intercontinental Hotel Wellington, 2 Grey St-WOAP
events.name: Le Petit Chef
events.venue: Intercontinental Hotel Wellington, 2 Grey St
events.long_description:
InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
events.description:
InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.
Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients.
Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

events.id: Queens of Lyon-Alma House, 40 Wallace Street-WOAP
events.name: Queens of Lyon
events.venue: Alma House, 40 Wallace Street
events.long_description:
Chef Laura Greenfield of Field & Green brings the spirit of the Mères Lyonnaises - the legendary “Mothers of Lyon” - to life in an evening dedicated to the women who shaped Lyon’s culinary legacy. Known as the gastronomic capital of France, Lyon owes much of its reputation to these pioneering female chefs, who created a style of cuisine that marries comfort and skill, tradition and innovation.

The evening will feature a five-course menu inspired by the Mères Lyonnaises, whose influence transformed home-cooked traditions into haute cuisine. Drawing from the kitchens of silk weavers and merchants, these women cultivated a culinary approach defined by warmth, generosity, and exceptional craftsmanship. Their legacy is woven into the fabric of classic French cooking, with many earning Michelin stars and leaving an indelible mark on modern gastronomy.

Set in the charming Alma House, this dining experience pays tribute to luminaries such as Eugénie Brazier, the first chef to simultaneously hold three Michelin stars at two restaurants - a record unbroken for six decades. Wellington's own award winning chef Laura Greenfield will reinterpret their dishes with her signature flair, infusing them with Field & Green’s ethos of genuine hospitality and culinary excellence.

Each course will be a celebration of the Mères Lyonnaises’ artistry, highlighting the timeless techniques and flavours that continue to inspire chefs today. Expect an evening of evocative storytelling through food, complemented by a thoughtful selection of beverages that enhance the menu’s Lyonnaise roots.

This unique homage to the “Queens of Lyon” offers an opportunity to savour history, honour culinary trailblazers, and experience the enduring influence of their kitchens.
events.description:
Chef Laura Greenfield of Field & Green brings the spirit of the Mères Lyonnaises - the legendary “Mothers of Lyon” - to life in an evening dedicated to the women who shaped Lyon’s culinary legacy.
Known as the gastronomic capital of France, Lyon owes much of its reputation to these pioneering female chefs, who created a style of cuisine that marries comfort and skill, tradition and innovation.
The evening will feature a five-course menu inspired by the Mères Lyonnaises, whose influence transformed home-cooked traditions into haute cuisine.
Drawing from the kitchens of silk weavers and merchants, these women cultivated a culinary approach defined by warmth, generosity, and exceptional craftsmanship.
Their legacy is woven into the fabric of classic French cooking, with many earning Michelin stars and leaving an indelible mark on modern gastronomy.

Bring your inner artist to life, guided by Wellington visual artist Jane Blackmore. You'll paint a piece that reflects an eclectic still life on a wintry South Coast evening, while you nibble on tasty vegan treats and sip perfectly paired cocktails crafted by Lyall Bay's Southward Distillery. 
Forget the cold outside!  As the night unfolds, immerse yourself in an inspiring blend of paints, tastes, and uplifting vibes, creating an unforgettable experience of creativity, cuisine, and connection. Ticket includes three cocktails and a canvas to create your masterpiece on to take home. Paints and paintbrushes will be provided.

events.long_description:
A Must-Attend Workshop!
Want to get your business seen online—without paying for expensive SEO campaigns? Join us to uncover simple, effective strategies to improve your search rankings and online presence. Using your FREE Digital Insite Report from Thryv, you’ll gain valuable insights into how your business appears across the web and what you can do to enhance your visibility.
Led by Thryv Business Advisor and Wairarapa local, Phillippa Roil-Glendenning, this workshop covers:
Google My Business Profile – Get listed, get optimized, and get found.
The Land Past Google – How your business appears in online directories and search engines.
Voice Search Visibility – Will Alexa or Siri find you? Make sure they do!
Website SEO & Performance – Speed, mobile-friendliness, and ranking factors made simple.

Social & Online Directories – Why they matter for SEO and how to make the most of them.
Using Social Posting for SEO – How regular content boosts your search ranking and keeps your business relevant.
Plus, discover how Thryv’s powerful tools can streamline and automate these tasks, saving you time and making online marketing effortless!
Phillippa will break down WHAT these elements are, HOW they work, and WHERE you can make quick, impactful improvements—all without hiring an expensive SEO agency.
With years of experience in digital marketing, SEO, and online visibility, Phillippa knows what it takes to help local businesses get noticed and grow. Don’t miss this opportunity to take control of your online presence and attract more customers. Spaces are limited—reserve your spot today!

events.long_description:
Interislander has been a long-time supporter of Visa Wellington on a Plate, the famous hospitality event that lights up the Wellington region each August.

The Love Ferry
Featuring a Poneke Red brioche bun, with a beef & pork patty seasoned with a mix of smoked paprika, garlic, and a touch of cayenne pepper. Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. Served with a side of crispy fries sprinkled with smoked paprika and sea salt at $20. For the perfect pairing, we offer a Garage Project Beer match for $12.

Pop-up Burger at Wellington Railway Station
We've set up a pop-up burger truck outside the Wellington Railway Station. This will allow the public to indulge in our burger and fries without needing to sail on the Interislander. Its also available to passengers when travelling the Cook Strait on the Ferry.

events.name: Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand 2025
events.venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Royal Society Te Apārangi invites you to attend Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand 2025 on Thursday 7 August where 21 participants from Aotearoa New Zealand and the Pacific Island Nations will pitch their innovative breakthrough idea for the chance to represent the region and compete at the Falling Walls Lab Global Finale in Berlin.
Attend this FREE event to hear the participants pitch their breakthrough ideas to the Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand Jury and be inspired by these students and early-career professionals!
About Falling Walls Falling Walls Labs are organised by independent partners of Falling Walls Foundation across the globe.
The winners of each Lab travel to Berlin for the Falling Wall Lab Global Finale run by the Falling Walls Foundation.
***For event enquiries, please contact the organisers at events@royalsociety.org.nz

events.id: Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand 2025-Royal Society Te Apārangi, 11 Turnbull St, Thorndon, Wellington-Facebook

events.venue: Royal Society Te Apārangi, 11 Turnbull St, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Twenty-one participants from around Aotearoa New Zealand and the Pacific Island Nations will pitch their innovative breakthrough ideas.
Coming from as far away as Fiji, participants will have the opportunity to showcase their innovative research, scientific idea, or evidence-based initiative, and how it could make a difference for society in a three-minute presentation.
The winning pitch will have the chance to represent the region and compete at the Falling Walls Lab Global Finale in Berlin.
This year’s pitches are Breaking the Walls of:
- Unsustainable Dairy
- Calcium Deficiency
- Disability Isolation
- Bias in AI
- Land-bound Health Systems
- Discomfort in VR
- Profit-Driven Gambling
- Setting Carbon Budgets
- Nature for All
- Carbon-Intensive Concrete
- Safer Cannabinoid Drugs
- Coastal Climate Risks
- Chronic Pain
- Housing-Related Illness
- Legal Inaccessibility
- Symbolic Green Financing
- Hydrogen Storage
- Gut Contractions
- Circular (De)Construction
- Biodegradable Bioplastics

events.id: Server Gardening with Julian Oliver-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Server Gardening with Julian Oliver
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This lecture, delivered by Julian Oliver, will introduce participants to the potentials and pitfalls of self-hosted server infrastructure, whether that be a PC-turned-server hosted at home, studio or office, or on a server rented at a datacenter. Starting points for self-hosting will be covered, with an introduction to system administration in the context of digital caretaker, guardian and gardener. The lecture will position self-hosting as an act of infrastructural resistance and reclamation in an era of pervasive digital imperialism and extractivism.
  The talk will also assess free and open source platform alternatives to Big Tech, from cloud, to webmail, forum, team chat, and more.

events.id: Supporting self-regulation through play-14 Marsden Ave, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Supporting self-regulation through play
events.venue: 14 Marsden Ave, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This session is designed for families with children in Preschool to Year 8 and will explore how structured play can help children develop self-regulation skills. These are the skills that help us manage emotions, thoughts and behaviours. Strong self-regulation supports focus, emotional control, persistence and positive social interactions. It is also linked to long-term success in education, health and wellbeing.
We're pleased to welcome Mina Prip from ENGAGE™, a research-based programme developed by Dr Dione Healey (University of Otago) and used in schools and ECEs across Aotearoa.
https://community.marsden.school.nz/CommunityConversation...
Through fun and familiar games, ENGAGE™ builds:
- emotional skills: recognising and regulating feelings, calming strategies and frustration tolerance
- cognitive skills: paying attention, remembering instructions
- behavioural skills: impulse control, turn-taking, movement regulation.
Mina will share the research behind the programme, how it is being used by Marsden, and simple activities you can use at home.
Date: Thursday 7 August 2025
Time: 5.30pm–6.30pm

events.id: NZAC Wellington: Beyond the mountains – The growth of rock climbing in Aotearoa from the late 1960's-Tararua Tramping Club Inc., 4 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: NZAC Wellington: Beyond the mountains – The growth of rock climbing in Aotearoa from the late 1960's
events.venue: Tararua Tramping Club Inc., 4 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for our next section night!
Natalie Looyer recently completed a PhD thesis at Victoria University of Wellington on the history of rock climbing in Aotearoa New Zealand.
This project traversed 60 years of modern rock climbing activities, from the first graded routes at Long Beach, Castle Rock, and Tītahi Bay in the 1960s, through the 'anarchic' era of Whanganui Bay in the early 1980s and the heyday of Women Climbing, to the boom of indoor climbing, competitions, sport climbing, and bouldering from the 1990s and into the 21st century. From its early beginnings to the Olympic stage, the story of rock climbing in Aotearoa is rich with colourful characters, special places, and contests for belonging.
Natalie will speak about the early years of rock climbing in Aotearoa, and why a new generation of New Zealand mountaineers in the 1960s turned to rock climbing on crags as a 'safer', yet equally exciting, form of climbing.
As always, there will be pizza and chats! Everyone is welcome at our section nights – see you there!
Photo credit: New Zealand Alpine Journal 31 (1978), photo by Pete Giles

events.name: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature
A one-of-a-kind yoga experience designed to awaken the senses, stir reflection, and bring you into deeper connection — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Take this moment to become grounded in your true nature through embodied movement. This practice is your invitation to appreciate and develop a deeper connection with the Earth — to slow down, to notice the changing landscapes and seasons around you, and to find them within you. It’s a chance to remember that we are part of this world, shaped by the same rhythms, held by the same ground.
We speak of “getting into nature” as something we have to do — yet Earth-based traditions have always seen the plant and all beings as interconnected and sacred, humans as one with the Earth itself.
This is more than a yoga class — it’s an immersive experience designed to bring you back into that sense of belonging.
As you move through gentle hatha yoga, you’ll be surrounded by breathtaking visuals of our earthly home, designed and projected by Andy from Hype Entertainment. The space will come alive with images of nature from sunset to sunrise — each scene offering a distinct atmosphere to reflect and move with. A curated soundscape and subtle aromatherapy will support your journey, drawing you deeper into the moment.
Let us weave the scared back in, to weave nature back into the centre of our everyday lives. Let us find our way back through nature, to our true nature and selves.
After your practice, stay to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, included in your ticket.
Meet Nicola, your teacher
With over 20 years of teaching experience and a deep connection to yoga philosophy, Nicola’s gentle guidance will lead you on a journey of self-discovery. Her classes are a blend of warmth and wisdom, helping you explore both your body and your spirit. As a teacher, she embraces the essence of yoga in every aspect of her life, creating a space where you can experience not only physical movement but a true connection to your inner self.

events.id: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Taoism: How to Eat Wisely
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Taosim: How to Eat Wisely
Discover the ancient wisdom of food, energy, and balance in this insightful session with Dr. Jinfeng — plus enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, included with your ticket.
Many people believe they’re eating healthily, yet still experience fatigue, inflammation, and discomfort. Why is that?
From a Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) perspective, health isn’t just about what you eat — it’s also about when you eat, the energetic nature of the food, and how well it suits your unique body type. In this workshop, you’ll explore food as medicine and gain insight into how to eat in a way that restores vitality, supports digestion, and balances your energy naturally.
What you’ll learn
– The energetic qualities of different foods
– How to identify which foods suit your constitution best
– The ideal times to eat during the day and why timing matters
– How TCM views food as fuel for both physical health and life force
Whether you're curious about Eastern approaches to wellness or looking for practical tools to support your health, this workshop will offer a fresh and meaningful perspective on your relationship with food.
Meet Jinfeng, your host
As a scholarly well-being practitioner with a long history of family heritage (great grandfather and father), Dr. Jinfeng has been practicing Taoist Qigong and Buddhism Great Awakening Zen Meditation to sharpen her own sense and boost her own physical vitality.

events.id: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble-55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble
events.venue: 55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
Photography – The Art of Paying Attention In this lecture Anne Noble will discuss modes of collaborative practice across a series of projects that spans her work with bees as well as current projects concerning the environmental degradation of our waterways.
In 2023 Anne Noble was commissioned by Ngāi Tahu to create an archive of images that would reveal the deteriorating state of freshwater across South Island waterways and the resulting impact on mahinga kai customs and practices.
He is remembered for his passion for the medium, support of photographers and their work and his special love of practices he termed lyric, transcendent or poetic documentary photography.
In association with the Peter Turner Lecture a fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to support the Peter Turner Scholarship that was launched in association with the lecture and each year provides a postgraduate student scholarship for a student engaging with social and cultural issues through the medium of photography in its broadest sense.
The Peter Turner Fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to grow the support this scholarship can offer young photographers aspiring for a career the lens based arts.

events.long_description:
Every Thursday fortnight is quiz night at one of Upper Hutt's best venues - Fermented at Brewtown!
Hosted by Sam from Gee Quiz and kicking off at 6.30pm, the quiz offers five rounds of trivia that's not too hard, not too easy, but includes content that relates to you and your crew!

We advise booking in your team here, specifying you are coming to quiz night: https://fermented.co.nz/reservations

Join us every Thursday night at Eva Pub for an unforgettable celebration of Wellington's vibrant music scene!
With an electrifying array of local talent and plenty of opportunities for you to shine, there's no better place to experience the magic of live music than your favorite local hangout.

events.id: Churton Park Toasmasters meeting-Johnsonville Bowling Club, 34 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Churton Park Toasmasters meeting
events.venue: Johnsonville Bowling Club, 34 Frankmoore Ave, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Would you like to improve your communication skills? Become a more confident public speaker? Grow your leadership skills? Meet new people?
Churton Park Toastmasters Club is just for you. We are multicultural, supportive, a friendly fun club where you can lose that fear of public speaking and improve your confidence, communication and leadership skills.
We meet on Thursdays every fortnight. The meeting will be held at the Johnsonville Bowling Club (34 Frankmoore Avenue, Johnsonville). Please arrive about 10 minutes earlier so that we can meet and explain how the meeting is organised.
We welcome guests to any of our meetings. There is no pressure to participate and you can just observe. Come visit us and meet our dynamic and diverse group. We're sure you will enjoy your time at the meeting!

events.id: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet
events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
The Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet is thrilled to be performing at the WJC!
The two first played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Program under the mentorship of the legendary Rodger Fox, and now return to the stage for this special performance.
Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.
Each piece reflects moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher.
The set will also feature compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.

events.id: REVELATION VALLEY-1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: REVELATION VALLEY
events.venue: 1 Kent Ter, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Experience the artistry of theatre-maker Lisa Maule and special guests in this poetry premiere.
Three years ago surrounded by books and thinking about constitutional change, Pākehā theatre maker Lisa Maule decided to write poetry.
Revelation Valley is a selection of her writing performed by Lisa with titles such as My Capitalist Stapler, Cohesion is Also a Radical Act and Hate (a poem about love).
Each night a different invited guest adds to the creativity with a taste of their own work.
Embrace unexpected laughs, challenge your norms and immerse yourself in creativity.
Lisa Maule grew up in Wellington where she was born and went to Karori Normal School and Wellington Girls College. She has two young adult children and two black fluffy dogs.
As a theatre maker Lisa started in the 1990s, her first role outside of university was as the technical operator at BATS Theatre on a Red Mole show.
Other formative experiences were at Taki Rua Theatre and with women's theatre such as Not Broadcast Quality and Magdalena Aotearoa.
The creative practice Lisa is best known for is her lighting design work and she also loves to draw, paint and make collage. Lisa has a penchant for collecting chairs which has been enabled by being a set designer and is good at cutting cardboard.
Rock cakes
Rocky relationships
Stirfry
Stir the pot
Mix the batter
Mix the metaphor
Flip the pancake
Flip the bird
Oi - get out the pantry!
Get into the groove
Get with the programme
Get up, get up, get up, get on
(Excerpt from Places of conflicted feelings)
_________________________________________________
ACCESSIBILITY: THIS SHOW TAKES PLACE IN THE STUDIO, LOCATED ON THE TOP FLOOR OF THE BUILDING. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS SPACE IS NOT FULLY ACCESSIBLE FOR THOSE WITH LIMITED MOBILITY.

events.name: The Girls Uninterrupted
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Meet the women behind The Girls Uninterrupted and Kiwi Yarns — bold, brilliant, and refreshingly real.
Brodie, Gracie, and Caitlin each bring their own spark, sass, and storytelling to the mic, making a vibrant blend of laughs, heart, and unfiltered conversation.
With backgrounds spanning journalism, broadcasting, and even nursing, these three besties are as relatable as they are remarkable — and they’re not afraid to say exactly what you’re thinking.
She is an award-winning journalist and podcaster who has had a successful, exciting career as a broadcaster in New Zealand for 18 years.
She was once a champion surf lifesaver and spent a few years in the New Zealand Army.

events.id: WJC presents Nicholas Baucke-maunsell Quintet-18 Allen Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: WJC presents Nicholas Baucke-maunsell Quintet
events.venue: 18 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet is thrilled to be performing at the WJC!
Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet —
reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York. The two first
played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Program under the mentorship of the
legendary Rodger Fox, and now return to the stage for this special performance.
Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an
exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.
The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects
moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big
Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher. The set will also feature
compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.
Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt
performance live.

events.id: Kizomba/Semba Beginners 102 TERM-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Kizomba/Semba Beginners 102 TERM
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Embark on a journey into Angolan partner dances! This class introduces you to the enchanting world of Kizomba and its vibrant parent, Semba.
The focus of the styles will be Semba Social and Kizomba. From here you can branch into Semba Show or Kizomba/Fusion
- Basic steps and rhythms for both styles
- The fascinating historical connection between the dances
- Proper frame and partner connection techniques
- Essential moves to flow on the social dance floor
- Dance both styles at parties around the world.
- Kizomba basics and key patterns
- Practice time with rotating partners
- Add Banga (attitude) to you dance
Perfect for beginners and experienced dancers alike! No partner needed – we'll rotate to ensure everyone dances.
Wear comfy clothes and shoes that are not to grippy/sticky on the floor.
Ready to let Angola's rhythms move you?
Join us and unlock the joy of Kizomba and Semba!

Casual $20 each - $160 for 8 weeks
Crazy Savings - Limited time
Foundation Package - $100 for 8 weeks ($12.50 each)
Paired Pass - $80 each person for 8 weeks ($10.00 each person)
Must be 1 lead and 1 follow
BOOK
https://www.danca.co.nz/classes
PASSES & DISCOUNTS
https://www.danca.co.nz/buy-packages

events.name: Midweek Melters 003
events.venue: Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Warm yourself up this winter with some MIDWEEK MELTERS!
This is Pōneke's newest midweek DNB night, created and curated by the people, for the people.

Inspired by tales of Aotearoa's drum n bass scene in the early 2000s and Tuesday night raves back when Valhalla was Valve Bar, we've decided that the scene needs a return to its roots. To continue this series, we've locked in an all star lineup packed with some of our favourite DJs in the capital. This time around we've got 4 donnies, each with their own flavour, spinning a range of the finest artisan drum n bass and jungle.

Get acquainted with each of them below!

PORCELAIN --> https://soundcloud.com/user-956840933-250420902
BIG FERG LH --> https://soundcloud.com/user-363431504
INTEC -- > https://soundcloud.com/intecdnb
FE B2B HNR8 --> https://soundcloud.com/fe202

Online tickets are only $5 - door will be $10 or $5 before 9pm

Lock in now and prepare for some MIDWEEK MELTERS!

events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.description:
Presented by KiwiTicket and Wellington Comedy The capital's premier comedy competition.
Witness the rising stars in stand-up comedy before they hit the big time.
The stepping stone for many New Zealand comedians, the Raw Comedy Quest has brought forth new comedy talent from across the country, with heats in Christchurch, Wellington, Palmerston North and Auckland.

2023 Wellington finalist Luke Tawi won the 2023 National Raw Comedy Quest, and 2024 Wellington finalist Chen Wang came runner up in the 2024 National Raw Comedy Quest, can the capital do it again?

events.id: Arizona Flashback-Two Grey, 2 Grey St-WOAP
events.name: Arizona Flashback
events.venue: Two Grey, 2 Grey St
events.long_description:
Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.

Featuring the talents of: Alex Scott-Billing: Guitar Lily Atu: Vocals / Saxophone Star Stephens: Trumpet/ Vocals Elina Chester: Keys Jono Benzur: Bass Eric Sebastian: Percussion Ranu Wijesuriya: Drums FREE ENTRY– music from 9 PM.
Don’t miss out!

events.id: Sconnoisseur-Pravda Café and Grill, 107 Customhouse Qy-WOAP
events.name: Sconnoisseur
events.venue: Pravda Café and Grill, 107 Customhouse Qy
events.long_description:
Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.

events.name: Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place
events.venue: Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists.
Stephen Gallagher is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance.
From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling.

events.id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.
Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality.
Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.
August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.
The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.

events.id: The Fungus Among Us-Supra, Level 1, 31 Dixon Street-WOAP
events.name: The Fungus Among Us
events.venue: Supra, Level 1, 31 Dixon Street
events.long_description: Take a deep dive into the culinary power of the humble mushroom. At this mind blowing event Tom Millot will be changing the paradigm and making the mushroom the hero of every dish. He's asking you to change your perspective on something that is often seen as an accompaniment and making it shine in a five-course menu. Mushrooms are extremely versatile and delicious and this event is all about pushing the limit and realising their full potential and appreciate the full glory of fungi. Think sourdough focaccia baked over charcoal with shiitake mushrooms and served with cheese foam, a seafood broth with fried and poached mushrooms, mushroom claypot, mushroom 'steak' with red wine jus and a white chocolate and mushroom cremeux to finish (menu subject to change). Paired drinks option (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) can be added on the night.

events.id: Raclette Party-Le Bouillon Bel Air, 88 Tory Street-WOAP
events.name: Raclette Party
events.venue: Le Bouillon Bel Air, 88 Tory Street
events.long_description:
Indulge in a heartwarming, soul-satisfying raclette party with a Parisian twist. Experience an unforgettable French tradition inspired by the snowy slopes and rustic charm of the French Alps, reimagined with Parisian flair in the heart of Wellington. This is a celebration of togetherness, a joyful and indulgent affair designed to warm your heart and bring people closer over bubbling cheese, shared laughter, and flickering candlelight. 
You'll enjoy authentic French raclette cheese, melted at the table using your own personal raclette grill and poured over steamed baby potatoes, served with a selection of artisan charcuterie, cornichons, and greens. There’ll be French wine, kir royals, and even vin chaud (hot mulled wine) on offer to round out the Alpine vibe.

events.id: Love the Unloved-Nara, 14 Memorial Square-WOAP
events.name: Love the Unloved
events.venue: Nara, 14 Memorial Square
events.long_description: A night of unfamiliar flavours that will change your perceptions. 'Love the Unloved' is a degustation featuring ingredients you might have overlooked or maybe avoided, and classic dishes that you probably know, but perhaps don't love ...yet. Nara's menu showcases local producers and each course will be paired spirit from local distillers Aurora Distillery. During the evening, Aurora will distill a new spirit made from foraged leftovers at Featherston Market, a truly 'unloved' drop that we know you'll love. Your ticket includes a six-course degustation with matching spirits for each course.

events.id: Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania-Le Ciel Bakery, 6/100 Tory Street-WOAP
events.name: Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 6/100 Tory Street
events.long_description:
Journey through the heart of Tanzania with dishes that feel like home - comforting, bold, and full of love. This special five-course degustation is created by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, a baker who grew up in Tanzania and carries its flavours, traditions, and warmth in her heart. 
Whether it’s the warm embrace of coconut-infused stews, smoky grilled meats, or fragrant spiced rice, each course is a reminder of how food connects us. This menu brings authentic East African flavours to the table, reimagined in a modern way that feels like home. Each course is matched with a carefully selected wine to enhance the flavours of the dish. Expect generous hospitality and a setting that feels like stepping into a Tanzanian family gathering.

events.id: Disaster On Taranaki Street!-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Disaster On Taranaki Street!
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Your community needs you!
The Playful Revolution is seeking up to 25 collaborative, open-minded creators who will explore, with the guidance of geologists and Emergency Response professionals, the potential impact of a major natural hazard event in the heart of Wellington’s Central City and work together to create an educational video to help others prepare.
This 2-day workshop will be led by Alex Bonham, Sophie Jerram and Finn Ilsey-Kemp, with experience in community generation, music, social practice, performance, and local government.
Friday 8 August 10:00am-4:00pm + Saturday 9 August 2:00pm-5:30pm They are looking for actors, those with a specific interest and knowledge of emergency preparedness and Wellington apartment residents.
Preference will be given to people who can come both days.

events.id: Lunchtime Concert: Otis Prescott-Mason Solo Piano Recital-73A Kelburn Pde, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Lunchtime Concert: Otis Prescott-Mason Solo Piano Recital
events.venue: 73A Kelburn Pde, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We warmly welcome you to join us on Friday the 8th of August when Otis Prescott-Mason will give a recital of music by Franz Schubert in the Adam Concert Room. From lieder transcriptions to minuets and impromptus, the recital will conclude with Schubert’s G major piano sonata, D.894.
Otis Prescott-Mason is a pianist from Wellington and a current classical performance student at Victoria University of Wellington's New Zealand School of Music. He currently studies under Dr. Jian Liu and Professor Boris Berman;
Recently Otis was awarded 3rd prize in the National Concerto Competition. In 2022 Otis was awarded 1st prize, Best Performance of a Classical Sonata, and the Audience Choice Award at the Lewis Eady National Piano Competition. In the same year he was awarded 1st prize at the PACANZ National Piano Competition. Otis was also awarded 1st prize at the 2020 New Zealand Junior Piano Competition.
Otis is a grateful recipient of generous support from Professor Jack Richards and the Royal Over-Seas League which him to perform and study in Europe and the United States of America.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.venue: 11 Ganges Road Wellington, Wellington 6035
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: An evening with Greg Sestero | Big Shark & The Room-5 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: An evening with Greg Sestero | Big Shark & The Room
events.venue: 5 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Roxy is delighted to welcome back our Best Friend for a special double bill screening with an in-person Q&A.
This is your chance to ask Greg Sestero (Mark) anything about his experience starring in the cult classic disaster-piece THE ROOM. You can keep your stupid comments in your pocket though!
First up we have the NZ premiere of Tommy Wiseau's new feature BIG SHARK, followed by a Q&A with Greg.
We'll have a short intermission with a meet & greet in the cinema before presenting THE ROOM* on sexy 35mm. As always this will be an interactive screening. You grab your mates, we'll supply the spoons. *strictly no American footballs allowed in the theatre.
If you wish to have your photo taken with Greg, please support him by purchasing some merchandise on the night.
On top of the double feature, we've got some very cool surprises in store for you!
This one is not to be missed!
$45 tickets including both features and the Q&A.

events.venue: 11 Ganges Road Wellington, Wellington 6035
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Tony Lyall - Talking....When I Should Be Listening-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Tony Lyall - Talking....When I Should Be Listening
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.description:
To make sure he still has stories to tell he has had to put himself into more and more outrageous situations and often during these tense moments Tony thinks to himself, at least I'll get a story out of this.
Come to this show to hear what happens when you start talking when you should be listening.
He has performed 7 solo hours as part of the NZ International Comedy Festival and at the Melbourne International Comedy Festival.
Tony's MC work has taken him to various sports events around the country.
He's also a sought after corporate MC and performer, and has entertained some of the biggest companies in New Zealand.

events.id: Tea Experience: A Sensory Workshop-14 Johnston St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Tea Experience: A Sensory Workshop
events.venue: 14 Johnston St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
One of the best parts of AWHI is sitting down for a cuppa before class and chatting with your mates. Since tea is such an integral part of the studio experience, why not get a little more yoga about our tea, too?!
This workshop blends the meditative practice of mindful tea preparation and drinking with gentle breathing and sensory awareness techniques. Participants will learn to slow down, connect deeply with the present moment, and cultivate inner calm—one mindful sip at a time. Perfect for tea lovers, wellness seekers, and anyone wishing to restore balance in a busy world.
Both conventional tea and herbal tea will be available for those who are sensitive to caffeine.
Led by tea expert *Souvic Nandy*, co-founder of the Asian School of Tea, an institution with branches in India, Thailand, New Zealand and the Philippines. Souvik promotes sustainable tea tourism, encouraging travellers to experience the authenticity of tea regions while supporting ethical practices. His programs seamlessly combine tea education with a commitment to environmental conservation and cultural preservation. By connecting traditional tea artisans with modern enthusiasts, he ensures the institution remains a bridge between heritage and innovation.
Investment: $39 (includes herbal & optional black tea samples)

events.id: The Bitter Brothers-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: The Bitter Brothers
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
The Bitter Brothers are coming home!
After winding our way around the North Island in Holly Jean’s Estima, trailer in tow, from club to club in a jam-packed tour promoting our recent debut album, Daddy Was An Outlaw, we are very excited to bring it all back home and close off our tour full circle with a big party at the Voglemorn Upstairs!
We have some old favorites, some new numbers lined up for you all, and some very special surprise quests who you won’t want to miss.
And if you haven’t heard about us by now, The Bitter Brothers are a five-piece, Wellington based, southern gothic, old-time, alt-folk, alt-country musical experience.
They have banjos, accordions, violins, various guitars and voices, upright basses, drums, percussions, delightfully unexpected arrangements, tempos, and smile-inducing harmonies.

events.id: The Lounge Band @ The RSC-34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South-Facebook
events.name: The Lounge Band @ The RSC
events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South
events.long_description:
The Lounge Band brings together four seasoned musicians from Wellington’s live music scene—featuring members of Dirt Cheap, Tone Rangers @Laffare Band and Mangaweka Blues Band.


Wellington’s Lounge Band blends original songwriting with timeless covers—delivered by dynamic lead vocalists Bill Bevan and Diana Beaufort, whose contrasting styles create something truly special.
Backed by Al Fergus on bass and Paul Weaver on lead guitar, this seasoned four-piece brings heart, groove, and grit to every show.
Expect soul, harmony, and songs you know and love—done with fresh energy and real depth.

events.id: Wellington Opera's A Masked Ball / Un Ballo in Maschera-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Opera's A Masked Ball / Un Ballo in Maschera
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.description:
What truths will be revealed from behind the masks?
Three people forced to choose between their desires and their duty.
Will fate be the ultimate decider for them all?
Wellington Opera’s A Masked Ball / Un Ballo in Maschera is portrayed with fresh perspective, taking inspiration from the Diana and Actaeon myth – a poetic interpretation that binds ancient archetypes with Romantic operatic drama, reframing our central character not just as a tragic lover, but as a hunted figure - a mortal who gazes upon the divine and pays the price.
Full of glittering dance music and powerful choruses, this is Verdi at his best.

events.id: Airhorn! August 8th!-7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Airhorn! August 8th!
events.venue: 7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
WE ARE BACK!!!
After a winter sabbatical where we devoted each hour to focused meditation—getting stronger, funnier, and more magnetic on stage—the Airhorn crew is BACK to KNOCK YOUR SOCKS OFF! Come to the #1 third space in town, the Newtown Community Center, for a night of laughter, tears, and the ultra-rare laughtears!
For August we have nothing but stars, like:
- the subversive starlet LILY CATASTROPHE
- the witty and wild ALAYNE DICK
- the off-the-wall charmer MOGZ
- Wellington's prettiest power couple JAK DARLING and BOOTH THE CLOWN!
- the joker with a thousand faces ANNA MACLEAN
- the American exile ZACH MANDEVILLE
And hosting the show is the comedic piledriver LESA MACLEOD-WHITING
Let's cut the fancy talk and get to the facts: this is the best show in the flippin' country and it's all for you. Come out and have a good time!
And check out our website at https://airhorn.nz!

events.id: Cringeworthy: The 90's-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Cringeworthy: The 90's
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cringeworthy – 90s!
A high-octane explosion of ‘90s nostalgia!
Written and devised by Andrea Sanders
Produced by Beatgirl Productions
Starring Andrea Sanders, Devon Neiman, Jared Pallesen and Emma Katene
Following the success of Cringeworthy ’60s, ’70s and ’80s, this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a ‘rad’ mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.
The 90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, the swing revival (Mambo No. 5), country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as To Sir With Love, Silly Love Songs, Unchained Melody and Get Down on It (can you dig it??).
On the local scene, legends such as Crowded House, Dave Dobbyn, The Exponents, Margaret Urlich, Supergroove, True Bliss, Ardijah, South Side of Bombay and The Chills gave us heavenly pop hits that have become Kiwi classics.
In some ‘fly’ outfits, Cringeworthy – the ’90s packages the hits of the decade (including Can’t Touch This, Weather With You, Love Shack and How Bizarre) with some unforgettable fashion trends including flannel shirts, baggy jeans, tracksuits and chokers. These energetic styles are woven together with a witty narrative reflecting the lifestyle, news events and culture of the time – smelling like Teen Spirit!
What’s the time Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today. Get ready to party like its 1999!
