events.id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) Album Release Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) Album Release Tour - Te Whanganui-a-Tara
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
WITH SUPPORT FROM AMERICAN MUSCLE & RAIDEN FREEMAN (SOLO)
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.
Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality. Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.
August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.
The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.
Friday 1 August - Wunderbar, Ōhinehou
Saturday 2 August - Secret Show, Ōtepoti*
Friday 8 August - Meow, Te Whanganui a-Tara
Saturday 9 August - Whammy Bar, Tāmaki Makaurau
TICKETS ON SALE NOW FROM RINGLETS.CO.NZ
*TICKETS NOT AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE
events.description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.
Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality.
Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.
August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.
The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.

events.id: Art Exhibition - the life works of Steve Jamieson-247 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Art Exhibition - the life works of Steve Jamieson
events.venue: 247 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for a short and one-time public viewing of the life works of Steve Jamieson, which have never been seen before.
Steve passed away recently, after suffering a fall off a ladder 2 years ago. The fall left him a paraplegic along with other complications that resulted in his health slowly deteriorating.
Prior to his accident Steve painted prolifically at home for years hoping to one day have an exhibition of his works, but sadly never quite realising his goal.
Steve led a solitary and independent life, the quintessential artist’s life really and often struggled with his mental health. After his death his family have gathered nearly 80 works on canvas from his home in Karori to curate a small exhibition.
Steve studied as an industrial designer in his early years and started out painting sets for festivals and events. His illustrative landscape paintings of the coastal bays and vistas around his home in Wellington have a naive quality and a playful graphical style along with confident use of colour.
We want to honour Steve and give him the exhibition he always dreamed of having.
His daughter Emma will be in the gallery from 10am -12pm on Saturday morning and we would love it if you could visit to support Steve’s dedication to his life long art practice.
Please share this event with anyone who might like to attend.
Huge thanks to Artist 24/7 Gallery for hosting us.
Saturday 9th August / 10am-12pm
247 Riddiford St
Newtown, Wellington
(Note: a private wake in the gallery for family and friends of Steve’s is being held on Friday 8th August from 5-7pm)

events.id: August Full Moon Drumming-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: August Full Moon Drumming
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Please remember this is a ZERO WASTE and *NO ALCOHOL* community gathering.
Kia ora!
Full Moon Drumming Wellington is a registered public event with the Wellington City Council. We are a group of humans from all walks of life who gather under the full moon each month to connect through drumming and dance around the fire. This gathering is participatory, that means if you made it to the circle you are part of the circle. As in Africa, there is no audience! Everyone is invited to participate as part of the ‘chorus’ (singing/clapping), dancing, or drumming.
The event is weather permitting, we check the forecast a few days prior and aim to make a decision the day before the event, although this is not possible and sometimes we make the decision on the day. All updates are posted on the event page.
This gathering is entirely run by volunteers, if you'd like to contribute in any way please get in touch.
There are a few things that we need help with:
- FIREWOOD: Please bring dry firewood as a koha, no wood no fire! Please NOTE we DO NOT burn pallets (due to nails) or treated timber. Driftwood from nearby south coast beaches is often abundant, feel free to post or reach out if you have a vehicle and are keen to help gather firewood on the day of the event.
- BEAUTIFYING THE CIRCLE SPACE: Anyone has fairy lights, oil burners, or is keen to make some signs?
NOTE: We hold a fire permit for this event. For safety reasons we don't allow participants to feed the fire, and while is generally okay to roast some marshmallows early in the evening we don't allow the use the fire for cooking or heating food.
This is an **ALCOHOL FREE EVENT**, please help us uphold this kaupapa and remind those who are unaware and might be new to the event. As hosts we are responsible for your safety and we take that responsibility seriously, especially given that the event is authorised through both fire and event permits. Large, public, all ages gatherings require administration and logistics so please respect this and the guidelines provided.
Princess Bay is within Taputeranga Marine Reserve (https://octopus.org.nz/taputeranga-marine-reserve), we are welcomed to gather each month in this special place so let’s all make sure there is NO RUBBISH LEFT BEHIND and that we take care of the space. Dogs are NOT ALLOWED at the gathering - there are Korora (Blue Pinguins) nesting under the rocks nearby and we've had issues with dogs in the past.
Children are welcome at the fire, though, especially after dark, please make sure that all children have adult supervision, that the supervisors are aware of the children they are looking after, and that the children are aware of who is looking after them.
Feel free to bring:
- Your friends.
- Drums or any percussive instrument.
- Warm clothing; jackets and wool blankets are good.
- Something to seat on (otherwise sand is often wet)
- Drinking water.
- Food, tea to share.
- Your lovely selves.
- Fire spinning kit and fuel.
FIRE SPINNERS: Please take all precautionary safety measures and make sure to set up fire-spinning downwind from the fire circle.
PARKING: There's a parking lot a few hundred meters from the fire circle where there's also public toilets. Please also be aware of our neighbors driveway opposite the stairway and do not park directly in front of it.
CARPOOLING: If you don't have a way to get to Princess Bay, or if you have spare seats in your car, feel free to post it on the event page. The less cars driving the better.
Feel free to share the event page and send an event invite to whomever you feel would be interested, not everyone sees the notifications and advertising

events.id: West African Drum & Dance Workshop Weekend w/ Koffie Fugah (Ghana/NZ)-220 Hanson St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: West African Drum & Dance Workshop Weekend w/ Koffie Fugah (Ghana/NZ)
events.venue: 220 Hanson St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Master Drummer & Dancer from Ghana, Robert Koffie Fugah, is coming back to Wellington! WOOT! Koffie is the leader of Kadodo Music, an expert facilitator who will get everyone rocking, make beginners feel very comfortable and confident, and at the same time challenge experienced students! Koffie is a true artist in the way he leads groups, nobody gets left behind and everyone leaves with a smile on their face!
Don't miss out on this exciting chance to work with a master teacher who has a gift for making it fun and getting everyone playing and dancing beautifully together.
All are welcome, NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY, and drums are provided!
These workshops are very inclusive and will meet you where you are at for all levels and beginners are welcome, the classes labelled intermediate and open will be a little more challenging, but all are very welcome to join in and give it a go as long as you don't mind a challenge!
This is an awesome opportunity to learn from Koffie! He is brimming with positive energy and passion for his art, and knows how to have fun!
Magic will happen here!

events.id: The Photonics / Class War On The Dance Floor / Meeps-Pyramid Club, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: The Photonics / Class War On The Dance Floor / Meeps
events.venue: Pyramid Club, Wellington
events.description:
The Photonics is an optical sound project of Daniel Beban and Tim Barlow.
Taking a cue from early experiments in light and sound technology, various light emitting sources (including ultraviolet therapy torches, strobes, remote controls and regular LED and tungsten bulbs) are modulated into sound via solar panels, resulting in an immediate and direct transposition of the optical into the audible.
Sometimes dreamy, sometimes upbeat anti-capitalist anthems.
--- Meeps - Ambrosial explorations of Sound/Mind Theonomaspheres alongside analog synthesis and digital visual craftiness.
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Lunch Speaker Series-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Lunch Speaker Series
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description:
Noble Rot invites you to enjoy a relaxed lunch in style. While away your afternoon with a leisurely three-course menu as they keep the wine flowing amongst you and your friends. They've lined up two incredible guest speakers at the forefront of the wine industry to entertain you with their stories, knowledge and insights into current trends in a relaxed but intimate atmosphere. You'll wish all learning was done this way. It’s the perfect excuse to treat your friends, your mum or your date.
 
Guest Speakers & Dates:

Saturday 9th — ‘Small Region, Big Sky’
Katherine Jacobs and her husband Jeremy embarked on a dream to produce some of Martinborough’s finest wines from their special vineyard in Te Muna, and they’ve achieved great success! Katherine will speak about upcoming trends, big dreams and hidden secrets in our favourite region’s wine scene.
 
Saturday 23rd — ‘A Rosie Afternoon’ 
Enjoy the company of Rosie Finn of Neudorf Vineyards, second generation of one of New Zealand's most prestigious wineries in Nelson. You’ll have the opportunity to ask Rosie all about current trends as she combines the story of her family winery’s historic roots and its impact on the landscape of New Zealand fine wines.

One pig. One night. 

One whole pig will be broken down for a night of tacos. There are so many awesome cuts that are underrated and under used that would generally be given to animal feed.

events.id: Michelin Star to Martinborough-Union Square, 10 Memorial Square-WOAP
events.name: Michelin Star to Martinborough
events.venue: Union Square, 10 Memorial Square
events.long_description:
Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.

Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.

events.venue: Ernesto's Cocina Cubana, 1 Grey Street
events.long_description:
Step into Pleasuredome, Ernesto’s bold, immersive dining experience where curiosity is encouraged, connection is celebrated, and playful fun is on the menu. From the moment you arrive, you’ll be welcomed with a glass of bubbles or a cheeky cocktail and swept into a sultry, tropical setting pulsing with warm beats and even warmer vibes. Charming MC Melody Thomas from The Good Sex Project will set the tone for an evening that blends aphrodisiac-inspired dining with deliciously daring entertainment.

Across the night, dive into a three-course feast, a refreshingly honest Q&A on love and intimacy hosted by Melody, and a few surprises - including a sex toy spotlight and the wildly entertaining vibrator races. With interactive moments, table icebreakers, and a pop-up “After Dark” shop, Pleasuredome is sexy, smart, and seriously fun. Come solo, with mates, or your main squeeze...just bring an open mind.

Entrée will tease the appetite with oysters or a velvet tofu kiss
Main course will be rich and indulgent - prime beef fillet, or snapper with luscious beurre blanc, or soul warming and decadent vegetable curry. 
Dessert will be your sweet climax - chocolate fondue and a Bohemian chocolate heart to take home.

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.name: Padi Rescue Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
The Rescue Diver course is the perfect opportunity for you to develop your personal self-rescue dive skills, help tired divers, administer first aid and rescue distressed divers, under the guidance of your PADI Instructor.
The Rescue Diver will start you looking differently at diving, being more aware of the divers around you as well your own safety and dive gear.
PADI Rescue Diver Course Information: Digital Theory – PADI Rescue Diver eLearning or tablet course (about 11 hours) Full Weekend – Practical rescue skills and scenarios in the pool and open water Prerequisites: PADI Advanced Open Water Diver certification or Adventure Diver with Navigation (or qualifying certification from another agency) 12 Years of age or older What To Bring: Diver Medical | Participant Questionnaire (completed in the last 12 months).
Other languages – click here Your PADI Advanced Open Water Diver card or Adventure Diver with Navigation Your eLearning completion form First Aid & CPR certificate (can be taught in conjunction with the course) Swimming costume and towel, plus your dive gear.
Courses are normally once every 3 months through-out the year or by demand.

Computers, Monitors, Tablets and Small Devices, Laptops, Routers and Modems, Mice, Servers, UPS, Cameras, Hifi Stereo Amps and Speakers, Mobile Phones, Car Batteries, Wiring & Cabling, Mainframe Circuit Boards, etc.

Master Drummer & Dancer from Ghana, Robert Koffie Fugah, is coming back to Wellington! WOOT! Koffie is the leader of Kadodo Music, an expert facilitator who will get everyone rocking, make beginners feel very comfortable and confident, and at the same time challenge experienced students! Koffie is a true artist in the way he leads groups, nobody gets left behind and everyone leaves with a smile on their face!

Don't miss out on this exciting chance to work with a master teacher who has a gift for making it fun and getting everyone playing and dancing beautifully together.

All are welcome, NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY, and drums are provided!

These workshops are very inclusive and will meet you where you are at for all levels and beginners are welcome, the classes labelled intermediate and open will be a little more challenging, but all are very welcome to join in and give it a go as long as you don't mind a challenge!

This is an awesome opportunity to learn from Koffie! He is brimming with positive energy and passion for his art, and knows how to have fun!
Magic will happen here!

events.id: Do It Yourself Framing-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Do It Yourself Framing
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
Bring along a painting and a suitable frame, either a cheapo from Briscoes or a good second hand frame.
We will provide the tools and matt board.
What’s included in this workshop: - Demonstration of the steps to framing your work - assembling the tools you need - choosing and cleaning frames - how to size and cut an acid free mat - what sort of tapes to use for each task - various fixings for hanging and D-rings - replacing acid leaching materials with foam board - cutting techniques - making and attaching labels and swing tags - how to photograph your art Hands-on session where you will learn to cut card, cut a window in the matt board, present, secure, tape, screw in D-ring, tie knots etc All materials will be provided including knives, metal ruler, cutting board, crescent board for the mat, mat cutter, tape, d-ring, string.
What to bring along: - your artwork to frame - a suitable frame for the artwork A4 or smaller - enthusiasm!
Thirty-minute lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

events.id: NEW DATE: Wellington: Makara Wetland Planting Day-590 Makara Rd, Makara, Wellington 6972, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: NEW DATE: Wellington: Makara Wetland Planting Day
events.venue: 590 Makara Rd, Makara, Wellington 6972, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The A Rocha planting day scheduled for 12 July at Makara has been postponed to 9 August due to the rain and wind forecast for the day.
-------------
A combined A Rocha Wellington planting day is to be held on 9 Aug at the wetland at Makara that we have been working on over the last couple of planting seasons.
The Regional Council have supplied a further 310 plants and 100 plants have come from the Makaracarpa group, so that’s 410 plants in total. The planting site is well prepared, and much of it is flat, with easy planting conditions (if a little damp
).
Details are:
Date: 9 August
Address: Joan and Bruce’s place, 590 Makara Road, Karori
Start time: 10 am. We will try and get all the trees in before lunch! That may be “aspirational” – so if you can stay on for a bit after lunch, there may be a bit more to do.
Lunch: a BBQ will be on site, please bring whatever you want to cook on the BBQ. If you are able to bring something else that goes with a winter BBQ to share, that would be great.
Clothes and tools: wear old warm clothes that you don't mind getting dirty, a raincoat in case of the odd shower, gumboots and gardening gloves. Bring your own spade if you have one.
Parking: the bridge onto the property is no longer considered safe for vehicles, so please park on the Makara Rd side of the bridge, off the driveway itself. There is space for 3 or 4 cars there so if its full, please leave your tools and passengers at the parking area, and park at Makara School at 399 Makara Road. You can either walk down, or text or ring me for a shuttle service (021 902 342).
RSVP please: Please RSVP at my email address ti.parminter@xtra.co.nz if you are planning to come along.
------------------
Photo: Megan Martin | DOC

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

events.name: Sculpt the City: Explore Risk and Resilience in clay
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Get hands-on with air-dry clay as we reimagine Wellington’s CBD at scale.
In this collaborative workshop, we’ll explore how we think about natural hazard risk and resilience—through shape, texture, and place.
By treating the city as a model we can mold, you’ll gain new insights into scale, design, and the ways we interpret our shared environment.
No experience is needed—just bring your curiosity, your observational eye, and a willingness to work with others.
She also shares her work and that of her collaborators and students in the SpatialThink Lab on Instagram.

events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:

The aim of the self portrait is to observe ourselves and convey what we see, or how we want to be seen.
In this course you will learn: - How to paint the structure of the head and neck - How to mix skin tones - How to describe light and shade for volume - How to convey expression in painting a portrait -The importance of the interaction of background and foreground This course is for all levels You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

events.id: Open Dance term three.-Te Whaea, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Open Dance term three.
events.venue: Te Whaea, 11 Hutchison Rd, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and join the WIDance team as we slide, bounce, wiggle, roll, and slide into term three, 2025!
Whether you're a seasoned dancer or a beginner, our classes are designed to be accessible and engaging for all skill levels.
WIDance offers a safe and inclusive space to find joy and laughter through movement, nurturing our creative curiosity through contemporary dance, improvisation, dance-based games, and composition. These activities enhance body and space awareness while fostering social connections through movement.
Our technique exercises are based on UK based Stopgap Dance company's IRIS syllabus.
"IRIS is an inclusive dance syllabus that gives teachers a framework to develop the disabled dancers of tomorrow. It is a consolidation of Stopgap’s experience of training professional disabled dancers, and it contains tried and tested methods that the company has been developing since 1995.
IRIS is divided into four levels: Include, Respond, Integrate and Specialise, each having its own set exercises, guidelines and assessments. IRIS will give disabled children and young people the same level of structure, balance and rigour of dance education as their non-disabled peers and provide the opportunity to accumulate skills and experiences necessary for the professional industry".
Term 3 runs for 6 weeks, on the following dates:
Saturday: 11 am to 1 pm (from August 9th to September 13th).
Cost: $120 waged. $85 unwaged
New option: Technique class only, 11am to 12pm, $60.
To book:
Email: sumara@widance.nz
Phone: 021 0501565
Direct Link to booking form: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLScKhyKKxMt.../viewform...
This project is proudly supported by Wellington City Council.
Who are we?

events.venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
events.description:
Kua raranga tahi tātou he whariki mō āpōpō Together we weave the mat for future generations Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga wānanga (classes).
- Three hour weaving class with experienced kaiako - Access to tools and harakeke - Harakeke is provided for your first two classes and then the tikanga is that you should hauhake (harvest) for yourself.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have a $20 ‘Please harvest for me’ option in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
Important information - It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia - At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable - For tikanga purposes beginner ticket sales close two days before wānanga giving us time to hauhake (harvest) for you - If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class - We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
Teina - General - $25 Teina - Concession - $15 Teina - Koha - $7 Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $50.00 Optional - ADD ON - Please harvest for me: $10 (10 rau only) after first two classes - 3 days notice required Note: Eventfinda fees apply Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting - We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust.

events.name: Death Cafe Newtown
events.venue: 7A Rintoul St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Death Cafe runs monthly on the 2nd Saturday.
Let's normalise our own demise! We are all going to die, let's talk about it. At a Death Café people - often strangers - gather to eat cake, drink tea and discuss death. Death Café is not a grief support group, or counselling session - instead it is a place to discuss death without expectations. The objective is 'to increase awareness of death with a view to helping people make the most of their (finite) lives'.
For more information about Death Cafes generally, check deathcafe.com
For any pātai about this Death Cafe, email info@newtowncommunity.org.nz / call 04 389 4786

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course This course is free for NZ citizens and residents (aged 16 years+).
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $199 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.

events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Award-winning authors Jenny Pattrick and Mandy Hager explore the craft and challenges of writing stories set in the past—both the recent and more distant.

events.venue: Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Cantharis Alpacas offer guided walks with alpacas in the hills above the Kapiti Coast, conveniently located just 45 kms North of Wellington and just North of the new motorway.
During this unique experience you can learn about these beautiful creatures, and you will have ample time to meet, get close, walk, enjoy a cuddle and hand feed the alpacas.
On the way up and at the top you can also catch the stunning views of the Kapiti Coast, Kapiti Island, the South Island (on clear days) and beyond.
Ensure you have your camera ready to take photos and “selfies” of you and the alpacas.

It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.

events.id: Exhibition Celebration - Adrift by Sarah Hume-Inverlochy House, 3 Inverlochy Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Exhibition Celebration - Adrift by Sarah Hume
events.venue: Inverlochy House, 3 Inverlochy Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Inverlochy Art School warmly invites you to celebrate Sarah Hume's solo exhibition of paintings in the IAS Community Gallery.
Please join us for refreshments and the opportunity to meet the artist and hear more about her beautiful work.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Paintings in this exhibition showcase the range of Hume's expansive painting practice, from landscapes and water to the animal kingdom. Her artwork is characterised by close observation, focusing on depth, colour and light. "{I am} inspired by the organic shapes and colours in nature: the flowing movement of water, the twisted stems of plants, and the shifting patterns of light".
Also included in this exhibition are artworks created while on an artist retreat in Sicily, adding desert golds and browns to her usual palette of calming greens and blues.

events.name: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Wellington Composers
events.venue: St Paul's Church, 1 Langdale Ave, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Then we move into works by people we’ve sung with, worked with, and deeply admire.
Our director Eric Sidoti brings a new arrangement of a song by Six60, adding a fresh and familiar note to the evening.
Thomas sang in the choir at a previous concert and has accompanied some of our rehearsals, and now we’re performing his Mass with the largest choir to present it to date.
It’s a bold, expressive work that shows the depth and versatility of a composer equally at home performing, conducting, and writing music.
These are works we believe in, and we can’t wait to share them with you.

events.id: NZ Species Edit-a-thon 2025-150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: NZ Species Edit-a-thon 2025
events.venue: 150 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
As the internet is increasingly taken over by sponsored posts and AI-generated content, Wikipedia remains steadfast as a source of verifiable, up-to-date information.
All are welcome – whether you’re a complete newbie or have experience editing – take this opportunity to develop your skills while contributing to the world's most comprehensive encyclopedia.
We'll provide all the training and resources you need to get started, and the native vegetation of Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush will provide the perfect location for collaborating with fellow nature enthusiasts to share our unique biodiversity with the world.
Whether you want to come along for just one day, or book in for both, we’re looking forward to having you join us.
You can also come by car and park in the main public car park on Wilton Road or along Churchill Drive.

events.long_description:
Wellington, get ready! It’s been a minute!
Fresh off a sold-out show in Auckland, Niko Ne Zna returns to the capital for a night of explosive Balkan brass at Vogelmorn Hall.
Expect bold brass, infectious rhythms, soaring vocals, and a dancefloor that won’t quit. This nine-piece powerhouse delivers their signature high-energy performance — featuring brand new songs in preparation for their upcoming third studio album, as well as all the hits you know and love.
Two powerful sets of Niko Ne Zna Balkan brass inspired music
Delicious food available
Cash bar featuring local beers from Kererū Brewing, as well as wine and spirits from the Balkans
A party like no other!
With trumpets, saxophone, trombones, sousaphone, tapan (bass drum), snare drum, percussion, and vocals in multiple languages, Niko Ne Zna blends hypnotic melodies, driving rhythms, and theatrical flair into an unforgettable live experience. Whether on the street, in a club, or on a festival stage, their shows are part gig, part spectacle — all heart.
They’ve wowed crowds at WOMAD, featured in What We Do In The Shadows, and played to packed houses across New Zealand and Australia.
Come early, grab a bite, enjoy a Kererū brew, and be part of something special.
Doors at 6pm.
“It’s like being dropped into the hot and spicy lands of a faraway country.” — wellingtonlivemusic.com
“Straight to the dancefloor.” — Elsewhere
“Driving rhythms, an intoxicating effect.” — Taranaki Daily News
www.nikonezna.com

events.id: Night of the Full Moon-40 Salamanca Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Night of the Full Moon
events.venue: 40 Salamanca Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Embrace your inner lycanthrope this August as we celebrate the final full moon of winter.
Enjoy a warming night of deep listening, moon movement, mask making, and group howling!
This evening event features a variety of lunar activities, including ambient listening under the Moon Dome, guided movements with Kaia Hawkins of Manahau Embodied Movement, mask-making, and group howling. Set your intentions with moon journaling, and enjoy a cup of lunar tea.
Weather permitting, we’ll be able to moongaze through the telescopes.
This event is part of Takurua Hauora: Winter Wellness, a Wellington event series promoting health and wellbeing inspired by Sir Mason Durie’s Whare Tapa Whā model.
Seated options are available for guided Movements with Kaia Hawkins.
Saturday 9 August | 7pm – 10pm | Space Place
Spaces are limited. Booking is essential.
https://www.museumswellington.org.nz/night-of-the-full-moon/

events.id: Homegrown Road Trip Wellington: Hori Shaw, Shane Walker, Te Wehi-69 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Homegrown Road Trip Wellington: Hori Shaw, Shane Walker, Te Wehi
events.venue: 69 Courtenay Pl, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT
Some of today’s most exciting homegrown talents are heading on tour – Hori Shaw and Shane Walker, with support from Te Wehi, are heading to 10 Kiwi towns and cities this winter.
The tour, the Homegrown Road Trip, will head to Gisborne, Whakatāne, Tauranga, Kaitaia, Hamilton, Rotorua, Napier, Palmerston, New Plymouth and Wellington over four weekends in June, July and August.
Hori Shaw, Shane Walker and Te Wehi are arguably three of the most popular Kiwi artists in music right now, with all three taking the top three spots on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles Chart. Te Wehi’s cover of Allen Stone’s Unaware; Hori Shaw’s Back in My Arms; and Shane Walker’s Coasty Girl have all reached number one on the charts and are currently charted at 1, 2 and 3.
Now, all three are joining forces for the Homegrown Road Trip.
Homegrown Road Trip is Hori Shaw’s first headline tour in NZ, and with hearty supporters for all three artists all around Aotearoa, these shows are all highly anticipated.
Homegrown Road Trip Tour dates:
Thursday, June 26: Gisborne – Sugar Bar.
Friday, June 27: Whakatāne – Boiler Room.
Saturday, June 28: Tauranga – Rusty’s.
Thursday, July 3: Kaitaia – Awanui Hotel.
Friday, July 4: Auckland – Darby St Station.
Saturday, July 5: Hamilton – The Factory.
Thursday, July 31: Rotorua – Social Club.
Friday, August 1: Napier – Cabana Bar.
Saturday, August 2: Palmerston North – Royal Hotel.
Friday, August 8: New Plymouth – Crowded House
Saturday, August 9: Wellington – The Grand

events.id: The Photonics / Class War on the Dance Floor / Meeps-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Photonics / Class War on the Dance Floor / Meeps
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Photonics is an optical sound project of Daniel Beban and Tim Barlow. Taking a cue from early experiments in light and sound technology, various light emitting sources (including ultraviolet therapy torches, strobes, remote controls and regular LED and tungsten bulbs) are modulated into sound via solar panels, resulting in an immediate and direct transposition of the optical into the audible.
---
Class War on the Dance Floor is the solo project of Marika Pratley inspired by trance 80s synth pop and contemporary hip hop, using the Deluge. Sometimes dreamy, sometimes upbeat anti-capitalist anthems.
---
Meeps - Ambrosial explorations of Sound/Mind Theonomaspheres alongside analog synthesis and digital visual craftiness.

$15 presales via Under the Radar
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.venue: 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro , Wellington
events.long_description:
Get Ready for Greed of Biblical Proportions!
The wigs are high, the heels are higher, and the stakes? Sky. Damn. High.
For one night only, get ready for an unmissable drag spectacular as drag royalty Mandy Moobs and Olivia Dreams—sensations from Drag Race Down Under—return to the spotlight for their most unfiltered, unapologetic, and unhinged live show yet.
From the werkroom to stages around NZ & Australia, these two queens have snatched wigs, broken hearts, and carved their names into drag her-story! Now they’re back where they belong: in the club, in your face, and ready to turn the party like only they can.
Whether you're a die-hard Drag Race stan, a lover of all things fabulous, or just someone who appreciates a strong contour and a stronger cocktail, this is the night you don't want to miss.
Come for the Moobs. Stay for the Dreams. Leave forever changed.
This is Moobs & Dreams: LIVE AND UNFILTERED.
One night. Two queens. Zero chill.
M&G Doors Open: 8:30PM
GA Doors Open: 9:00PM
*Meet & Greet ticket holders will receive 1x photo included in the ticket price and have access to preferential seating before General Admission doors open.

Joining me on the night is a very special guest - Dan Aikido aka Martin Kwok, is an Emmy award-winning sound editor, music obsessive and DJ based in Wellington.
Part of the legendary Jewel School crew, he is a true “DJs DJ” - deep crates, impeccable taste and serious skills.
There will be Disco - There will be Boogie – There will be Broken Beat - There will be Garage and House.
There will be a red light - there will be a smoke machine and there will be a disco ball.
Get ready to feel the music - Saturday 9 August @ San Fran

events.id: Speed Dial-154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Speed Dial
events.venue: 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
An apocalypse has hit us. In the desolate aftermath, where shattered skyscrapers claw at a poisoned sky, a new kind of war is brewing. Forget the old world; this is a battle for the now. A coded signal crackles through the static – "Speed Dial," the ultimate gathering.
This isn't a tale of heroes; it's the gritty reality of survival. The venue? A hidden space where the best DJs from the remnants of society converge. These aren't just DJs; they're sonic warriors, armed with tracks that defy the decay and ignite the night.
The stage is set: a makeshift platform, illuminated by flickering fires and a Cage to keep the animals. Here, the scavengers of 140, 160 and 170 unite. Their mission: to drop beats shake the ruins, turning the wasteland into a dance floor.
Lineup:
-Dons
-Magazine
-Kensington Collective
-Manor
-OffGrid
-Pearly & Clova

events.id: Unfolding Ft. Eli Høff-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Unfolding Ft. Eli Høff
events.venue: MOON, Wellington
events.description:
Cable Management brings you Unfolding, our debut gig where we couldn’t be more happy to share the sounds that move us—techno for your mind and body.
Expect evolving BPMs, genre hybrids, and a night that explores deep into the dark, hypnotic and underground.
It all started because we wanted to hear Eli Høff live—one of Aotearoa’s most exciting producers of deep, intricate and compelling techno, built for altered states.
Plus ikona happens to be dropping his latest EP soon and it all just came together.
We’re all about crisp, full-bodied sound, so we’ve teamed up with the legendary Tub’s Audio to deliver, backed by crystalline visuals from Vision Chips and Catalyst.

events.id: KOHA SUNDAY YOGA - Heated Flow-34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: KOHA SUNDAY YOGA - Heated Flow
events.venue: 34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us EVERY Sunday for a 90 minute Heated Flow for koha entry (ie, give what you can)! Proceeds are donated to a different charitable organisation each month that's committed to supporting the wellbeing of Aotearoa!
This weekly class is open to everyone, regardless of yoga experience - haere mai!
BYO mat or hire for $2; towels available for $3 and make sure to bring a big water bottle!
To book: Download the AWHI app to view the timetable, or simply show up in good time on Sunday!
WHAT IS 'KOHA'? Koha loosely translates to 'gift' or exchange. In other words, pay what you can for the class!
For more information about our studio, visit our website at awhiyoga.co.nz

events.id: Manawa Karioi Working Bees-7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Manawa Karioi Working Bees
events.venue: 7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities. We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery. We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates. A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.
Meeting at the Information Shelter in the Tapu te Ranga Marae car park at the end of Danube Street in Island Bay. Children are welcome with parents or guardians.

events.id: The Little High Tea Soiree-Anam Cara Gardens, 150 Rangiuru Road-WOAP
events.name: The Little High Tea Soiree
events.venue: Anam Cara Gardens, 150 Rangiuru Road
events.long_description:
The award-winning Ōtaki Kids Market's High Tea party will be a fun-filled treat, packed with all the delicious goodies you'd expect from a classic high tea just with extra cuteness. Created by tamariki and rangatahi from the Ōtaki Kids Market and overseen by local chef Lucinda Caldwell from Seriously Pickled Catering Co., it features a selection of teas, a refreshing mocktail on arrival, and a tempting mix of sweet and savoury delights - from finger sandwiches to delicious slices and cupcakes. Hosted at the beautiful Anam Cara Gardens in Ōtaki, you'll enjoy music from “Pretty Boys” a popular young duo, and be able to enjoy a walk around the beautiful gardens and play garden games after your high tea.
(Please note, food may vary slightly from the photograph supplied)

events.id: Italian House Party-Boulcott Street Bistro, 99 Boulcott St-WOAP
events.name: Italian House Party
events.venue: Boulcott Street Bistro, 99 Boulcott St
events.long_description:
Get ready for an unforgettable Italian experience, join the Boulcott Street Bistro team at Plimmer House for a lively afternoon filled with indulgent flavours, history, and great company. From Midday, they'll be serving up a mouthwatering family-style shared Italian feast, featuring classic dishes and hearty flavours that celebrate the best of Italian cuisine.

But that’s not all...experience the fascinating history of the great Italian cocktail - the Negroni - as they take you on a journey through its iconic evolution, offering you a chance to sip on different versions of this classic cocktail along the way. Pair it all with Italian wines, refreshing Limoncello, and other delicious Italian treats that will have you feeling like you’ve been transported to Italy.

So gather your friends for an afternoon of feasting, sipping, and celebrating. It’s the perfect way to embrace the Italian spirit, in true style, all while enjoying a great time together!

events.id: Tales of Thai Treasures-Khao Soi, 3/100 Tory Street-WOAP
events.name: Tales of Thai Treasures
events.venue: Khao Soi, 3/100 Tory Street
events.long_description:
Immerse yourself in the rich heritage of Thailand through its traditional sweets, where each bite tells a story steeped in centuries of culture. From the golden elegance of Thong Yod to the rich, caramelised flavour of Khanom Mo Kaeng, these desserts are more than just treats, they are pieces of history.

This curated tasting experience invites you to explore delicate handmade desserts that capture the essence of Thailand’s culinary legacy. Savour savoury bites like Chor Muang and Crystal Prawn Rolls, each meticulously crafted to highlight the vibrant flavours of Thai cuisine. To complement this exquisite selection, specially chosen teas will be served, enhancing the flavours and creating a harmonious balance for your palate.

As you indulge, enjoy a live traditional Thai dance performance, bringing the culture to life in a visually captivating way. The combination of food, dance, and narration creates a fully immersive experience, offering not just a taste of Thailand, but a true journey into its heart and soul.

Whether you're a seasoned foodie or new to Thai cuisine, this event offers an unforgettable opportunity to connect with the cultural richness of Thailand through its most iconic sweets and traditions.

events.id: Mid-Winter Christmas Feast-Oikos Hellenic Cuisine, 382 Broadway-WOAP
events.name: Mid-Winter Christmas Feast
events.venue: Oikos Hellenic Cuisine, 382 Broadway
events.long_description: Indulge in a Mid-Winter Christmas Feast, Oikos style. With a warm rakomelo on arrival (a traditional Greek alcoholic winter drink), take a seat at the table, graze the afternoon away with some Oikos Christmas favourites, and you will leave merry and full of enough cheer to kick the winter blues. This will be everything you would expect of a Christmas day feast (with a unique Oikos spin of course). Home smoked salmon, slow roasted lamb and a secret family stuffing recipe will be just a few things to fill the family style shared table. Finish with figgy toffee pudding and maybe a carol or two.

events.id: Maille Sunday Kai-Cuba Street Tavern, 172 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: Maille Sunday Kai
events.venue: Cuba Street Tavern, 172 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Walk-ins only between 1-4pm. Bookings available from 4pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.

events.id: Fondue Love Affair-Karla Marie Ceramics, G02/111 Dixon Street-WOAP
events.name: Fondue Love Affair
events.venue: Karla Marie Ceramics, G02/111 Dixon Street
events.long_description:
The Fondue Love Affair is a story in two parts, and full of heat, heart, and handmade magic. It begins in the colourful, art-filled studio of Karla Marie Ceramics (3rd or 10th of August), where you will be guided through a playful clay session to design and hand-build your very own fondue sets. With sweet treats and refreshments on hand, award-winning ceramicist Karla Marie will help you shape a vessel, crafted with care, and made to be shared. 

Two weeks later (17th or 24th August), the story continues with a candlelit chocolate fondue tasting hosted by Wellington’s beloved Barron Hasselhoff’s. You will return to see your glazed and fired creations unveiled, now ready to be filled with warm, flowing chocolate. A luscious fondue bar awaits, featuring locally made milk, dark, and white chocolate alongside an indulgent spread of unexpected dippables—think fruit, marshmallows, cookies, and flavour twists like chilli, sea salt, or rosemary.

Price covers two sessions per event:
Event 1: Sunday 3 August + Sunday 17 August
Event 2: Sunday 10 August + Sunday 24 August

events.id: Embroidered Leaves: An Arts & Crafts inspired workshop-25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Embroidered Leaves: An Arts & Crafts inspired workshop
events.venue: 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this embroidery class seasoned embroiderer Cathrine Lloyd will guide you through a series of stitches to complete a beautiful leaf design. Inspired by the wallpaper found on the walls of Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, embellish this design with beads, sequins and beautiful threads. Whether you're an experienced stitcher or a newcomer to embroidery, this class offers the perfect opportunity for you to express your love for nature and the style of the Arts and Crafts movement.
Morning tea and all materials provided except those noted below. This class will be followed by our monthly Stitching Circle from 2pm, so feel free to bring your lunch and stay on for the Stitching Circle.
Beginners are very welcome.
What to bring: sharp embroidery scissors, a 8-inch hoop. The fabric will be cut for this size hoop only. You can buy a hoop for $15 from the tutor at the start of the class if you don’t have one.
Please note: The class will take place upstairs.

events.description: -Learn about our innovative Bubble Tech Triple Cone Orgonite Technology and how you can use it to create a positive impact on your health, wellbeing, consciousness and Humanity -Delve into the importance of Structured Water and its profound impact on all living things and Mother Earth -A deep dive into Tensor Technology: working with copper and sacred geometry to create life force energy to impact nature and increase your own wellbeing Finally you'll discover how the combination of these technologies will empower you to make a lasting impact on yourself and the world around you.

events.id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique.
This is an excellent opportunity for a best friends' Sunday morning or a self-care session for yourself!
In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects.
Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.
Then there’s a week break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast.

events.id: The Pines Market-50 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: The Pines Market
events.venue: 50 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington’s must-attend winter event is back — The Pines Market returns to Houghton Bay!
This Winter, join us at the stunning Pines venue, perched above the coastline, for a market experience like no other. Soak in breathtaking ocean views, enjoy a warm and welcoming vibe, and explore an eclectic mix of local art, handcrafted goods, lush plants, and one-of-a-kind treasures — all lovingly created by Wellington’s most talented makers and artists.
Whether you're hunting for a unique gift, wanting to treat yourself, or just looking for a great day out, The Pines Market is your winter wonderland of creativity and community spirit.
Expect:
Handcrafted jewellery
Unique art & design pieces
Beautiful plants & seedlings
Thoughtfully made crafts & homeware
Plenty of surprises around every corner!
Most stalls accept EFTPOS, but bringing some cash is a good idea too!
This isn't just a market — it’s a destination. Come for the shopping, stay for the atmosphere, and leave inspired.
Don’t miss The Pines Market — the ultimate winter gathering for lovers of all things local, creative, and beautiful. We’ll see you there!

events.id: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
A story runs through it -What is the voice that mobilises readers?
Research explains why certain forms of storytelling are especially effective at leaving readers with the desire to act on ideas.
If you want readers to walk with you into issues that are important to you, this is your chance to find out how.
Marilyn will share some evidence regarding effective voice and content, along with suggestions to apply the research.
You’ll read a few samples and have time to jot down and discuss your own starting points.

events.name: The Waikanae Beach Indoor Market
events.venue: Waikanae Beach Community Hall, 22a Rauparaha St, Waikanae
events.description:

Natural Honey, Sewing Craft, Woodwork, Art, jewellery, up-cycled and re-purposed items and lots lots more.
Bring the Kids along so they can meet local author Michael Peryer and view his latest Children's Adventure Books.
Jane will be also be there with her hand made Crochet Toys along with Helen and her hand made Children's Dress Ups and Dolls Clothes etc Meet up with Family and Friends and enjoy a day out on the Kapiti Coast and visit this great friendly Community Market then spend the rest of the day at other events and attractions including a visit to our great cafes.
Don't miss it... support local!

events.id: Twisted Rings for Winter-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Twisted Rings for Winter
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver!
Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then how to form it up into a ring that fits you.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.
Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

events.id: Winter Natural Textured Rings - August-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Winter Natural Textured Rings - August
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
:-) Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!
Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools.
Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

events.id: Winter Textured Rings - Wellington-65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Winter Textured Rings - Wellington
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special!
Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!
Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.
Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
Workshop fee is $128, Early bird pricing $115 (ends 13 July).

events.id: Your Story, Your Way: Writing your life-19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Your Story, Your Way: Writing your life
events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Everyone has a story worth telling — including you.
In this interactive workshop, you'll explore simple, engaging ways to begin writing your life story.
Whether you're looking to record memories for your family, reflect on your journey, or eventually publish a memoir, Gigi Fenster will help you take the first step.
No writing experience required — just bring your memories and a willingness to explore.
Limited places – secure your spot now!

events.id: Being in Print: Publishing Perspectives-289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Being in Print: Publishing Perspectives
events.venue: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
A panel discussing indie, professional and self publishing.
Traditionally published YA fantasy author Katharine J. Adams, self-published romance writer Leanna Morgan and indie-author Anne Ingram chat about their experiences in the publishing industry.
Learn why they chose to pursue their specific publishing pathway and the pros and cons of each.
Participants will gain insight to the different modes of the publishing industry – traditional, independent, self-publishing – and have the opportunity to ask questions.
Our thanks to NZSA Wellington Branch for sponsoring this event.

events.id: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā-Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā
events.venue: Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Ruri' is one word for a 'short love ditty, poem or jingle'.
Rongoā is most often understood as being healing or medicinal.
Ruri Rongoā is about being together, about connection with each other and in this case, having some fun with language itself.
At this session we'll spend time reading poems by awesome queer rangatahi, then we will write a couple ourselves -- one on our own, and one together as a group.
Suitable for ages 15-20.

events.description:
The award-winning Ōtaki Kids Market's High Tea party will be a fun-filled treat, packed with all the delicious goodies you'd expect from a classic high tea just with extra cuteness.
Created by tamariki and rangatahi from the Ōtaki Kids Market and overseen by local chef Lucinda Caldwell from Seriously Pickled Catering Co., it features a selection of teas, a refreshing mocktail on arrival, and a tempting mix of sweet and savoury delights - from finger sandwiches to delicious slices and cupcakes.
Hosted at the beautiful Anam Cara Gardens in Ōtaki, you'll enjoy music from “Pretty Boys” a popular young duo, and be able to enjoy a walk around the beautiful gardens and play garden games after your high tea.

events.description:
Divert from your usual narrative with a writing task aimed to rouse the imagination and create new pathways to venture toward.

Join Natala Gwiazdzinski for some fun stepping out of your writing comfort zone and maybe even surprise yourself at the unexpected direction you take.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC–Raki Māori Constituency-In-studio-84 Aorangi Street Feilding, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4702-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC–Raki Māori Constituency-In-studio
events.venue: 84 Aorangi Street Feilding, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4702
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: WPF presents Pride (2014) - the film-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: WPF presents Pride (2014) - the film
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our film fundraisers continue on 10 August with Pride, a story of grassroots activism and solidarity.
Based on a true story, it depicts a group queer activists who raised funds to help families affected by the British miners' strike in 1984.
In line with the movie’s themes of stronger together, we will be hosted by Two/Fiftyseven, a venue creating inclusive, community-focused impact by making space accessible and bringing people together.
Make an afternoon of it! There'll be an intermission, with free cups of tea and home baking for sale, plus a ‘Bread and Roses’ singalong. Can it get any more wholesome?
The movie's rated M, so while it's recommended for mature audiences aged 16 and over, anyone may join us. The rating is due to language, sexual references and some drug use.
TICKETS
- $15 waged
- $10 unwaged
- Companion tickets for disabled people are free.
Pride and Pride (2014) is for everyone, so if ticket price is a barrier for you, please get in touch and we’ll sort you out.
ACCESSIBILTY
- Two/Fiftyseven is fully wheelchair accessible
- Bathrooms are gender neutral, and include baby-changing facilities
- We’ll screen the movie with closed captions
- Seating is in your choice of sturdy armless chairs, bleachers, and squabs
- Two/Fiftyseven has really great airflow along with vents to the outside. You are very welcome to wear a mask.

Step into the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse this winter and enjoy a cozy afternoon of creativity. In this guided watercolour workshop, you’ll learn to paint a charming still life of seasonal gourds and winter produce, using techniques to capture texture, form, and gentle winter light.
Nestled among the garden’s winter blooms, the glasshouse provides the perfect haven to paint, sip, and relax. Enjoy a comforting bowl of homemade pumpkin soup, crusty bread, and a glass of mulled wine as you create. No experience needed- just bring your curiosity and a love of colour.
Date & Time: Sunday 10th August | 1-4pm
Location: 1023 Longbush Road, Longbush 5884
(20 min scenic drive from Martinborough)
Price: $129

Join illustrator and designer, Emma Weakley and children's book author Joanne Welch as they chat all things illustration and design from their respective wealth of industry experiences.
Limited places - book your ticket now!
Our thanks to NZSA Wellington Branch for sponsoring this event.

events.id: Pinehaven Party - Streamside Celebration-Pinehaven Rd, Upper Hutt-Facebook

events.long_description:

BYO picnic encouraged, BBQ/bake sale fundraiser for local community group pending

events.id: Planting and Track Maintenance - Working Bee-Manawa Karioi Reserve, Danube Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Planting and Track Maintenance - Working Bee
events.venue: Manawa Karioi Reserve, Danube Street, Wellington
events.description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities.
We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery.
We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates.
A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.

events.id: Miramar Maupuia community centre Raranga-Motu Kairangi Te Kohanga Reo, 27 Chelsea St, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Miramar Maupuia community centre Raranga
events.venue: Motu Kairangi Te Kohanga Reo, 27 Chelsea St, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Miramar & Maupuia Community Centre, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:30pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

events.name: Monthly Stitching Circle
events.venue: 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bring whatever you're working on (it can be knitting, crochet, embroidery, cross stitch, mending - anything crafty!) and join us on the second Sunday of the month (February to November) for a casual session of sociable stitching hosted by the Wellington Embroiderers' Guild.
Each session runs from 2pm to 4pm, but as an informal event you are welcome to arrive late or leave early. Please note the session will be held in an upstairs room, for more information about accessibility at the house, see this page of our website.
Tea and coffee provided. Suggested donation $5; free for Friends of Katherine Mansfield House & Garden and Wellington Embroiderers' Guild members.

events.id: My Kāpiti: Speak Your Story-59 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: My Kāpiti: Speak Your Story
events.venue: 59 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.description:
Calling all rangatahi aged 13–18!
Join acclaimed poet and performer Te Kahu Rolleston for a dynamic 1.5-hour workshop where you’ll craft and perform your own powerful spoken word piece inspired by your connection to Kāpiti.
Explore your identity, voice, and creativity in a safe and supportive space—then take the stage and share your story with a live audience right after the workshop!
Whether you’re new to spoken word or already passionate about performance, this is your chance to be heard, be bold, and celebrate who you are.
This venue is accessible via stairs.

events.description:
Friends of Pātaka Winter Music Series offers an eclectic mix of music to entertain you on winter Sunday afternoons, mid July-mid-August.

events.id: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi-60 Lady Elizabeth Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi
events.venue: 60 Lady Elizabeth Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nau mai haere mai, join us for a wānanga on what it means to be a young tangata whenua artist working and creating in Aotearoa. Facilitated by Curator and Artist Israel Randell (Tainui, Ngāti Kahungunu, Rarotonga, Mangaia) who will be joined by ringatoi Aroha Matchitt-Millar (Ngāti Rangitihi, Te Whakatōhea, Tūhoe), Enjoy Curator Brooke Pou (Ngāpuhi, Ngāi Te Rangi) and Kiingi Tuheitia Portraiture Award 2025 winner Jazmin Tainui Mihi Paget-Knebel (Te Whānau-ā-Apanui, Whakatohea, Ngāpuhi, Ngāti Hine). Together they will be discussing reclaiming art forms, their journeys as artists and curators, practical tips, and the importance of rangatahi artists in Aotearoa.
Poipoia te kākano kia puāwai. This is a wānanga for rangatahi ringatoi at any stage of their harenga. We encourage you to bring along mahi toi that you are working on.
We will start the afternoon off with a kōrero from Israel, Aroha, Brooke and Jazmine, have a kai and kaputī break, and come back together for some sharing amongst the rōpū.
events.description:

Facilitated by Curator and Artist Israel Randell (Tainui, Ngāti Kahungunu, Rarotonga, Mangaia) who will be joined by ringatoi Aroha Matchitt-Millar (Ngāti Rangitihi, Te Whakatōhea, Tūhoe), Enjoy Curator Brooke Pou (Ngāpuhi, Ngāi Te Rangi) and Kiingi Tuheitia Portraiture Award 2025 winner Jazmin Tainui Mihi Paget-Knebel (Te Whānau-ā-Apanui, Whakatohea, Ngāpuhi, Ngāti Hine).
Together they will be discussing reclaiming art forms, their journeys as artists and curators, practical tips, and the importance of rangatahi artists in Aotearoa.
Poipoia te kākano kia puāwai.
This is a wānanga for rangatahi ringatoi at any stage of their harenga.

events.id: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi-Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wānanga - Mana Toi Mana Rangatahi
events.venue: Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Facilitated by Curator and Artist Israel Randell who will be joined by ringatoi Aroha Matchitt-Millar, Enjoy Curator Brooke Pou and Kiingi Tuheitia Portraiture Award 2025 winner Jazmin Tainui Mihi Paget-Knebel.
This is a wānanga for rangatahi ringatoi at any stage of their harenga.
The intimacy of the process of skinning and pelting manu is both cathartic and repairing, recognizing the role colonisation had in separating Māori from these taonga while whatu-ing the strands of whakapapa back together.
Her toi centres the celebration of Māori and Indigenous cultures through the practice of decolonizing the lens and reclamation of visual narratives from an indigenous perspective.
There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue.

events.id: ERNA FERRY and the Zanzibar JAZZ Ensemble- Former Rodger FoxJazz Ensemble-Beach Road, Paekakariki-Facebook
events.name: ERNA FERRY and the Zanzibar JAZZ Ensemble- Former Rodger FoxJazz Ensemble
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekakariki
events.long_description:
REMEMBERING A JAZZ GREAT
ERNA FERRY AND RODGER FOX JAZZ ENSEMBLE TO PLAY KAPITI
Listern to Erna's Interview at www.mulledwineconcerts.com
"Jazzy grooves with Horns" Erna Ferry, partner of the late Rodger Fox and long-time singer with his band describes the show she will be presenting for Mulled Wine Concerts in Paekakariki at 2:30 PM on Sunday 10 August 2025. "Rodger was a great jazzman and teacher and put together jazz groups of all sizes, ranging from his famed Big Band to smaller combos more suited to more intimate venues. He has left us, but the jazz he championed so well remains. The musicians who were associated with him still want to play and I still want to sing". Together with the principal musicians from Rodger's line-up, she will cover an eclectic range of songs from "The Beatles to Beyond" for Kapiti audiences at the Paekakariki event.
Mary Gow, the organiser of the concert reminds us that Rodger Fox and his ensemble played many times in Paekakariki and he loved the informality and passion for jazz he found on the Kapiti Coast. "We were so happy to learn that this group will carry on the good work" she notes. "It won't be a sad occasion at all, but a happy celebration of the good-time music and fun he enjoyed".
The Mulled WIne Concerts organisation has been presenting musical events in Paekakariki for sixteen years, ranging from full-on classical events - piano recitals, string quartets and soloists - through Celtic folk music and ukeleles, and also jazz and band music. Over the years Gow's focus on quality has cemented her series of concerts into must-see happenings and whatever the genre of music is presented, they usually attract a good audience. The popularity of jazz makes it certain that the 10 August concert will be well attended!
===ENDS===
Mulled Wine Concerts presents Erna Ferry and the Rodger Fox Jazz Ensemble
at St Peter's Community Hall, Beach Road, Paekakariki.
Sunday 10 August at 2:30 PM
Tickets $35 (Student under 16, $15). Online Sales: marygow@gmail.com
Shop outlets: Magpie Paremata, 99 Mana Esplanade; Finn's Hotel, Paekakariki; Moby Dickens Bookshop, Paraparaumu Beach; Jenoa, 2 Mahara Place, Waikanae.
Info: www.mulledwineconcerts.com

He has left us, but the jazz he championed so well remains.
The musicians who were associated with him still want to play and I still want to sing".

RSVP here: heymates.com/wellington/pathways-to-presence/ Entry: $20.00 - reserves your spot and supports the platform.
Exact location is shared via email once you have paid/joined via site.

events.id: Art/Craft Workshop for Children (5-13yrs)-Moera Community House, 107 Randwick Crescent, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Art/Craft Workshop for Children (5-13yrs)
events.venue: Moera Community House, 107 Randwick Crescent, Lower Hutt
events.description:
Our art class is designed to help children unleash their creative potential by providing expert guidance, ample space, and a wide range of art materials and tools.
By encouraging children to explore their imaginations and express themselves in great detail, we inspire them to develop a deeper understanding and appreciation of the world around them.
Through hands-on activities using paints, clay, foam, coloured paper, cardboard, brushes, scissors, and more, children gain the ability not only to appreciate the beauty in life but also to create their own stunning works of art.
Join us to nurture your child's creative talents and inspire their artistic journey!
