events.name: Maddy Low: Dragons - Single Release Show
events.venue: Underworld Tavern, 13 Pirie Street, Wellington
events.description:
Join rapidly rising indie star, 18-year-old singer-songwriter Maddy Low for a Sunday afternoon of live music as she celebrates the release of her stunning new single 'Dragons'.
Known for her emotionally honest lyrics and unique fusion of pop-rock and indie-folk, Maddy builds her songs live using guitar, loop pedals, and layered vocals — creating a raw, immersive experience that feels both personal and powerful.
Coming off the recent success of her song 'To be near' this special acoustic set will feature stripped-back versions of her original songs, including her latest release Dragons, as well as some of the covers she is known for on YouTube and from busking on Cuba St.
Headlining in Auckland earlier in the year, she now calls Wellington home, so this is a one-off chance to see Maddy up close before the next chapter begins.

events.id: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)-39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson)
events.venue: 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks

Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party

Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.
And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!
Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.
1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social
Q&A
Q. What is bachata?
A. Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.
Q. I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
A. Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.
Q. Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
A. Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.
Q. Who are the capital bachata collective?
A. We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you
￼

events.name: Brazilian Zouk - Improvers Variations Io-io & Bonus)
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block C (5 weeks).
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.
In Improvers Block C you will focus on Variationa on Io-io and Bonus as well as some exercises on Elasticity.
===Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week Block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpC
===Location:
Classes are in Studio 6, Level 5, Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. If you just show up on the night, you are welcome to watch the class but will not be able to join in (this is to respect the learning of our regular students as the classes are progressive)

events.id: Deep dive - Traditional Samba de Gafieira Part 2-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Deep dive - Traditional Samba de Gafieira Part 2
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Across six immersive sessions (the first being a practica), we'll Continue to learn the fundamentals of Traditional Samba de Gafieira.
We will continue to deepen your knowledge, continuing on learning the concepts started in the first block of Samba de Gafieira classes.
Week 1: Practice/party/catch up
Week 2: Sacada + Sacada Invertido
Week 3: Romario
Week 4: Pica Pau
Week 5: Esse + Esse saida
Week 6: Facao + Facinha
Samba de gafieira is the partnered version of Brazil’s world-renowned, samba no pe. Samba de Gafieira is danced to the Brazilian samba musical rhythms and must be distinguished from the ballroom Samba, danced in International Latin and American Rhythm ballroom dance styles.
Check out this demo : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JMGlfr3zA5w
It appeared in the 1940s and it gets its name from the Gafieira – popular urban nightclubs of Rio de Janeiro at that time. The dance derived from the Maxixe and followed the arrival of the Choro (another samba musical style). It left most of the Maxixe’s Polka elements behind but maintained the entwined leg movements of the Argentine Tango, although adopting a more relaxed posture than the latter. Many see this form of Samba as a combination of Waltz and Tango.
- Prepaid 6 week block cost is $98 ($90 without the practica) waged or $80 ($75 without the practica) for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students, and if you want to pay for the practica separately its only $10
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukDeep13
Location:
Classes are in the Footnote NZ Dance Studio, 60 Dixon street

events.id: High Tide: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick | Writers on Mondays-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: High Tide: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick | Writers on Mondays
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Seasoned Wellington writer Jenny Pattrick's latest novel, Sea Change, digs into the developing tensions within a small Kāpiti Coast community forced to negotiate a managed retreat after a rupture in the Alpine fault generates a devastating tsunami.
Tensions of a different kind propel debut author Jennifer Trevelyan's A Beautiful Family. This suspenseful coming-of-age novel turns around a summer holiday on the coast and the search for a missing girl.
Two authors at different stages of their careers discuss their work with Kate Duignan.

Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

events.id: Masterclass with soprano Lauren Armishaw-Sharp House, 79 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Masterclass with soprano Lauren Armishaw
events.venue: Sharp House, 79 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for a masterclass with soprano Lauren Armishaw on Monday 11th August from 3pm-5pm in the Hunter Council Chamber. The focus of the masterclass will be on Baroque repertoire, on which Lauren has built her career as a soloist in based in Europe. Having completed her initial study here at VUW, she then completed her Masters in Early Music at the Royal Conservatoire in The Hague, and she says she's excited to return and share her knowledge with the next generation of singers.
Biography:
Soprano Lauren Armishaw grew up in Wellington where she studied singing with Emily Mair at Victoria University of Wellington, and completed degrees in both Composition and Mathematics. Alongside music and maths, she took courses in Italian, Psychology, and Biology, and remembers her time at VUW as incredibly fulfilling — not just for study, but for the wider university life. She was a member of the Italian Club, played Gamalan, and even paddled with the Dragonboat Team.
After moving to the Netherlands in 2002, she completed her Master’s in Early Music at the Royal Conservatoire in The Hague, and has since built a career as a versatile soloist performing across Europe — from major baroque and classical works by Handel, Bach, Mozart and Monteverdi, to contemporary groups like Asko|Schönberg Ensemble.
She’s particularly passionate about 17th and 18th-century opera, and for her Master’s final presentation she unearthed and revived a forgotten staged oratorio by F. C. Lanciani from 1690 — because why not?
Whilst on regular trips home to NZ, Lauren has given concerts together with NZ Baroque Orchestra, Baroque Voices and Auckland Choral Society.
Her deep love for choral music began during her years in the NZ Secondary Students Choir, NZ Youth Choir, and World Youth Choir — experiences she credits with shaping her musical identity. Ensemble singing continues to be a big part of her life: she’s a core member of the Netherlands Bach Society and performs regularly with the Netherlands Chamber Choir.
Lauren is excited to return to VUW to work with the next generation of singers. Whether you want help getting your Handel and Bach recits and arias into shape or want to explore some lesser known baroque repertoire, she’s here to share insight and encouragement.
For more info: www.laurenarmishaw.com

events.id: Cantonese Celebration-Hei Restaurant, 126a Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: Cantonese Celebration
events.venue: Hei Restaurant, 126a Cuba Street
events.long_description:
Share a truly special family celebration meal at Hei, inspired by Michael Chan's roots in Guangzhou and his wife Shirley's Hakka heritage. It's a big, hardworking family and their gatherings are filled with laughter, stories and most importantly great food.  
This four-course meal features a cherished duck dish - it doesn't have a name, but it's a cherished recipe passed down through generations. A labour of love, prepared only for special occasions it is rarely served outside of the Chan family home. 
The Chan family's iconic KC Cafe has been feeding Wellington bellies for 26 years and despite having 160 dishes on the menu, Michael still has more he wants to share. His new venture Hei extends his creativity, reigniting his love for cooking and offers a more refined personal dining experience. For this event, Michael invites you to be part of this new chapter. Each ticket includes four courses and a welcome drink.

events.id: Next Gen Cook Off-LTD., Level 1, 60 Dixon St-WOAP
events.name: Next Gen Cook Off
events.venue: LTD., Level 1, 60 Dixon St
events.long_description:
The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - UHCC -Monday 11th August Production Day Pass-In-studio-22 Lane Street Upper Hutt, Wellington Region 5018-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - UHCC -Monday 11th August Production Day Pass-In-studio
events.venue: 22 Lane Street Upper Hutt, Wellington Region 5018
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Jennifer Trevelyan and Jenny Pattrick
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Seasoned Wellington writer Jenny Pattrick’s latest novel, Sea Change, digs into the developing tensions within a small Kāpiti Coast community forced to negotiate a managed retreat after a rupture in the Alpine fault generates a devastating tsunami.
Tensions of a different kind propel debut author Jennifer Trevelyan’s A Beautiful Family.
This suspenseful coming-of-age novel turns around a summer holiday on the coast and the search for a missing girl.
Two authors at different stages of their careers discuss their work with Kate Duignan.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Tuesday nights - Wellington-65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Tuesday nights - Wellington
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. It starts on Tue 12 August and runs for 8 weeks until Tue30 September, 5.30pm-8pm.
Beginners will focus on cabochon stone set ring. The stone setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Advanced: Chain Making and other projects.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.
Course fee $440, early bird $396 till 13 July.

events.id: Nathan Macgregor solo exhibition-148 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Nathan Macgregor solo exhibition
events.venue: 148 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nathan MacGregor bio
Creations from the void
Wallace art awards 1994
Schizophrenic art awards 3rd place 1999
Coast art trail 2023, 2024, 2025
20th century art history paper
Art is a spiritual and practical focus observing nature and the flow of time .Inspiration and influences vary from Van Gogh too Dzogchen Buddhism a deep transcendental meditation practice bringing light and colour too compositions extrapolating nature's beauty.
My work is often about the heroes journey from the abyss too the foot stool of the lord Jahve.
Kind regards Nathan MacGregor.

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - The Scream-166 Main Rd, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - The Scream
events.venue: 166 Main Rd, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!
Join us for a creative night of drinking
and painting
in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.
Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.
What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!
We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.
For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to
[[https://paintvine.co.nz/]

events.id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind Through Yoga Wisdom-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind Through Yoga Wisdom
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind Through Yoga Wisdom
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Why does the mind so often race ahead, spin stories, or spiral into fear—just when we most need it to be calm? Why does peace feel fleeting, while panic clings on? In this grounding workshop, we’ll explore simple, profound tools drawn from yoga wisdom to begin gently rewiring the anxious mind. Learn how to shift from reactive patterns to inner steadiness, and rediscover a sense of clarity, safety, and ease within.
6.15pm Tuesday 12th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

events.id: Tax on Tuesdays series - Funding a Better Aotearoa, Session 1: We can have nice things-55 Lambton Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Tax on Tuesdays series - Funding a Better Aotearoa, Session 1: We can have nice things
events.venue: 55 Lambton Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The first in a new Tax on Tuesdays series on 'Funding a Better Aotearoa - why we need more revenue'. Over the course of this series, experts from across Aotearoa will share their views about:
- the value of public spending to our society and the economy
- what it would take to adequately fund infrastructure, responses to climate change and embedded poverty, the education and health systems
- the need to build a capable state to deliver these public goods
In the inaugural session, Taylor Forward will speak to the topic 'We can have nice things - the value of public expenditure and the economic faults in austerity logics'.
Tayla Forward (Ngāpuhi), is a researcher in economics and political economy, Fellow of the World Inequality Lab, postgraduate studies at the Paris School of Economics, and research associate at Victoria University of Wellington and the University of Canterbury.
Both in-person and online options.
In-person at VUW Law School - GBLT3.
Register to attend either in-person or online at https://www.tjanz.org/we_can_have_nice_things

Delivereasy presents Matchmaker - a playful pop-up where your dream burger is just a quiz away. Answer a few cheeky love questions and get “matched” with a mystery burger that fits your flavour personality. Sweet and romantic? Meet Honey & Brie. Spicy and bold? Whether you're here for love, dinner, or a little bit of both - Matchmaker is the perfect excuse to grab your mates, eat your way through your VWOAP checklist, and discover your burger soulmate(s).

Love is messy. Good thing we’ve got napkins.

events.id: Work Smarter - Wairarapa. AI Literacy for Communications, Marketing and Business.-50 Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Work Smarter - Wairarapa. AI Literacy for Communications, Marketing and Business.
events.venue: 50 Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
events.description:
You’ll learn: Why AI is suddenly everywhere - and why that matters for communications and marketing people.
Understanding AI so that you can apply it to the right tools for your role How to use AI for content creation, workflow, and strategy without devaluing human skillsets How to use AI critically, and understand the risks, red flags and ethics How to train AI to sound like you; so it reflects your brand, not generic outputs Step-by-step ways to save hours a week without cutting corners How to get your team onboard and start using AI safely and effectively Why early adopters are getting ahead fast, and how to future-proof your skills.
This workshop is built for: Marketing, communications and engagement professionals who want to retain value in our changing industry AI curious professionals and business owners Anyone who's been avoiding AI, and wants real, practical ways to use AI to improve marketing, communications and engagement right now.
You’ll walk away with: A practical understanding of AI, how it works and why it might not have been working for you already A toolkit of recommended AI tools tailored to your needs Clear workflows you can apply the next day Confidence to use AI without risking your brand, credibility or ethics The understanding of how to integrate AI into your work, team and organisation No tech jargon.
My focus is making AI accessible, ethical, and practical for people who don’t have time to waste - because knowledge is power, and understanding AI will make your job easier, not harder.

events.name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Auckland
events.venue: 11th Floor, 99 Albert Street Auckland, New Zealand
events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.venue: Bell Street Featherston, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.name: Permacomputing 101
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
This light-hearted talk will introduce some old, some new and some eccentric ideas for keeping computers and their software running for as long as we can.
Come and learn some tricks to fight planned obsolescence and also build new things that might survive the onslaught of corporate capture.
We’ll be streaming this talk from aboard a little sailboat adrift somewhere in the Pacific!
No prior knowledge of computing required.
About the host, Devine Lu Linvega Vagabond, lifelong student and co-founder of Hundred Rabbits.

events.id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind Through Yoga Wisdom- Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind Through Yoga Wisdom
events.venue: Vivian Street  Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind Through Yoga Wisdom
Why does the mind so often race ahead, spin stories, or spiral into fear—just when we most need it to be calm? Why does peace feel fleeting, while panic clings on? In this grounding workshop, we’ll explore simple, profound tools drawn from yoga wisdom to begin gently rewiring the anxious mind. Learn how to shift from reactive patterns to inner steadiness, and rediscover a sense of clarity, safety, and ease within.
The seminar will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!
Meet Your Host: Ramadas

events.id: 6 Week Meditation Course-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 20 Alexander Rd, Raumati-Event Finder
events.name: 6 Week Meditation Course
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 20 Alexander Rd, Raumati
events.description:
The goals we have set for this course are: - to understand the principles of meditation practice - to be able to sit comfortably and still - the ability to follow a basic meditation technique independently - to establish a regular home meditation practice - to be inspired to further develop knowledge and skills in meditation In our daily lives, we increasingly need more focus, inner clarity, and perhaps most of all, inner peace.
These qualities are inherent to us, though sometimes hidden by a busy mind.
This course will provide both theoretical and practical methods to reconnect with your Self.
Suitable for complete beginners, those returning to their practice after a break, or anyone seeking the support of the Sangha.
If you would like to attend the course online please email us at: kapiti@yogaindailylife.org.nz for the Zoom link.

events.id: 2025 New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: 2025 New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
The most joyful children’s literature event of the year is surely the New Zealand Book Awards for Children and Young Adults ceremony, and we’re inviting you to join the celebration at the characterful Pipitea Marae in Wellington on Wednesday 13 August.
You’ll be greeted by a singing group of talented Pōneke rangatahi and there’ll be live music throughout the evening. But most importantly, you’ll get to meet the 47 gifted children’s writers, illustrators and translators who are finalists in this year’s awards, and applaud the winners as they are announced.
Tickets (which include food and refreshments at the post-ceremony function) are on sale now via Humanitix for $52.00 plus booking fees. This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so secure your place today and enjoy this wonderful showcase of the very best books of the year for young New Zealand readers.

events.id: EYA Presents: Let's talk about Purgatory-17A Boulcott St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: EYA Presents: Let's talk about Purgatory
events.venue: 17A Boulcott St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We all want to be saints, but the struggle against sin and selfishness can feel overwhelming. There may be days where we might feel satisfied simply making it to purgatory rather than entering the pearly gates. But is this lukewarm path the only way to make it to heaven?
Fr Kevin Mowbray will delve into the reality that in this life, we are given every opportunity to prepare our souls for God’s presence. Embracing the sufferings of this moment purifies us the way the refining fire of purgatory would. In this way, we can prepare ourselves in this temporary world to live alongside our Lord in the everlasting world.
See you at EYA!
_____________________
Wednesday 13 August 2025 | 6:00PM
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is welcome!

events.id: Lost Wax Casting - 6 weeks, Wednesdays-65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Lost Wax Casting - 6 weeks, Wednesdays
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A fantastic course that's full of fun and inspiration! Beginners and advanced students welcome! The course starts on Wed 13 August and runs for 6 weeks until Wed 17 September, 5.30pm-8pm.
Create interesting designs in wax then send them off to be professionally cast in metal. Once your pieces are back you will be taught how to cut, file and shape them into wearable pieces.
Level 1 students: Learn to work in both soft and hard jewellers' wax and send your waxes away to be cast. When they return you will learn how to clean them up into finished jewellery and/or incorporate them into jewellery in multiple ways. We start with rings but encourage students to think outside the box!
Level 2 students: Advance your carving skills and learn to set stones in your waxes. This can be done either by creating claws and other settings or trying the cast-in-place technique - an organic, exciting process.
Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.
Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what they want to make.
Course fee $325.

events.id: Return Season! The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing-25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Return Season! The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing
events.venue: 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Back after a sold-out season during the 2025 Wellington Pride Festival!
"She enthrals me, enslaves me – and her personal self – her body absolute – is my worship."
Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, and Vixen Temple present The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield’s Queer Writing, an immersive theatrical experience in one of Aotearoa’s leading historic house museums.
Join performance artist Vixen Temple and historian Kerryn Pollock of Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga on a journey through Mansfield’s sensual diary entries and sapphic-coded short stories, moving through the rooms in the home of her birth, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden in Thorndon. Live musical accompaniment will be performed by Ms Weeds.
All details and booking via www.katherinemansfield.com

Perfect for anyone interested in the night sky, this two-hour live session under our immersive planetarium dome will guide you through the basics of stargazing: how and why the stars and planets move the way they do; how to find South and other useful markers in the sky; and how to locate your place in space.
Sit back and enjoy being taken on a detailed tour of the night sky with our high-definition laser projectors.

- Intermission with refreshments
- Access to Space Place’s galleries and interactive exhibits
- 20% discount at Space Place Shop

Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!

events.description:
Shane Jones, Minister for Oceans and Fisheries, Minister for Regional Development, Minister for Resources, Associate Minister of Finance and Associate Minister for Energy is not your average politician, nor is this your average political lunch.
The eponymous Matua has lent his name to this lunch in a testament to the tenor of this event.
Expect an honest and insightful discussion on politics and the New Zealand economy – in an articulate and open forum.

events.id: Bridget Douglas and Michael Tsalka - Flute and Piano-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bridget Douglas and Michael Tsalka - Flute and Piano
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
The program opens with J.S.
Internationally renowned visiting pianist, Michael Tsalka, showcases two solo works for piano: Pauline Viardot-Garcia’s charming Sérénade and Gavotte, followed by the World Premiere of Two Poems, One Meditation by British composer Prof. Nicholas Smith.
He has recorded 40 critically acclaimed CDs, with repertoire from the Baroque period to the Contemporary Era (including many world premiere recordings) for NAXOS, Grand Piano, Paladino, Brilliant Classics, IMI, Sheva Collection, Wirripang, Tempus Clasico, and Ljud & Bild.
Circa 85 contemporary compositions (which he premiered) were dedicated to him by composers from all over the world.
Bridget is Section Principal Flute of the NZSO and an Artist Teacher in Flute at the New Zealand School of Music - Te Kōkī.

events.id: EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study-17 Boulcott Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study
events.venue: 17 Boulcott Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!
__________________
Every Wednesday | 16 July 2025 - 08 October 2025
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is most welcome!

events.id: Tales of the Unexpected - WELLINGTON-11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tales of the Unexpected - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Professor Richard Beasley CNZM FRSNZ, the 2024 Rutherford Medal winner, will highlight ten influential research programmes that have challenged long-held clinical assumptions, advanced medical knowledge, and directly influenced patient care: Should fever be treated?
What was the cause of the epidemic of asthma deaths in New Zealand?
Biography Professor Richard Beasley, renown academic, physician, and researcher, is the founder and director of the Medical Research Institute of New Zealand (MRINZ).
Richard was Deputy Chair of the Health Research Council of New Zealand from 2010 to 2016 and has had a longstanding medical advisory role with the Asthma and Respiratory Foundation of New Zealand, chairing the adolescent and adult asthma guidelines group.
Richard was appointed a Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to medical research in 2008; elected a Fellow of the Royal Society Te Apārangi of New Zealand in 2015; awarded the Sir Charles Hercus Medal in 2016 in recognition of the impact of his research, the Beaven Medal in 2019 in recognition of his translational research, and was awarded the Rutherford Medal by the Royal Society Te Apārangi in 2024 for revolutionising the treatment of asthma worldwide.

events.id: The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing-Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield's Queer Writing
events.venue: Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington
events.description:
Back after a sold-out season during the 2025 Wellington Pride Festival!
Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, and Vixen Temple present The Magic of Her Body: Readings of Katherine Mansfield’s Queer Writing, an immersive theatrical experience in one of Aotearoa’s leading historic house museums.
The Wednesday performance will be followed by a Q&A session.
Born in Wellington, she lived permanently in England and Europe from 1908 until her untimely death from tuberculosis in 1923.
She became a central figure in literary modernism alongside contemporaries such as Virginia Woolf and DH Lawrence.

events.id: Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course-61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course
events.venue: 61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Musical improv can be absolute magic. Whether it's a whole musical show, or single song that bursts out of an emotional scene, music adds so much to our improv.
This course for improvisers will give an introduction to musical improv. We'll cover basic song structures, how to get into a song from a scene, how to support a song through chorus work, and why and when we use music to add to our improv.
Participants should be confident in scene-work and have at least 2 years improv experience. This course will not teach you how to approach scenes and characters, so you should have a solid foundation which you can add to with this new toolbox of musical skills.
The course includes 6 workshops which will run 6:30pm to 8:30pm on Wednesdays from August 6th to September 10th. As it is an intro course, we do not anticipate a showcase for this course.
ABOUT THE TEACHERS
LIA KELLY is a theatre-maker and teacher based in Pōneke. She is an established director, actor, improviser and musician and has been a part of productions across the city over the last 10 years. She directed One Night Band which won 'Most Original Production' at the Wellington Theatre Awards 2023, and performs regularly as both a player and musician for POPROX.
ISAAC THOMAS has been an improviser and improv musician for a decade in Pōneke and Whakatū/Nelson. He's played with Body in Space, Playshop, Poprox and been musical director for musical improv powerhouse The Pāua Ballads. He has worked with almost every major improv company around the city accompanying them through improvised piano, guitar and vocals.
THE STANDY-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. events.id: Phases: Four-Part Sound Journey Through the Cycles of the Moon-26 Constable St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Phases: Four-Part Sound Journey Through the Cycles of the Moon
events.venue: 26 Constable St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Phases: A Gong Cycle in Four Moons
A 4-Part Sound Journey Aligned with the Lunar Rhythm
*$30 per session, or $100 for all four*
Float into a deep, immersive sound experience designed to align you with the rhythms of the Moon and the wisdom of the seasons.
Phases is a four-part sound bath series, each session attuned to a specific lunar phase and its accompanying zodiac sign — all cardinal, all initiatory. Through resonant soundscapes, guided meditation, colour, scent and intentional rest, you’ll be invited to explore the cycles of growth, release, reflection, and renewal within yourself.
Each session begins with a gentle meditation, followed by a sound journey that mirrors the energetic mood of the moon. These sessions are spacious, meditative, and restorative — open to anyone seeking connection with body, breath, and the unseen tides that move us. We will finish with silence and tea, to help integrate and ground.
All sessions will take place on the four Wednesdays of August, starting at 7pm.
The Four Sessions:
06.08 - 1. Waxing Gibbous in Capricorn – "Edge of Fullness"
A gong bath for expansion, tension, and the power of almost.
13.08 - 2. Waning Gibbous in Aries – "The Unravelling Light"
A sound ritual for release, gratitude, and gentle undoing.
20.08 - 3.Waning Crescent in Cancer – "Return to the Deep"
A meditative descent into rest, reflection, and inner shadow.
27.08 - 4.Waxing Crescent in Libra – "Kindling the New"
A soft emergence — a ritual for vision, hope, and gentle beginnings.

Whether you attend one session or the full cycle, each phase offers a way in — a space to listen more deeply to your inner world, to the moon, and to sound itself.
What to bring: A yoga mat or two, blanket, pillow, and anything that helps you feel comfortable lying down. **I recommend bringing extra cushioning as the floor here is concrete.**
You are welcome to bring a journal, crystals, or other ritual items.
No prior experience with sound journeys or astrology is necessary — just come as you are.

events.id: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
Deep Soma Remembering is a breath-led journey into those quiet places within—where emotional density softens, ancestral wisdom rises, and your own inner rhythm becomes unmistakably clear.
This session is for anyone who feels “off” even when everything looks “fine.” For those navigating transition, fatigue, emotional overwhelm, or simply sensing that their body is speaking—and they’re finally ready to listen.
Plus - there is an amazing plant-based dinner included in your ticket!
Core Intention
To reconnect with the intelligence of the soma—the living, sensing body—as a gateway to emotional clarity, ancestral remembrance, and spiritual presence.
What to Expect
Guided Elebreath
session (conscious, rhythmic breathing and somatic presence)
Embodiment practices to awaken sensory awareness and deepen body connection
Intuitive visualization cues and energetic attunement
Gentle music and sacred space to support emotional and energetic release
Closing prompts for reflection and emotional integration
You’ll be gently guided back into your own inner landscape—where truth lives, tension releases, and the nervous system finds a place to land.
Contraindications
This session involves intentional breath modulation, somatic awareness, and nervous system stimulation. Please consult a medical professional or get in contact if any of the following apply:
Pregnancy (2nd or 3rd trimester especially)
History of cardiovascular issues, stroke, or high blood pressure
Epilepsy or severe respiratory conditions
Diagnosed PTSD, schizophrenia, or other unmanaged mental health conditions
Currently taking medications that affect heart rate or nervous system regulation
All participants will be guided to listen to their body’s cues. You may choose to simply receive the energetic field and breathe gently if needed. Your safety, sovereignty, and comfort come first.
Integration Support After Breathwork
Breathwork opens the door—but integration is what sustains the shift. After your session, you may feel light, raw, expanded, emotional, or deeply calm. All responses are valid.
We suggest:
Drinking plenty of water
Taking time to rest and reflect
Journaling or voice noting any insights that arise
Spending time in nature or grounding practices (e.g., bare feet on grass, epsom salt baths)
Avoiding overstimulation or intense conversations immediately after
Free Integration Resource Kit
As part of your experience, you’ll receive access to a free post-session integration kit via my private Circle community, which includes:
A grounding breathwork audio to support your nervous system reset
A curated Spotify playlist for emotional flow
Reflective journaling prompts to deepen embodiment and remembrance


Meet Lynn, your host
Lynn supports visionaries, wellness practitioners, and individuals navigating life transitions to return to the intelligence of their bodies — so they can live, lead, and create from a grounded, soul-aligned state.
As the founder of Elebreath
, her work bridges somatic breathwork, nervous system regulation, and energetic mastery with intuitive embodiment and deep manifestation practices.
Through her signature method, the Soulful Living Blueprint, she guides clients through:
– Somatic breathwork & nervous system healing
– Embodiment and activation coaching
– Soul-rooted manifestation practices
– Holistic wellness integration
– Business systems automation & aligned scaling

Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets
...............................................................................................
Make Thursdays your night to connect and take a break from your week. Events range from creative workshops, wellness courses to entertaining experiences. All within a down-to-earth and welcoming space. Each event wraps up with a plant-based dinner and dessert.
...............................................................................................
Bhakti Lounge
1/175 Vivian Street
Wellington

events.id: Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- Kauri Street Lower Hutt, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: Kauri Street Lower Hutt, Wellington
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: Snacks Amore-Amuse Snack Bar, 178 Willis Street-WOAP
events.name: Snacks Amore
events.venue: Amuse Snack Bar, 178 Willis Street
events.long_description:
When the host brings you bread, instead of a red flag...Snacks Amore!
Amuse Snack Bar invites food lovers to ditch the dating apps for one delicious night of light-hearted speed dating and snack-based bonding at their Euro-inspired aperitivo haven. Whether you are after a snack (human) or a snack (sustenance), you're guaranteed to leave with a full heart and a satisfied appetite.
Each attendee will enjoy 12 mini dates and 6 courses of Italian-inspired snacklets – cacio e pepe, agrodolce, pasta alla norma, porchetta, and zabaione, all served in perfect bite-sized form. A glass of Lambrusco kicks off the evening, with a cheeky mini tiramisu maritozzo to take home. Throughout the event, wines curated by the charming Richard Klein of Artigiano Imports will be on offer, alongside Amuse’s house spritz, Negroni, and Parrotdog Lager.
The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming – more aperitivo hour than high-pressure matchmaking. The Amuse team, also musicians, will guide the evening with playful icebreakers, musical moments, and a light-touch structure that makes meeting new people easy and enjoyable.
Two themed evenings allow guests to choose their best fit:

Evening 1: General Assembly
Grouped on the night by chosen generation:
• 5:30pm – Millennials (28–45)
• 7:30pm – Gen X (40–60)

Evening 2: Rainbow Night
Grouped by dating preference:
• 5:30pm – those seeking men
• 7:30pm – those seeking women

The event warmly welcomes all gender identities and sexual orientations. Attendees will be asked to indicate who they’re interested in dating at checkout, but gender identity remains private unless individuals wish to share it. Symbols and nametags on the night will help create a fun and inclusive vibe. Amuse Snack Bar is proud to be an LGBTQIA+ friendly space.

events.id: Hatman's B'day Bash-Fortune Favours, 7 Leeds St-WOAP
events.name: Hatman's B'day Bash
events.venue: Fortune Favours, 7 Leeds St
events.long_description:
Join Fortune Favours and Hill’s Hats for an unforgettable evening as they come together to celebrate Hill’s Hats’ remarkable 150th anniversary! This special event will transport you back to 1875, immersing you in the rich history and tradition of New Zealand’s most iconic hat brand. Expect a night filled with flavour, fun, and a touch of nostalgia.

The evening will feature a lavish buffet banquet, including a show-stopping drunken pig on the spit, slow-roasted to perfection, and accompanied by a selection of mouthwatering sides. Pair your meal with complimentary beverages and a cocktail to get the celebration started. As live music sets the tone, the atmosphere will be full of excitement and warmth, making it the perfect occasion to unwind and connect with friends, old and new.

Throughout the evening, take in the rich legacy of Hill’s Hats as they mark this major milestone in style. And to make the night even more memorable, you will receive your very own Hill’s Hat to take home, an enduring symbol of tradition and craftsmanship that has stood the test of time.

Don’t miss out on this spectacular celebration of history, culinary delights, and timeless style. Join Fortune Favours for a night to remember, and raise a glass to 150 years of Hill’s Hats and many more to come.

events.id: 6 Week Back & Neck Care Yoga Course-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: 6 Week Back & Neck Care Yoga Course
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Courses focused on Back & Neck Care from the System YOGA IN DAILY LIFE are well-known in Europe for assisting in recovery from back pain, poor posture and neck stiffness.
The consistency and regularity of your yoga practice is an important factor in bringing changes in your back and your general physical state.

events.id: Wellington Leadership Group: 7 Strategies to Boost Your Productivity-40 Mercer Street, City, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Leadership Group: 7 Strategies to Boost Your Productivity
events.venue: 40 Mercer Street, City, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
7 Strategies to Boost Your Productivity: Achieve More with Less—Without Burning Out
In today’s workplace, the rules have changed. Teams are leaner, budgets are tighter, and expectations are higher than ever. If you’re feeling the pressure to deliver more with fewer resources, this event is for you.
Join us for a powerful session designed to help professionals navigate the productivity paradox: how to stay focused, energized, and effective when the workload keeps growing but the support doesn’t.
You’ll walk away with 7 actionable strategies that help you:
🔍 Cut through noise and focus on high-impact tasks
⚡ Recharge your energy and avoid burnout
🧠 Use brain-based tools to stay sharp under pressure
🎯 Prioritize with precision—even when everything feels urgent
🛠️ Structure your day for momentum, not just motion
📈 Build habits that sustain performance in high-demand environments
Why this matters now:
Because the old productivity playbook—just work harder—is broken. This session offers a smarter, more sustainable way forward for professionals who are being asked to do more with less.
🎯 Who should attend:
Business owners and team leaders managing reduced headcount
Professionals juggling multiple roles and rising expectations
HR and L&D leaders supporting overwhelmed teams
Consultants helping clients adapt to leaner operations
📅 Reserve your spot—space is limited.
Let’s rethink productivity and build a better way to work.
About Cillín Hearns
An Irishman living in New Zealand, Cillín has a strong background in information technology and consulting. He has several years experience in project management and project governance. Cillín has led project teams through multiple concurrent projects ranging in size from $300k to $12m. He has also had the good fortune to lead and develop up to 12 teams of 140 consultants of various disciplines including Agile, DevOps, Test Analysis, Business Analysis, and Architecture so he knows what it takes to deliver.
Giving back to the community is important to Cillín. That’s why he set up the Wellington Leadership Group and the Wellington Coaches Network. With over 1,700 members in the Leadership Group, Cillín speaks on a range of topics on everything from holding difficult conversations and giving feedback to personal effectiveness and high-performing teams. With a vision to raise the level of coaching throughout New Zealand, Cillín facilitates mini workshops to advance coaching skills across all coaching disciplines and team leaders.
As a Leadership and Performance Coach, Cillín has worked with people from a range of backgrounds and at every level of the organisation. His style is both relaxed and professional with a large dose of humour at the right times which is summed up nicely by this feedback, “Fantastic – this guy rocks! Amazing speaker. The session was motivating and inspiring.”
About Results Coaching
Founded in 2011, Results Coaching (formerly Setanta Consulting), is one of New Zealand’s fastest growing coaching practices. Our promise is to expand the horizons of our clients measured by observable growth through coaching and training events. As one participant put it, “This is the type of talk I’m looking for at my stage of my career, i.e. focuses on personal development rather than technical skills.”
Please Note: We may photograph or record the event for promotion purposes and may reproduce the image of any person who attends for any purpose without payment.

events.id: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Breathwork: A Journey into Embodied Memory & Inner Truth
Deep Soma Remembering is a breath-led journey into those quiet places within—where emotional density softens, ancestral wisdom rises, and your own inner rhythm becomes unmistakably clear.

This session is for anyone who feels “off” even when everything looks “fine.” For those navigating transition, fatigue, emotional overwhelm, or simply sensing that their body is speaking—and they’re finally ready to listen.

Plus - there is an amazing plant-based dinner included in your ticket!

Core Intention
To reconnect with the intelligence of the soma—the living, sensing body—as a gateway to emotional clarity, ancestral remembrance, and spiritual presence.

What to Expect

Guided Elebreath®️ session (conscious, rhythmic breathing and somatic presence)

Embodiment practices to awaken sensory awareness and deepen body connection

Intuitive visualization cues and energetic attunement

Gentle music and sacred space to support emotional and energetic release

Closing prompts for reflection and emotional integration

You’ll be gently guided back into your own inner landscape—where truth lives, tension releases, and the nervous system finds a place to land.

Contraindications
This session involves intentional breath modulation, somatic awareness, and nervous system stimulation. Please consult a medical professional or get in contact if any of the following apply:

Pregnancy (2nd or 3rd trimester especially)

History of cardiovascular issues, stroke, or high blood pressure

Epilepsy or severe respiratory conditions

Diagnosed PTSD, schizophrenia, or other unmanaged mental health conditions

Currently taking medications that affect heart rate or nervous system regulation

All participants will be guided to listen to their body’s cues. You may choose to simply receive the energetic field and breathe gently if needed. Your safety, sovereignty, and comfort come first.

Integration Support After Breathwork
Breathwork opens the door—but integration is what sustains the shift. After your session, you may feel light, raw, expanded, emotional, or deeply calm. All responses are valid.

We suggest:

Drinking plenty of water

Taking time to rest and reflect

Journaling or voice noting any insights that arise

Spending time in nature or grounding practices (e.g., bare feet on grass, epsom salt baths)

Avoiding overstimulation or intense conversations immediately after

Free Integration Resource Kit
As part of your experience, you’ll receive access to a free post-session integration kit via my private Circle community, which includes:

A grounding breathwork audio to support your nervous system reset

A curated Spotify playlist for emotional flow

Reflective journaling prompts to deepen embodiment and remembrance



Meet Lynn, your host
Lynn supports visionaries, wellness practitioners, and individuals navigating life transitions to return to the intelligence of their bodies — so they can live, lead, and create from a grounded, soul-aligned state.

As the founder of Elebreath®️, her work bridges somatic breathwork, nervous system regulation, and energetic mastery with intuitive embodiment and deep manifestation practices.

Through her signature method, the Soulful Living Blueprint, she guides clients through:
– Somatic breathwork & nervous system healing
– Embodiment and activation coaching
– Soul-rooted manifestation practices
– Holistic wellness integration
– Business systems automation & aligned scaling

events.id: Drew Rae Roadshow - Wellington-Westpac Stadium, Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Drew Rae Roadshow - Wellington
events.venue: Westpac Stadium, Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The nature of health and safety work is changing. The scope of responsibilities is expanding. New risks, and new tools, are emerging. Are you prepared? This full-day workshop with Drew Rae has been developed to ready you for a professional future that could look very different from your past.
Dr Drew Rae is an Associate Professor in the Safety Science Innovation Lab at Griffith University, where he teaches courses on research methods and safety engineering, and manages the lab’s research programme. Drew co-hosts the Safety of Work podcast and is on the editorial board of the journal, 'Safety Science'.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to work with a renowned safety thought-leader. In person events are in Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington with an online option available too.

events.id: Fazerdaze (duo) | Wellington-9 Edward Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Fazerdaze (duo) | Wellington
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fresh off her Aotearoa Music Award wins for Best Solo Artist and Album Of The Year, coupled with the release of her critically acclaimed album Soft Power & new single Motorway, Ōtautahi dream-pop artist Fazerdaze (Amelia Murray) is bringing her special duo show to Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.
The last time the Fazerdaze duo hit the road was late last year, when Amelia Murray and bandmate Dave Rowlands (keys and guitar) toured North America alongside Australian psych-rockers POND. Along the way, they delivered a mesmerizing live set at Seattle’s legendary KEXP studio as part of the station’s iconic live-to-air series. Now, local audiences are in for a treat as Fazerdaze brings that same magic home for a series of rare, intimate shows on home soil.
Tickets live 9am Wednesday 11th June via Undertheradar.co.nz & www.fazerdaze.com/tour

events.name: How To Build A Referral Rich Reputation
events.venue: 17 Parumoana Street, Porirua
events.long_description:
“Your reputation is everything.”
If you are not thrilled at the prospect of constant content creation and marketing, and would rather spend the bulk of your time working with clients, then your Referral Rich Reputation does the heavy lifting of client attraction for you. When you have a team of former clients and colleagues vouching for you, it’s like having your own sales team out there working for you 24/7.
A Referral Rich Reputation is something that grows and grows, provided you are investing in the right activities to support it.
Join Lorraine in this interactive session to learn how to intentionally create a reputation that does the heavy lifting of marketing for you.

events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South
events.long_description:
K A T E brings Sultry Blues, with a hint of Enchantment and a sprinkle of Jazz. Backed by her highly talented band, this team of musicians is more than just a show of music. Some would say to witness them helps them gain a connection to their heart.
K A T E brings a presence to the room as her songs weave in and out of emotion and all of its duality that is tied to this life that we live as human beings.
K A T E's music offers joy and even sanctuary for all people wanting to enjoy the healing side that music can offer.

events.id: LAUNCH: o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s "chrysalis (d[i]s)section"-57 Willis Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: LAUNCH: o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s "chrysalis (d[i]s)section"
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Please join 5ever books from 6pm on Friday 15th August to celebrate the launch of o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th))'s first full length collection of poetry, "chrysalis (d[i]s)section".
From 6pm, at Unity Books Wellington
with performances from Anneke Westra, Mallory Elmo and Kieran Trainor
All welcome, free entry
Drinks and nibbles served
Books will be for sale for $30!
Info about book and author below
----------------

Blurb:
chrysalis (d[i]s)section takes a scalpel to poetic form(s), making a collage of neo-[n]ietzschean rhyme, jazz-inspired intonation, & second-wave feminist calls for male castration / in three sections, the 'caterpillar to butterfly' cliché of personal metamorphosis is rewritten, while exoskeletal references are both irreverently & deferentially effaced / silly, serious, & {self-}referential: rhythmically-punctuated wordplay toys with the notion of authorship, across time //
Author bio:
o(l[i]ve)(*) (bly(th)) is an outer-disciplinary artist / she has recently been playing the piano, writing poetry, painting, & poking ink into skin / (her) poetry has been published by various local literary journals & this is (her) first full-length collection of poetry //

events.id: Lunchtime Concert: Ravel's L'Enfant et les Sortilèges (The Bewitched Child)-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Lunchtime Concert: Ravel's L'Enfant et les Sortilèges (The Bewitched Child)
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Join the Classical Voice students and the Collaborative Piano Class of NZSM with the senior choir Lyrica from Kelburn Normal Primary School in a magical journey. We start in a bedroom where chairs and clocks come alive and cats,tea pots, and cups talk. There's a Princess, a Fire who only warms the good, a little old man, a chorus of numbers, and all manner of birds, squirrels, frogs and talking trees teaching The Child empathy and compassion.
Children are welcome and will be encouraged to take part so please come dressed as your favourite animal or princess and let us tell you the story.

events.id: Taputeranga: Above and Below exhibition opening-69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Taputeranga: Above and Below exhibition opening
events.venue: 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us as we welcome Rick Allender and Katy Cottrell to Toi Poneke Arts Centre for the opening of Taputeranga: Above and Below. Taputeranga: Above and Below celebrates the vibrant life of the Taputeranga Marine Reserve on Wellington’s south coast. Artists Katy Cottrell and Rick Allender explore the connection between land and sea through intricate works crafted from natural wood veneers. Katy delves beneath the waves, illustrating native marine flora and fauna with a Victorian-era scientific flair. In contrast, Rick maps the reserve’s surface with bold, modernist marquetry inspired by its geography, human structures, and natural landmarks.
Thanks to Fortune Favours, Victoria University Coastal Ecology Laboratory and Wellington City Council.

events.id: The Magnificent Weirdos Presents "First Draft" - Eight Rehearsed Readings of Plays in Development-12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Magnificent Weirdos Presents "First Draft" - Eight Rehearsed Readings of Plays in Development
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
From 15-17 August, The Magnificent Weirdos is teaming up with writers in the early stages of creating new work to present rehearsed readings of these works in progress for the public, followed by audience kōrero with each writer/creator.
All the work is created by writers and devisers with lived experience of disability, neurodivergence, d/Deafness or mental distress.
Each work of approximately 20 minutes will be presented once over the weekend. Each reading will be followed by a 30 minute chat with the writer, facilitated by the director. It's an exciting and creative way to develop new work, both for writers, who receive feedback at an early stage, and for audiences who get to water the seed from which the fruit will eventually grow.
We will also be hosting an industry workshop led by Playmarket, leading a conversation on opportunities, processes and accessibility for new playwrights. Playwrights will need to register for this free workshop which has 20 spaces.
The whole event is NZSL interpreted. Accessible to blind/low vision folks without audio description.
Check out the program for more details of each play, content notes and pre show information here: https://www.magnificentweirdos.com/fd-program
#FirstDraft #Playwrights #LiveTheatre #Playreading #NeurodivergentWriters #DeafWriters #DisabledWriters #HannahPlayhouse #Wellington
INSTAGRAM:
@hannahplayhouse @sameena.zehra @WgtnCC @playmarketnz

events.id: ration the Queen's veges-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: ration the Queen's veges
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.

events.id: Ōtari Glow Worm Tour-160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
events.venue: 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.
This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.
Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.
This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or inquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

events.id: Cheesy Lovers-Le Marché Français, 262 Thorndon Quay-WOAP
events.name: Cheesy Lovers
events.venue: Le Marché Français, 262 Thorndon Quay
events.long_description:
Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!

events.id: Tea Lover's Odyssey-t Lounge by Dilmah, 22-24 Willeston Street-WOAP
events.name: Tea Lover's Odyssey
events.venue: t Lounge by Dilmah, 22-24 Willeston Street
events.long_description:
Dilmah T Lounge, focusses on promoting tea in an innovative and creative way, offering guests an unforgettable experience. Their single-origin Dilmah tea, sourced directly from Sri Lanka – the Pearl of the Indian Ocean – is at the heart of what they do.

Guests are invited on a gastronomic journey through Sri Lanka's stunning hill country aboard the Dunhinda Odyssey, the latest addition to the Sri Lanka Odyssey fleet. Named after the majestic Dunhinda waterfall, this scenic train departs from Colombo and travels to Badulla, the hometown of our chefs. The journey offers travelers an unparalleled experience, surrounded by breathtaking landscapes and lush tea plantations.

The t Lounge chefs showcase the finest flavours of Sri Lankan cuisine, perfectly paired with premium teas. Each dish and tea pairing is thoughtfully presented in an innovative way, challenging guests to experience and appreciate tea in new and exciting ways.

events.venue: Entrance D, Block Massey Unviersity, Wallace St Mount Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Take a peek under the hood and get an inside look at the creative process as Swiss-American filmmaker Alexandre O. Philippe leads this special masterclass, with a focus on film history, deep analysis, and the art of cinematic storytelling.
Known for his distinctive approach to the cinema essay, including NZIFF 2025’s Chain Reactions Alexandre invites participants into a world where film is not just watched, but rigorously examined, deconstructed, and cherished.
A must-attend for filmmakers, critics, students, and film lovers alike, this masterclass promises to ignite your curiosity and sharpen your analytical eye.
Bring your questions, your obsessions, and your love for movies – this is cinephilia at its most alive and engaged.
Members of a number of Film Industry Guilds qualify for concession priced tickets to this Masterclass.

Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
