events.name: Ghost Trio (piano trio)
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Monique Lapins (violin), Ken Ichinose (cello) and Gabriela Glapska (piano).
The programme is titled “Between Tides” based upon the concept of a journey through time and cultural landscapes, showcasing the evolution of chamber music from the late 18th century (Beethoven) to the 20th century (Shostakovich), and finally to the contemporary era (Takemitsu, Downie).
There is a world premiere of a work by New Zealand’s own Glen Downie, written especially for the Ghost Trio.
Ludwig van Beethoven, Piano Trio in D major Op 70 No.
2 in E minor Op 67

events.name: Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour
events.venue: Old St Paul's, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington
events.description:
"Presented by Strung Out Touring Jenny Mitchell - The Forest House Tour After opening for Kasey Chambers around Australia, award-winning songwriter Jenny Mitchell returns home for a national tour celebrating her acclaimed album Forest House.
Now based in Melbourne, the AU Review describes Jenny’s music as a “sublime slice of folk” and her new highly anticipated album, Forest House, is capturing fans across the motu and the globe.
- Old St Paul's - Sunday 18 August - Doors open at 7pm - Support from Katie Thompson NZ Best Country Artist Winner and 2 x Golden Guitar nominee, Jenny Mitchell, is a storyteller from the deep south of New Zealand with impactful songs full of grace and grit.
Her last album ‘Tug of War’ included the pivotal release of the 2022 APRA NZ Best Country Song ‘Trouble Finds a Girl’ and was described by Rolling Stone as an album, “worthy of every award it will inevitably collect.” No stranger to the road, Jenny was recently awarded a scholarship to perform at Nashville’s iconic AmericanaFest and has toured Australia and New Zealand extensively over the last decade - supporting artists including Fanny Lumsden (AU), Tami Neilson (NZ) and Nadia Reid (NZ) along the way.

We offer five classes for Novice, Beginners, Elementary, Pre-intermediate, and Intermediate levels. All classes run for 10 weeks small class sizes ranging from approximately 3 to 10 people. These classes are suitable for learners 14 years older and are held at the VUW Pipitea Campus.

events.long_description:
Speakers: Ilse Breitwieser, Research Associate – Botanist; Rob Smissen, Senior Researcher – Botanist. Allan Herbarium, Manaaki Whenua – Landcare Research, Lincoln.
Call them billy-buttons, drumstick flowers, billy balls, sun balls (in Australia) or woollyheads and puatea in New Zealand, or with their scientific name Craspedia (Gnaphalieae, Compositae/Asteraceae), these everlasting daisies are conspicuous members of many plant communities in New Zealand and Australia but remain an outstanding taxonomic challenge.
In 1961, based on a small number of available herbarium specimens, HH Allan’s Flora of New Zealand volume 1 recorded just 6 species in New Zealand. However, the 1992 and 1993 checklists of Tony Druce, who made extensive field observations and collected numerous herbarium specimens, distinguished more than 45 undescribed entities that might warrant taxonomic recognition.
Morphological variation in New Zealand Craspedia is complex, making the definition and circumscription of species problematic. At least in part, this difficulty is the legacy of an extremely rapid and recent diversification of the genus in New Zealand—a scenario that produces challenges for genetic as well as morphological approaches to delimiting species.

events.id: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions-1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions
events.venue: 1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand
events.description:
Doctors For Nutrition and MTM Charity invite you to an evening of inspiration, education, and connection at our next ‘Dine with a Doc’ dinner.
Join us for a presentation on ‘The Power of Plant-Based Nutrition and Lifestyle Interventions for Preventing Chronic Disease’—an event designed to empower everyone from healthcare professionals to health-conscious community members.
You will also be the first to hear about the new MTM charity, and about their mission.
Through easy-to-understand explanations of key concepts - such as endothelial dysfunction, intramyocellular lipid accumulation, and calorie density - you’ll discover how WFPB eating can dramatically improve health outcomes and transform lives.
After the presentation, join us for a panel discussion and a Q&A session with Dr Haitjema and Dr Luke Wilson.

events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
We're delighted to have Sereana Naepi in the shop to talk about Oceans Between Us: Pacific Peoples & Racism in Aotearoa, which she edited and was published by Auckland University Press.
Oceans Between Us is both a testimony and a call to action.
It documents the struggles of Pacific peoples and envisions a world beyond now.
A rallying cry for justice, a demand for equity and a catalyst for change, this book is not about survival alone – it’s about thriving.
All welcome!

events.id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point? This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction. Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.


Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 19th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

events.name: Love in Scent
events.venue: WORLD Wellington, 29 Manners Street
events.long_description:
Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.

events.id: The Parliamentary Launch of the NZCBIA Building Construction Report-Legislative Council Chamber - NZ Parliament, 1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Parliamentary Launch of the NZCBIA Building Construction Report
events.venue: Legislative Council Chamber - NZ Parliament, 1 Molesworth Street, Pipitea, Wellington
events.description:
The NZCBIA Building Construction Report, commissioned by the New Zealand Chinese Building Industry Association (NZCBIA) and led by renowned economist Shamubeel Eaqub, is fast becoming a respected voice in New Zealand’s property and construction sectors.
This year’s edition provides practical insights into key industry issues, with a particular focus on people, including workforce trends, productivity, training and upskilling, diversity, and the growing impact of AI.
Backed by data and real-world case studies, the report sheds light on the challenges and opportunities shaping the future of the sector.
The Parliamentary Launch brings together industry leaders, government representatives, and key stakeholders to mark the release of this influential report and to drive conversations that support the sustainable development of New Zealand’s building and construction industry.

events.id: Draw It Out - Teens block course-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Teens block course
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A fun and deep way for teens (11-17 year olds) to learn to process their feelings.
Theme: Listening to your inner voice
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Teenage years can often be filled with external influences, making it hard to listen to our own inner voice for guidance. This 4-session block course teaches teens how to use drawing to process hard feelings and access their own inner resources, which can be used at home as visual journaling.
Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
4.15pm-5.30pm
Tuesday 19th August - Metaphors for feelings
Tuesday 26th August - Uncovering needs
Tuesday 2nd September - Unlocking self-compassion
Monday 8th September - Curiosity in direction
Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Peace Over Panic: Rewiring the Anxious Mind
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.description:
How do we respond when the mind spirals, when uncertainty clouds our judgement, or when we find ourselves at a personal breaking point?
This workshop draws from ancient and time-tested wisdom found in yoga philosophy — especially the Bhagavad Gita — to explore how anxiety and inner conflict can become turning points for insight and conscious action.
Rather than avoiding or suppressing discomfort, the Gita offers a way to meet it — with clarity, honesty, and meaningful direction.
Through a blend of philosophical reflection and grounded tools, we’ll explore how to steady the mind and reconnect with deeper purpose in the face of pressure or doubt.
Meet your host, Sivananda Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass.

events.id: (Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down-Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: (Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
Reflections on the future
Join Chris at the National Library to mark the end of his time in the role with his reflections on the future of Aotearoa New Zealand poetry and readings from special guests.
"I left the doors to the past and the future unlocked ... "
Chris Tse’s three-year term as Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate ends on Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, when the next Poet Laureate will be announced: https://www.nzbookawards.nz/nat.../2016-national-poetry-day/
About the speakers
Chris Tse (he/him) was born and raised in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He studied film and English literature at Victoria University of Wellington, where he also completed an MA in Creative Writing at the International Institute of Modern Letters. In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate. His poetry, short fiction, and non-fiction have been recorded for radio and widely published in numerous journals, magazines and anthologies. He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
Ken Arkind is an American poet, author, performer, and educator originating from Steamboat Springs in Colorado. He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion. Ken now resides in Auckland and is a recent graduate from the Manukau Institute of Technology’s Creative Arts Programme.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music. Her poems started being published in her junior years of high school, and her debut chapbook anomalia was published by We Are Babies Press in April 2022. Her writing takes inspiration from antique stores, Tumblr text posts, and dead poets.
Gregory O’Brien is a poet, painter, author, curator, and editor. His most recent poetry publication is a collection of poems and paintings, House and contents (2022). Other recent publications include a book-length meditation on the Pacific, Always song in the water (2019) and the Ockham award winning book Don Binney: Flight Path (2023).
events.description:
Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate.
He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music.

events.id: BØLZER - Southern Tempest Tour: Wellington-154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: BØLZER - Southern Tempest Tour: Wellington
events.venue: 154 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
BØLZER - SOUTHERN TEMPEST TOUR
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla
21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar
Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr
An intuitive art project born from raw passion;
musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition
and enactment. Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical
medium largely inspired by – and seeking to
channel – the primeval essence of the human experience,
flashes of illumination will descend the sky
from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer
Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the
project first took physical form in 2008. Before
long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership
outshone any need for a bass player and
has since served to both challenge and empower the
band’s creativity. Following their 2010 live debut in
Zürich, BØLZER soon made a name for themselves
as the remarkable Swiss-Antipodean duo capable of
conjuring up mighty barriers of sound with nothing
but a ten-stringed guitar and an almost ritualistic
percussion style. The pair describe their own stage
experience as a form of spiritual rapture, an atavistic
vortex woven together from the profound union
of spectacle meeting spectator on a deeper plane.
events.description:
BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla 21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr An intuitive art project born from raw passion; musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition and enactment.
Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical medium largely inspired by – and seeking to channel – the primeval essence of the human experience, flashes of illumination will descend the sky from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the project first took physical form in 2008.
Before long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership outshone any need for a bass player and has since served to both challenge and empower the band’s creativity.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington-29 Waiapu Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington
events.venue: 29 Waiapu Rd, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
Towering seaweed forests and colourful sponge gardens lie just beneath the surface of Wellington’s coastline.
Like forests on land, these underwater habitats support a remarkable diversity of life, including treasured kaimoana species.
Yet they face growing pressure from human activity and environmental change.
Dr Nicole Miller will take us on a visual journey through Wellington’s Blue Belt, exploring current conservation successes and challenges.
Drawing on years of diving, photography and local restoration work, Nicole will highlight the beauty and fragility of these ecosystems and why it’s more important than ever to bring changes to the surface.

events.id: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review-3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review
events.venue: 3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The Government recently announced a review of the Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975, which comes as the statute approaches its 50-year milestone on 10th October. The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.”
Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.
Tickets are $35 per session, or $25 for students and SuperGold Card holders, and include one drink and light kai. Doors open 5:30pm. The exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata will remain open to view until 8pm.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum
Wednesday 20 August | 6pm–8pm
Tickets $25–$35
This series has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
Speakers:
Christopher Finlayson
The Hon. Christopher Finlayson served as an MP for 12 years, including as Attorney-General and Minister for Treaty of Waitangi Negotiations from 2008 to 2017. During his Ministerial career he also held a number of other portfolios. He is the co-author of He Kupu Taurangi: Treaty Settlements and the Future of Aotearoa New Zealand. He left politics in 2019 and now works for Bankside Chambers as a barrister.
Matanuku Mahuika
(Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa)
Matanuku Mahuika is one of Aotearoa’s leading Māori lawyers in private practice. He co-founded Kāhui Legal in 2003. Prior to establishing Kāhui Legal, Matanuku was a partner at Walters Williams & Co and in-house counsel at the Treaty of Waitangi Fisheries Commission.
This series has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.

The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.” Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.

events.name: Battle of the Wine Regions
events.venue: Rosella, 18 Majoribanks Street
events.long_description:
The best winemakers from across New Zealand will battle it out for bragging rights, and raise money for a charity dear to Rosella's heart at the same time. 
For a second year, three winemakers will put their best grape-crushing foot forward to match a wine from their home region with each course in a five-course degustation menu. Guests will vote for the best-matched wine for each course, scores will be tallied up, and winners will be crowned! 
All profits will go to Heart Kids Foundation, a charity that Rosella's owners received a lot of support from when their son was born with a congenital heart disease. This is their chance to give back to this great charity and provide the support needed for other families going through the same situation.

events.id: I-Sarn Thai KanTok-Tuk Tuk Thai Kitchen, 15 Hartham Place North-WOAP
events.name: I-Sarn Thai KanTok
events.venue: Tuk Tuk Thai Kitchen, 15 Hartham Place North
events.long_description:
Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.

In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.
Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing.

events.id: Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?-Level 13/18 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Before9: Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?
events.venue: Level 13/18 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for "Responsible AI - have we figured out what that means in practice?," an engaging Before9 (Breakfast event) discussing the latest strategic direction of the technology in Aotearoa New Zealand.
New Zealand's first national AI strategy has arrived, aiming to boost productivity and encourage the uptake of AI "with confidence." But as we move forward, a critical question remains: what does "responsible AI" actually look like in practice for businesses and organisations in Aotearoa? This panel discussion will delve into the nuances of the government's new strategy, exploring its impact on our collective journey. Our panel will unpack the challenges and opportunities presented by a "light-touch" regulatory approach and discuss how we can build a uniquely Kiwi framework for responsible AI in New Zealand.
Our panel will be made up of the following individuals:
Zoe Udy, Deputy Chair at TUANZ
Sasha Vlassoff, Senior Policy Advisor at InternetNZ
Plus one other
Zoe in particular will be able to give an update from our meeting with the Parliamentary cross-party caucus on AI.
We look forward to hosting you at this Before9.  This event is free for members of InternetNZ and TUANZ.  This is a number limited event to 30 individuals so make sure you register early.
Please note the formalities will start at 7:45am but you can arrive any time after 7:30am.
events.description:

events.id: Illicit Love-The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street-WOAP
events.name: Illicit Love
events.venue: The Bond Store, 21 Birmingham Street
events.long_description: Step into a world of secrets for this one-night-only prohibition-style speakeasy, packed with live jazz, bootleg cocktails, and a dance floor ready for rebels and romantics alike. Slip past the watchful eye of the ‘authorities’ and step into a world where love is bold, the drinks flow freely, and the music never stops. Enjoy handcrafted cocktails featuring The Bond Store’s award-winning spirits, paired with decadent bites designed for sharing. The night kicks off with big brass energy from a live jazz band, leading into a high-energy celebration of love, freedom, and the thrill of breaking the rules. Drape yourself in 1920s glamour, grab your partner in crime, and prepare for a night of indulgence, mischief, and unforgettable memories. But remember...loose lips sink ships, so keep the password hush-hush.

events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington City Chorus is a group of dedicated and talented women (and one man) who perform one of the few musical art forms that originate in the United States - Barbershop Harmony.
Wellington City Chorus is a chapter of Sweet Adelines International.
This non-profit organisation is dedicated to teaching, learning and singing four-part harmony, barbershop style, through performances and teaching, perpetuating and creating a love for this style of A Cappella singing in our community.
Wellington City Chorus is fortunate to have David Brooks as our Director – skilled in and enjoys the craft of barbershop and willingly passes on his knowledge.
As previous national champions Wellington City Chorus has represented New Zealand on the international stage in Las Vegas, Hawaii, Denver, Baltimore and St Louis.

Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
Because this is a reminder that politics isn't just about policies and power plays - it's about stories, people and the laughs that come with it.
Whether you're a political junkie, or just dipping your toes into current affairs, Three Gals One Beehive invites you to pull up a chair, pour a glass of wine and join the conversation that's as enlightening as it is entertaining: Whether it's recounting drama that’s reminiscent of a House of Cards episode or assessing the strategic manoeuvres that would be at home in The Queen’s Gambit, their podcast promises to make even the driest political topics engaging.

events.id: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Whāia te mātauranga hei oranga mō koutou: A Review
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai.
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum is proud to present the Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, an informative lecture series about the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The review is part of the coalition agreement between New Zealand First and National and will be led by an Independent Technical Advisory Group (ITAG), supported by Te Puni Kōkiri, to examine the whether the Waitangi Tribunal is “fit for purpose, not just for today, but for the generations to come.” Joining us to discuss the topic of reform are Former Attorney-General and Treaty Minister Christopher Finlayson, and Matanuku Mahuika, who co-chaired the Waitangi Tribunal’s own Strategic Direction Review Group in 2024.
Christopher Finlayson served as an MP for 12 years, including as Attorney-General and Minister for Treaty of Waitangi Negotiations from 2008 to 2017.
He co-founded Kāhui Legal in 2003.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Underwater Forests of Wellington
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.description:
Towering seaweed forests and colourful sponge gardens lie just beneath the surface of Wellington’s coastline.
Like forests on land, these underwater habitats support a remarkable diversity of life, including treasured kaimoana species.
Yet they face growing pressure from human activity and environmental change.
Dr Nicole Miller will take us on a visual journey through Wellington’s Blue Belt, exploring current conservation successes and challenges.
Drawing on years of diving, photography and local restoration work, Nicole will highlight the beauty and fragility of these ecosystems and why it’s more important than ever to bring changes to the surface.

Puck Lane Creative Workshops
Puck Lane Creative Workshops
Woodblock Artwork + Mixed Media
In collaboration with Treacle Lane and House of Puck, we invite you to a super fun evening of creative chaos—in the best possible way.
This workshop? We're building bold, beautiful mixed media artwork with woodblocks, nails, thread, and collage. It’s part art, part alchemy—all materials included, no stress required.
Just book your spot, show up, and let your inner maker run wild. The space is ambient, the vibes are high, and the snacks are not messing around. Sip something nice, hammer something gently, and create something you didn’t know you had in you.

events.id: Mosaic Design-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Mosaic Design
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Mosaic Design You'll be able to make several pieces of mosaic to your own design and after the completion of the course, will feel confident to carry on working on your own projects.
A list of materials and tools required (approximate cost $70, depending what you may already have at home) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.
Please wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.
By the end of the four-week course, you'll be able to: • Demonstrate the basic principles/techniques of mosaic design • Break and cut tiles correctly • Place tiles on the object • Stick pieces to flat and curved surfaces • Grout a mosaic piece • Use stones and shells in mosaics Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.id: Redacted- Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Redacted
events.venue: Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
An exciting and immersive original production, Redacted is a bold devised theatre work created entirely by the Year 2 and 3 drama students.
Bursting with energy and imagination, this vibrant piece blends dance, dialogue, monologue, music, and abstract art to explore the current state of Wellington, the arts, and the shifting world around us.
Through a series of compelling vignettes and live art moments, the students reflect on their place within the arts landscape today, diving into themes of the universe, taonga, Superman, and freedom of speech.
Honest, dynamic, and deeply creative, Redacted showcases the extraordinary voices of tomorrow’s artists as they grapple with what it means to express themselves in a constantly evolving world.
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford and Gavin Rutherford

events.id: Creative Mindfulness-Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Creative Mindfulness
events.venue: Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough
events.description:
Step away from the noise and into a space of calm and creativity.
In this gentle, guided workshop, we’ll explore simple yet powerful art-based mindfulness practices designed to help you slow down, reconnect with yourself, and find presence through making.
Using a mix of mark-making, colour exploration, and intuitive drawing, you’ll be encouraged to let go of outcomes and tune into the process—no pressure, no perfection, just peaceful creativity.
This special locals’ offering is a small thank you to those who continue to support Ventana and value the power of art to soothe and restore.

events.id: Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn how to photograph the night sky with this three-part workshop.
Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Thursday 21 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required, and we have pencilled Friday 22 August). The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.

events.id: Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt
If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.
Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.


In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.


You will discover:
what stops you from saying "no" when you really want to
how to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"
how to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict


Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets

events.venue: 45 Tory St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Honeymoon Around Asia: A Love Letter to Flavour
Pack your bags—Chow’s taking you on a romantic getaway through the flavours of Asia (no passport required
)
This five-course love affair is a journey through Thailand’s fiery passion, Japan’s delicate romance, Vietnam’s garden-fresh charm, Singapore’s bold intensity, and Korea’s comforting soul. Each dish is a love letter to its homeland—served with a playful twist and paired with mini Asia-inspired cocktails designed to make your tastebuds swoon
Expect an immersive vibe with house & disco beats, passport-style menus, and cheeky photo ops like our “Just Married to Dumplings
” station and “Love Letters Wall.” Whether you’re bringing your soulmate, your bestie, or your fellow foodie—it’s a night to indulge, laugh, and fall head-over-heels… for the food
One night only. Five courses. Five destinations. One unforgettable culinary getaway.
General release tickets are on sale from 12pm Friday 27 June
Spots are limited — Book Now !!

events.id: Nelson Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- The Ridgeway Nelson, Nelson-Event Brite
events.name: Nelson Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: The Ridgeway Nelson, Nelson
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: Honeymoon Around Asia-Chow, Level 1, 45 Tory St-WOAP
events.name: Honeymoon Around Asia
events.venue: Chow, Level 1, 45 Tory St
events.long_description:
A celebration of romance, adventure, and culinary delight. This five-course journey invites you to explore the diverse and vibrant flavours of Asia, each course representing a love letter to a different destination.

From Thailand’s spicy heat to Japan’s delicate sushi, Vietnam’s fresh herbs, Singapore’s bold flavours, and Korea’s comforting warmth, each dish tells a beautiful story of romance and culture. The atmosphere will be filled with house and disco beats, setting the stage for a playful, immersive experience. The interactive passport-style menus guide you through the adventure, while fun photo opportunities like a “Love Letters Wall” and the “Just Married to Dumplings” photo station let you capture the magic of the evening.

With mini cocktail pairings featuring creative, Asia-inspired concoctions, this event is all about connection, indulgence, and the joy of sharing a meal with those you love, whether it’s your partner, bestie, or fellow food enthusiast. Five courses, five destinations, and one unforgettable night of culinary bliss.

events.id: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
AWHI Yoga and Wellbeing’s accredited 200hr YTT program is a comprehensive and thorough journey into becoming a 200 hr certified Yoga Teacher.
We are the only vinyasa yoga teacher training in the world that blends Te Ao Māori and ancient yoga wisdoms, offering a uniquely 'Aotearoa' experience while retaining universal relevance for teaching and practicing yoga in any part of the world.
Our training is suitable for individuals interested in becoming a yoga teacher, or those looking to take a personal journey towards deepening your own practice and knowledge.
Either way, we guarantee a transformative and life-changing experience that will deepen your relationship to yoga, others, Aotearoa and your self.
A $1,000 deposit reserves your spot.

events.id: Netherfield Ball-Homewood, 50 Homewood Ave-WOAP
events.name: Netherfield Ball
events.venue: Homewood, 50 Homewood Ave
events.long_description:
Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life. This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.

Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom. As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.

The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era. With the glow of garden lighting, live music filling the air, and an atmosphere brimming with romance, you’ll feel as if you’ve stepped into Austen’s world. Dancing will play a central role in the evening, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the grace and grandeur of the Regency social scene.

Whether you’re an Austen devotee, a fan of Bridgerton, or simply drawn to the allure of historical elegance, this event promises to captivate your imagination and senses. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a night filled with charm, sophistication, and timeless romance.
events.description:
Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life.
This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.
Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom.
As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.
The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era.

events.id: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender-Hamilton-Humanitix
events.name: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender
events.venue: Hamilton
events.description:
You don’t feel you’ve the right to pursue your dreams You don’t have the confidence to speak up and share ideas You’d love to dress differently but you’re scared what people will say.
You’re doing what’s expected of you, but it feels like you’re leading someone else’s life.
This workshop is for you If lack of confidence is holding you back If you’re struggling with leadership If you’ve been told you’re too much What we'll cover in the workshop Build a foundation that’ll empower you to take risks, overcome fear and self-doubt, and do the things you’ve always wanted to do.
A fun day of laughter and connection for anyone who wants to explore how they can take up more space in the world.
Meet your irreverent badass hosts Miraka (Shelly) Davies Described as the lovechild of Brené Brown and P!nk, aged 37, Shelly walked away from her family’s five-generation commitment to conservative Christianity and started the exploratory period of her life, also known as “fucking shit up.” A people pleaser in recovery, she infiltrates organisations on the pretext of giving writing training and subverts teams to question the rules, while using her hard-won lessons in badassery to inspire you to know yourself, love yourself, find power, and have joy.

events.name: The Disciplinary Process
events.venue: Te Awe Awe Street Palmerston North, Manawatū-Whanganui
events.description:
This course will cover how to effectively manage the disciplinary process.
This is where the disciplinary process followed has resulted in the employee taking personal grievance action, claiming they have been unjustifiably dismissed or disadvantaged.
Key audience: This course is suitable for HR practitioners and managers who are responsible for the disciplinary process in their organisations.
Learning outcomes Understand procedural fairness and justifiable reasons for initiating disciplinary action.
Improve supporting documentation such as letter-writing, note-taking and investigative materials.

Anna Banas

events.name: Electra Business After Five - 21 August 2025
events.venue: 10 Bath Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We're delighted to welcome Jerry Shearman from Central Economic Development Agency (CEDA) which connects people, place and business in Manawatū. 
 
Jerry, a former scientist with a passion for data and insights, believes strongly in evidence-based decision-making.  With over 15 years’ experience in senior leadership roles within the tertiary education sector, Jerry brings a wealth of expertise in strategic thinking, stakeholder engagement, and turning vision into action, as evidenced by some of the exciting things happening in the area which Jerry will share with us. 
 
Join us for an evening of insight and inspiration and hear one of the region’s most dedicated leaders talk about: 
Te Utanganui - designed to be New Zealand's third major distribution hub, complementing the Golden Triangle (Auckland-Hamilton-Tauranga) and the Christchurch-Rolleston node. Te Utanganui is a transformative multi-modal logistics and distribution hub located in Palmerston North, it serves as a vital link in the national freight network currently going through transformational changes connecting road, rail, air, and sea transport systems. 
Manawatū Regional Food Strategy, our Land Diversification initiative and the complementary capability between regions
Regional NZ - the need to work together, shared populations, future growth plans
Electra Business After Five
Thursday 21st August 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin

events.id: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Social Media Marketing for Small Enterprises: Visual Impact Whether you are just starting out or already running a business, having an online and social media presence is essential.
While most of us know in theory that we need a marketing plan, a social media strategy, a consistent post schedule, and engaging reels for TikTok, the reality is that every business is unique, and your approach should reflect that.
With attention spans shorter than ever, your audience will move on within seconds if they are not engaged—they see images first and then only start reading the text.
In this course, we will explore different types of content suitable for your specific needs and audiences, how to create it or where to source it, how to develop the right visual strategy for your online presence, what tools to use, and how to implement it immediately.
By the end of the course, you will have an outstanding online presence.

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
Please contact for booking: indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

So just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.id: Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network-29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Sing Sing Film Fundraiser - Arts in Corrections Network
events.venue: 29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Arts Access Aotearoa for a powerful evening of film and purpose as we screen the critically acclaimed movie Sing Sing — based on a true story of redemption, creativity and the transformative power of the arts within the prison system.
Sing Sing tells the story of incarcerated men who find hope and humanity through a prison theatre programme. It reflects the values Arts Access Aotearoa upholds: that the arts can break down walls, build confidence and create change, inside and out.
Tickets are $25 and proceeds support the Arts in Corrections Network.
Before the screening, you will hear from actor, playwright and musician Jamie McCaskill (of the Māori Sidesteps musical comedy group), and playwright and columnist Dave Armstrong. Together, they led a powerful theatre and storytelling course at Whanganui Prison, supporting and transformation behind the wire.
Come along and support us to continue this important work.
About Arts in Corrections
Arts programmes in prisons can be powerful pathways to healing and change. They help people restore their sense of identity, build resilience and develop skills that support rehabilitation and reintegration into the community. By nurturing creative potential and cultural identity these programmes foster personal transformation.
Arts Access Aotearoa leads a national network that supports Corrections staff and community educators and groups to design and deliver meaningful arts programmes in prisons and Community Corrections..

events.id: Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

events.venue: Utauta Street Waikanae, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Saluti e baci! A Taste of Sicily-Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Saluti e baci! A Taste of Sicily
events.venue: Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.description:
An evening of Sicilian wine and tapas with Tonic and Lucas Monge of Del Mundo Imports.
Since 1851, five generations of the Rallo family have produced some of Sicily’s finest wines at their Donnfugata winery.
In recent years they have innovated winemaking and sustainability practices on the island while showcasing traditional varietals such as Nero D’Avola, Grillo and Zebibbo.
Join Tonic and Del Mundo’s Lucas Monge for an exploration of Sicily via wine and antipasti/dessert pairings.
Thursday, 21 August, 6:30pm Registration via Tonic’s website.

events.id: Sachi | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Sachi | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
One of New Zealand's most celebrated live acts, dance music duo SACHI have today announced two shows across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau.
Tickets for SACHI’s shows in Wellington and Auckland will be available to purchase by the General Public on Tuesday, July 15 at 12pm local time.
My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences on Monday, July 14 at 1pm until Tuesday, July 15 at 11am local time.
Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz.
Each of the EPs’ title characters represents a different phase of SACHI’s discography — from their introduction on Lunch With Bianca, to establishing themselves internationally on Nights With Ruby (created while living in LA pre-pandemic), to the full-circle evolution of their most refined and lustrous body of work to date, Breakfast With Ella.

events.id: The Wedding Trio-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wedding Trio
events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Way back in January 2023, Jake, Dan and Mark formed an instant rapport on the bandstand of a garden party.
With a nod to famous saxophone trios such as the Sonny Rollins band of A Night at the Village Vanguard and Lee Konitz' Motion, The Wedding Trio reinterprets classic jazz standards and original compositions by Jake Baxendale, utilising the space afforded by the absence of a chordal instrument to investigate groove, polyphony and interaction, all in the spirit of freewheeling, rambunctious fun that any good wedding party will conjure up!

events.id: Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington-10 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington
events.venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hi queer friends who love crafts-have I got the film for you! NZ feature film Went Up The Hill will have its Wellington Premiere at the NZ International Film Festival on 21 August at the Embassy at 830pm-get your ticket now!
Come along and be amongst the first to see NZ feature film Went Up The Hill from queer NZ filmmaker Sam Van Grinsven.
Tickets to the Wellington screening are available for $26 at the NZIFF website:
https://www.nziff.co.nz/.../te.../went-up-the-hill/
The film is also screening at NZIFF in centres around the country including Auckland, Christchurch, Dunedin amongst others!
Shot in Canterbury and funded by the NZ Film Commission, the film stars Vicky Krieps (The Phantom Thread) and Dacre Montgomery (Stranger Things) in a poetic ghost story that centres on two queer characters-a woman and her dead wife’s estranged son -as they are each haunted by her spirit. The film premiered to critical acclaim as a Special Presentation at Toronto Film Festival in 2024 where Sam was hailed by Hollywood Reporter as already having the ‘control of a master’ in a film that is ‘captivating', ‘elliptical' and 'technically stunning’.
Sam Van Grinsven has a passion for queer interpretation of genre and seeing queer characters within spaces that historically have not been explored as diversely.
Here's the trailer link-we hope you can join us!

events.id: LHPC Antenatal Class 8 2025-12 Britannia Street Lower Hutt, Wellington 5012-Event Brite
events.name: LHPC Antenatal Class 8 2025
events.venue: 12 Britannia Street Lower Hutt, Wellington 5012
events.description:
Lower Hutt Parents Centre ispart of a national voluntary-led, not-for-profit organisation who provide high quality ChildbirthEducation Classes (Antenatal Classes), Baby & You Classes and other Parent EducationClasses for Hutt Valley families.
We are here to help.
Our comprehensive Antenatal Classes lead by qualified Childbirth Educators will help you prepare for labour, birth and the early days with a newborn.
From time to time a 'weekend intensive' course which runs for two full days is held on consecutive Saturdays.
Courses cost $220 (including booking fee) The course covers: • Nutrition and exercise during pregnancy • Labour signs and stagesWe • Pain relief options and interventions • The birth process • Breastfeeding and newborn care • Transition to Parenthood and practical parenting • A tour of Hutt Hospital maternity unit, either physical or virtual tour We encourage you to enrol early to ensure you get a spot.

events.id: Beervana-Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy-WOAP
events.name: Beervana
events.venue: Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s boldest, hoppiest, and most delightfully weird beer festival. This is no ordinary tasting event, it’s a full-blown sensory adventure where brewers go wild, food gets fancy, and the unexpected is always on tap. 

Expect more than 60 breweries pouring over 300 unique brews—from hazy IPAs and fruited sours to beer cocktails and non-alcoholic surprises. 

But Beervana isn’t just about the beer. It’s a feast for all senses: think whitebait fritters from Boulcott St Bistro, Korean fried chicken, Mahurangi oysters. Add in live music, quirky brewery stands (yes, there’s a Best Stand vote), and unexpected entertainment and you’ve got a festival that you'll come away from with a greater knowledge of great beer, a belly full and plenty of fun memories with your mates.

events.long_description:
Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.
With headline act, Kura Forrester
Kura Forrester is an actor, writer and comedian, a face you have definitely seen on the telly including Kiwi shows such as: Golden Boy, Shortland Street, Super City and The Adventures of Suzy Boon.
Winner of the 2019 Billy T Award, Kura is fast becoming one of the standout comedian actors of New Zealand.
And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee

She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards
Along with
Sandy Burton
Alayne Dick
Leki Lyons
and Mike Fowler

events.id: Island Bay art auction and art weekend-3 Thames St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Island Bay art auction and art weekend
events.venue: 3 Thames St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This is our biennial showcase of original New Zealand art and celebration of the work of incredible artists and creatives - from established to emerging.
This glorious weekend of art kicks off at 6.30 pm on Friday 22 with the thrilling auction. Anyone can bid on an original and unique piece - from acrylics to watercolours, ceramics and jewelry. Previous auctions have featured contributions from Sheyne Tuffery, Juliet Best, Karl Fritsch, and Nicola Jackson.
This year contributors include Greta Menzies, Ewan McDougall and Carrie Carey, to name a few. Friday night's auction is free to attend, but it is an 18+ licensed event.
On Saturday and Sunday, the school opens its doors to allow you to wander through the exhibition at your own pace (with a coffee in hand). Art works will be on sale all weekend, so you could pick up a piece or two.
Not only that, but this year also sees the auction host, Island Bay School, celebrate its 125th anniversary. There'll be an exhibition featuring stories, photos and memories of the school, its tamariki and kaiako.
This event is a fundraiser for Island Bay School to help support its amazing Artist in Residence and other art-based programmes. These give the tamariki space in which to experiment, play and create alongside some phenomenal artists.

events.id: 96 Originals-Logan Brown Restaurant, 192 Cuba St-WOAP
events.name: 96 Originals
events.venue: Logan Brown Restaurant, 192 Cuba St
events.long_description:
Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

events.id: DILLI-24-Loretta, 181 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: DILLI-24
events.venue: Loretta, 181 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.
events.description:
A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India.
Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.
Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish.
In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes.

events.id: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters-42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters
events.venue: 42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.description:
Join Big Brothers Big Sisters of Wellington and Guest Speaker Glen Denham on Friday 22 August at the Petone Club, Udy Street, Petone for a delicious buffet breakfast, exciting live auction, raffles and more!
Glen Denham is the Principal of Wellington College, where he channels his lifelong passion for teaching and school leadership.
Before transitioning into teaching, Glen was a national basketball player, earning a spot as a Tall Black for 16 years during the 1980s and 1990s.
As team captain for 13 of those years, he was regarded as one of New Zealand’s top players and a key figure in the country's basketball legacy.
His journey from professional athlete to educator has shaped his dynamic leadership style, blending discipline, resilience, and teamwork with a deep commitment to nurturing youth.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.venue: Old St Paul's, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s (OSP) will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
About the Artists Ludus is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard.
Stephen Gallagher is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance.
It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.” About the Venue Built in 1866, Old St Paul’s is a prime example of timber Gothic Revival architecture and one of Aotearoa’s most important historic places.

events.long_description:

Japanese comfort food, Miso, is tasty, nutritious, and healthy...Why don't you make your own??
Sat 23rd August 2025 12pm-1pm
Crofton Downs Primary School Hall, Wellington (https://maps.app.goo.gl/bbQNHJHRGo4c6VGK7)

*Your reservation will be confirmed once your payment processed.
*Please understand the fee is basically non-refundable due to the arrangement of raw ingredients.

events.id: Feed Your Senses-Foxglove Bar & Kitchen, 33 Queens Wharf-WOAP
events.name: Feed Your Senses
events.venue: Foxglove Bar & Kitchen, 33 Queens Wharf
events.long_description:
Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

You’ll not only produce fantastic charms but gain essential silversmithing skills such as soldering, shaping and polishing, as well as learning top tips for how to create stunning and meaningful jewellery on a budget.

bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby.

events.name: Jewellery Making - Vintage Silver Charms
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Create your own personalised silver charms for chain bracelets!
You’ll not only produce fantastic charms but gain essential silversmithing skills such as soldering, shaping and polishing, as well as learning top tips for how to create stunning and meaningful jewellery on a budget.
You can bring your own bracelet to adorn with the charms you make, or if you choose you can purchase one of our top-quality NZ made silver bracelets directly from the tutor in class ($25 cash please if you wish to purchase a bracelet).
By the end of the course you’ll be able to: Design and create a set of 3 silver charms using fine jewellery-making techniques Use a jeweller’s saw to cut sheet silver into simple shapes Use jeweller’s files and sandpapers to refine silver forms hammers and steel punches to imprint letters, symbols and textures into sheet silver Use jewellery pliers to bend silver hoops and/or a soldering torch to connect charms to your bracelet Use polishing tools to shine and finish your silver jewellery creations Please wear closed-in footwear suitable for a workshop environment.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish-100 Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
events.venue: 100 Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!

events.description:
Our popular weekend block classes are the best way for keen makers to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment!
It runs from Saturday 23 August for 6 weeks until Saturday 27 September, 10am-1pm.
This class is for regular students at Ōtaki who have already completed a beginner's 4 week block as a minimum.

events.id: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market-Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market
events.venue: Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough
events.description:
Craft and recycle market including a drop in indigo dying business and other potential fabric design.
www.thunderpants.co.nz/ We’re a small, ethical, family-owned and operated company, based in the Wairarapa, producing New Zealand made cheeky goodness for your bum (and other areas) from regeneratively grown Australian cotton.
The Thunderpants story began in Nelson in 1995, when we were design students frustrated by irritating undies.
The challenge was on to create the ultimate comfy undie that wouldn’t go up your bum… Now, twenty years on, Thunderpants has grown to produce nearly 50,000 Thunderpants garments a year including kids clothes, swimwear, yoga pants, leggings, tops and camis.
Our focus has always been on producing underwear and clothing of exceptional quality and design using fun colourful prints and this ethos permeates all aspects of the clothing we produce.
