events.venue: Dixon Street Masterton, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.description:
In this 60-minute downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s previous summers, namely the large ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures.
A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn Cost: $5 (cash only, please).

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

Clayton Taylor and Nathan Torvik bring us The Early Bobs, their heartfelt homage to Dylan’s golden years.
Think harmonicas, blistering guitar breaks, and especially a voice that fans say “does Bob better than Dylan”.
From the Dust Bowl ballads to the biting protest songs, they’ll take you from 1961 to 1979 with authenticity, soul, and a whole lot of magic.
If you love Dylan—or just good stories wrapped in unforgettable tunes—these are your guys.

events.name: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
The English Locust is the folk/blues solo project of Wellington musician Jim Bailey.
The English Locust describes his sound as " Bob Dylan if he was goth", fusing the melancholy poeticism of groups like the Smiths and Joy Division with the musical stylings of folk and Delta Blues.
With his solo project The English Locust, he was a regional finalist in this years Battle of the bands, being the only soloist to make it that far in this years competition.
The group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mabudungun word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.
Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

events.id: The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers-Rogue and Vagabond, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers
events.venue: Rogue and Vagabond, Wellington
events.description:
From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses...
The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money.
Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'.
Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone.
Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.

events.id: Breaker bay Raranga-150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breaker bay Raranga
events.venue: 150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.
events.description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to: Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome.
We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
• An old towel • Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke • Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools • Some tools are available to borrow • Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required • Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke Koha appreciated, not required If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.

events.name: Pinot run
events.venue: Matahiwi Estate Winery, 286 Paierau Rd
events.long_description:
Get ready for a thrilling journey where classic cars, delicious food, and exceptional wine come together. Calling all car clubs, classic car enthusiasts, and lovers of fine wine—this is a one-of-a-kind classic car rally that combines the beauty of Wairarapa’s stunning vineyards with the excitement of a fun-filled rally to Brewtown in Upper Hutt.

Along the way, participants will stop at various local food producers to take on foodie-focused challenges, making this event a feast for the senses and also feel good factor knowing you'll be helping raise funds for Hospice NZ, making this event both a celebration of cars and a meaningful way to give back. So, polish your car, pack a bottle of Pinot, and get ready for an unforgettable day of food, fun, and philanthropy!

events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Step into the cozy charm of the Ventana studio and spend a hands-on crafternoon learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower- a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.
In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand. It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.

Location: Ventana Art Space
7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough

events.id: The Life of Henry the Fifth-1 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Life of Henry the Fifth
events.venue: 1 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth

events.id: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This two-day class is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes.
The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.

events.id: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures.
Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.
If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back.
Techniques: - Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’ - Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal - Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal - Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces - Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces - Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery Project : 1 Ring with sea glass (silver, brass and copper options) Materials: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.
Daylong workshop options on either Sunday 20 July or Sunday 24 August.

events.name: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop
events.venue: The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
A fun, relaxing and creative workshop to make a magical clay house which can be used with real or fake candles.
We will use my hand drawn templates, white clay, slab building and modelling techniques, and imprint with fabrics to produce stunning clear glazed white houses.
Also includes the option of adding some dashes of colour accents using underglazes and coloured slips.
I love making houses!
You can add birds, cats, window boxes or whatever inspires to your creation.

events.id: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment!
The course starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm-5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver.
An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.
Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

events.id: Kids Rock 4 Palestine-9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kids Rock 4 Palestine
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kids Rock For Palestine
One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
This isn’t just a concert, it’s a movement. Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.
Do you want to volunteer to help? Email aotearoa2gaza@gmail.com
ALL UNDER 18s MUST ATTEND WITH A PARENT OR GUARDIAN.

events.id: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine-Martinborough 5711, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine
events.venue: Martinborough 5711, New Zealand
events.description:
What to Expect: Huntress Experience: Guided by "The Huntress", Jannine Rickards, a passionate advocate for sustainable living and wild wine, you’ll be introduced to a deep, meaningful connection between the land, the food we consume, and the wines we enjoy.
Alongside her teachings, you’ll discover how Huntress Wines reflect indigenous food-growing practices and how each bottle celebrates the connection between the land’s cycles and the wines that grow from them.
Wine Pairing: As you absorb all the knowledge from the Huntress and Butcher, you’ll enjoy expertly paired wines throughout the experience.
Huntress Wines have been carefully chosen to complement each stage of the workshop, with a focus on organic, terroir-driven bottles that reflect the spirit of the land and match exquisitely with the charcuterie selection prepared.
This is a one-of-a-kind workshop that celebrates sustainable practices, the art of butchery, and the symbiotic relationship between the food we eat and the wine we drink.

events.name: It's in the Ballot - SWDC - Martinborough Community Board - In-studio
events.venue: Texas Street Martinborough, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Kath Irvine talks Fruit Trees: Winter-58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kath Irvine talks Fruit Trees: Winter
events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
Top of the fruit tree to-do-list at this time of year, is to check your fruit trees for health and vigour before they get going again in spring.
With that knowledge in hand, you'll be able to decide whether or not your trees need compost or mulch and whether to prune them now or in summer.
I'll show you how to prime them for the season ahead and set the scene for good health - get out ahead of pests, disease and poor vigour - its way easier and a lot more fun!
Coffee + tea + home baking for sale from 2.30.
Talk starts at 3.

events.id: Tony Yan Tong Chen-Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Tony Yan Tong Chen
events.venue: Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae
events.description:
Born in Auckland, Tony Yan Tong Chen has performed throughout New Zealand, North America and Europe.
Winner of New Zealand's Wallace International Piano Competition in 2019, Tony has since been placed in a number of other International competitions.
His Waikanae concert will open with Beethoven's concise Opus 90 Sonata.
A delightfully playful Chopin Waltz then introduces Chopin's great Bb Minor Sonata - the one frequently known as "the Funeral March Sonata" and considered to be one of the greatest piano sonatas ever written.
The next part of the concert will be devoted to the music of Alexander Scriabin, a Russian composer whose early music was greatly influenced by Chopin.

events.name: Greta O’Leary and Goodnight My Darling - River Dark Tour
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
This August 24th join alt-folk songwriter Greta O'Leary & Te Whanganui a Tara artist Goodnight My Darling for one intimate and special show at San Fran, performing new and recently released works in celebration of emergence and O’Learys debut record 'River Dark'.
‘A folk-rooted aesthetic that feels almost gothic’ (RNZ).
River Dark' is O'Leary's debut.
I was in the field below the house, I was at the pond with the dog, I played make believe longer than most.
I was taught to be quiet.” ***************************************** Goodnight My Darling is the vision and project of up and coming Te Whanganui a Tara based singer-songwriter Maxine Macaulay.

events.id: Terry Shore-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Terry Shore
events.venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Terry Shore has been a real stalwart around the local Wellington music scene for over 30 years, playing his own original music both solo and with the Volun Terry Band.

He has 5 albums, 2 more on the way, and 3 EP's to his credit since releasing his first Poly Rhythm album in 2010. For the last 20 years he has run a programme on Wellington Access Radio showcasing unknown songwriters called Terry's Songwriters Show which airs on Saturdays at 2:30pm.

Terry has written memorable original catchy pop songs such as Anything, Dancing On The Line Island Love, Galactica Calling, The Daleks Are Coming In and many more.

He will be playing at the Undercurrent on Sunday 24th August from 5:30pm performing his originals with electric acoustic guitar and MP3 backing tracks. Stay on after the Sunday Jazz and see Terry for a good entertaining show!

Sunday 24th August
5:30pm
$15 online/ door
$20 for entry and CD

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

events.description:
Join Aotearoa's pre-eminent Bob Dylan tribute band for a night of rollicking rockin' folkin' funkin' songs from the Bobster - recognised as one of the worlds greatest songwriters.
We have 2000 plus songs to choose from so no - we're not doing them all, just a selection of his greatest hits, some deep cuts into obscurity, and ones we think are worthy of an airing.
Our ten piece band is packed to the gunwales with drums, guitars, brass section, singers, and keyboards to replicate the sound of the man, but also provide our own interpretations of some songs.
Our band members come from all manner of musical outlets, from the Mockers and Let's Planet to the Balkanistas and the Wooden Box Band.
Don't think twice, Lay your lady lay down and get your ticket now cos - y'know This Wheel's on Fire and there ain't no stoppin' the Dylan train.

events.id: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
*Limited door sales for $25* *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

Pōneke’s best dressed improv company PopRox are excited to bring their signature format back to Circa in 2025 after a year of sold-out shows in 2024.
Featuring an hour and 15mins of hot improvisers, long-form narrative work and more laughs than you have lung capacity for, this show is sure to have you “frequently laughing so hard [your] chest hurts” — Wellingtonista. DATES: 30 March, 27 April, 25 May, 27 July, 24 August, 28 September, 26 October, 23 November
Circa Theatre’s new cafe, bar and brasserie Chouchou

events.venue: 181 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Alpine Odyssey adventure evening in store.
There'll be some stories, yarns and tales of adventure, questions answered, plus drinks and nibbles.
Come meet Laurence Mote and Huw Kingston at their half way point on their Alpine Odyssey tour of NZ.
They're riding the length of the Motu and stopping to ski at every ski field along the way, (25-26 apparently).
In their words, they are; "Once again partnering with Save the Children, our journey will raise funds for climate adaptation and resilience projects in the South Pacific, our island nation neighbours who are right on the frontline of climate change".

events.id: Audio Described Show - Mamma Mia! The Musical, Wellington-Courtenay Place, Wellington, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Audio Described Show - Mamma Mia! The Musical, Wellington
events.venue: Courtenay Place, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
MAMMA MIA! IS BRINGING THE PARTY TO WELLINGTON!
My, my, how can you resist the world's favourite feel-good musical as it brings the good times and sunshine to the St James Theatre. Since first opening in 1999, this exhilarating smash-hit has become a global phenomenon, thrilling over 70 million people worldwide. MAMMA MIA! is a jukebox musical featuring the timeless songs of the legendary Swedish pop group ABBA. With its heart warming tale and infectious music, MAMMA MIA! has become one of the world's most beloved and successful musicals.
When: Wednesday, 27 August, touch tour at 5.45pm, audio described performance at 7.30pm
Where: St James Theatre, 77-81 Courtenay Place, Wellington 6011
Run time: 2 hours 35 mins, including 20 min interval
Tickets: $60, plus booking fees. A free companion ticket is available.
To book: contact the Ticketmaster Group Booking line on 09 970 9745, or email groups@ticketmaster.co.nz. A $5 service fee per transaction applies.
Let them know at time of booking how many headsets you need, if you will be attending the touch tour and if you will be attending with a guide dog.
Arrive at 5.30pm for the touch tour at 5.45pm.
On the night of the performance, tickets and headsets can be collected from The St James Foyer area (Stalls foyer, ground floor) from 6.30pm

events.id: DOMUS (ESP, AU) / Juniper May-272 Taranaki Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: DOMUS (ESP, AU) / Juniper May
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
DOMUS: the duo of Tarik Rahim (Spain) and Mo Aung (Australia) - guide a journey through live improvisational soundscapes incorporating field recordings, synth textures and ethereal vocals.
Their performances reflect a fusion of their diverse influences - from lofi psychedelic to abstract electronic beats, contemporary neofolk and a merging of their respective South American and Southeast Asian heritage.
While being accomplished artists in their own right with this project they blend their sounds into a unified, compelling and resonant experience.
https://domuss.bandcamp.com/album/you-lead-me-into-silence
---
Juniper May is the latest solo project of Pōneke artist Lora May. Using an SP-404, she channels and transfigures samples of found sounds, synths and field recordings into melodic, distant and estranged pop songs.
$20 presales available via UTR
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

events.id: Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
The Men’s Circle is a free, supportive gathering for men to connect, share openly, and grow together. Whether you're navigating life changes, seeking community, or simply wanting a space to be heard, you're welcome here.
Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
Stay afterwards for a nourishing, plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a powerful way to extend the connection beyond the circle. This gathering is not run for profit—Andre is simply passionate about creating spaces for genuine connection.
What to Expect in the Circle:
Gathering in Circle: We sit in a circle to foster a sense of unity and equality.
Centering In: A short meditation or silence helps us arrive and ground.
Talking Object: A shared object moves around—only the person holding it speaks.
Optional Sharing: Speak if you feel moved. You’re always welcome to pass.
Active Listening: No interruptions, advice, or feedback—just presence.
Confidentiality: What's shared in the circle, stays in the circle.
Our Shared Agreements:
Speak from the “I”: Share from your own experience, not on behalf of others.
No fixing or judging: This is not a space to solve, but to witness.
Be present: Share what’s alive for you right now.
Respect and trust: We uphold a culture of care, confidentiality, and non-judgment.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
................................................................................................
Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets
...............................................................................................
Make Thursdays your night to connect and take a break from your week. Events range from creative workshops, wellness courses to entertaining experiences. All within a down-to-earth and welcoming space. Each event wraps up with a plant-based dinner and dessert.
...............................................................................................
Bhakti Lounge
1/175 Vivian Street
Wellington

events.id: Sound Healing Experience-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Sound Healing Experience
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!
Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.
With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.
What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!
Why You Won’t Want to Miss This
A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound
A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal
Limited spaces
Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.
Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?
Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud Claudio Escutia
Instagram Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)
Facebook Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music

events.name: Steps To Success - The recipe to competing at your best
events.venue: 10 Surrey St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you become the best athlete possible. No matter your level, weather you are a beginner, an amatuer or a pro, this workshop has the recipe to start competing at your best.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and performance focus
2. Physical Prep & Recovery – Injury prevention, recovery tips, and training smarter
3. Nutrition for Success – Fuel your body right
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer:
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Olivia White:

Certified Better Business Analyst (CBBA) – Wellington (Two-Day Certification Course, Exam and Certificate)
Ready to take your business analysis career to the next level? The CBBA course is Wellington’s practical, industry-recognised certification for anyone serious about growing their BA capability and impact.
What you’ll get:
In-depth BA skills: Master the full business analysis lifecycle—from strategy and stakeholder management to requirements and solution delivery.
Certification that counts: Walk away with your Certified Better Business Analyst credential, backed by local employers and the BBAI community.
Real-world learning: Work through Wellington-focused case studies, hands-on exercises, and group discussions designed for today’s public sector and business environment.
Career connections: Meet fellow BAs, connect with local leaders, and get personalised advice on your next career step.
Who should attend?
Practicing business analysts ready for certification and career growth
Project professionals, change leads, and digital specialists wanting deeper BA expertise
Wellington-based professionals looking for a recognised BA qualification and community
Next cohort: End of August, Wellington CBD
Spaces are limited. Reserve your spot and join the region’s growing network of Certified Better Business Analysts!

events.id: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a one-day workshop designed to elevate your leadership skills by delving into complex problem-solving and equity-focused educational strategies.
Developed and led by Dr. Jacqui Patuawa and Distinguished Professor Emeritus Viviane Robinson, this workshop builds on your existing expertise in leading learning, focusing on the use of double-loop thinking to address underachievement.
As Mumford et al. (2000) stated, “effective leadership behaviour fundamentally depends upon the leader’s ability to solve the kinds of complex social problems that arise in organisations.” In this session, you will: Build trust and foster respectful dialogue.
Accurately identify and analyse challenges affecting student outcomes.
Develop effective solutions that promote equitable educational success.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson’s Terrier, Worrier ‘a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person’.
Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson’s work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is filmmaker, writer, and artist Rachel O’Neill’s Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.name: It's in the Ballot - HCC - Monday 25th August Production Day Pass-In-studio
events.venue: Queens Drive Lower Hutt, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
It starts on Monday 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Monday 13 October, 5.30-pm - 8 pm.
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals.

events.name: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

Understand essential health and safety components and how they relate to your legal duties.

events.id: When the Family Fractures: Working Confidently with Separated Families- Taranaki Street Wellington,-Event Brite
events.name: When the Family Fractures: Working Confidently with Separated Families
events.venue: Taranaki Street Wellington,
events.description:
Parental Separation affects a significant proportion of our clients, yet most practitioners receive minimal training in managing these complex family dynamics.
It will help clinicians who feel uncertain when separation dynamics emerge in individual therapy, or who are struggling with managing consent issues and parent involvement.
Especially if you are worried your therapeutic recommendations might complicate legal matters; you're unsure when to take on these cases and when to refer; or your between-session workload with these clients is unsustainable.
You'll Leave Knowing: evidence-based interventions that work in separated family contexts how separation impacts child development and attachment tools to identify red flags, know which cases to accept and when to refer when you need both parents' consent (and when you don't) how to prevent being triangulated and maintain therapeutic boundaries confidence about providing court-appropriate documentation methods to structure sessions and manage between-session contact how to protect yourself legally while maintaining therapeutic effectiveness This workshop is fully catered.
Her approach integrates ACT, Compassion-Focused Therapy, and ProSocial principles with practical strategies drawn from extensive experience in: expert witness testimony in Family Court proceedings court-mandated therapy for families in legal disputes child and adolescent mental health services youth justice system intervention perinatal mental health support working with neurodivergent children and their families Her career spans leadership roles including Past President of the ANZ Association for Contextual Behavioural Science, Research Associate for Telethon Kids Institute, and Council Member for Collaborative Practice Western Australia.

events.venue: 5, ANZAC House 181 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
The Management Essentials Training has been developed by Clubs New Zealand and is aimed at upskilling Managers who would like to improve their knowledge around compliance issues and obtain a detailed understanding of the various components clubs traditionally earn revenue from.
The course is aimed at anyone who is new to club management, moving into club management or even those who have years of experience and want to refresh their knowledge and skills.
The course provides numerous opportunities for discussion and to explore ideas, issues or questions participants have, some of the topics covered on the course include; Who is Clubs New Zealand and what we can assist with via our website or in person, Basic accounting requirements for your club – Audits, Gaming accounts, “KISS”, Legislation that effects your club - The Sale & Supply of Alcohol Act 2012, Incorporated Societies Act, Food Bill etc., Gaming – best practices, Business Partners – making them work for your Club.
Two days The cost of the two day course is $190.00 per person (plus accommodation and travel).

events.long_description:
Join John Chow — entrepreneur, investor, and co-founder of Stonewood Group — for an evening of real-world insights into entrepreneurship, innovation, and the future of business in the AI era.

Whether you’re a founder, freelancer, investor, or simply AI-curious, this is your chance to hear directly from one of New Zealand’s boldest business leaders and walk away inspired.

Keynote: “Lessons from the Past, Eyes on the Future: A Founder’s Take on AI”
John shares his entrepreneurial journey and how he’s thinking about AI as a tool for the next wave of business growth.

A live podcast-style conversation between John Chow and Bin Wang (Head of AI, Stonewood Group), unpacking how real companies can embrace AI without the hype.

Networking + Giveaways
Mix and mingle with fellow professionals, founders, and AI enthusiasts. Enjoy drinks and enter the draw to win prizes!

Presented by:
Urban Hub Wellington
Workspaces built for entrepreneurs, growing teams, and professionals who want to do more with their day.

events.id: Terror-Fi Presents: THE TOXIC AVENGER (NZ Premiere - Wellington)-12 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook

events.venue: 12 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Be the first in New Zealand to see THE TOXIC AVENGER, starring Peter Dinklage, Kevin Bacon, and our favourite adopted Kiwi Elijah Wood.
Comically violent, absurdly gory, and extremely entertaining ... Toxie is the radioactive antidote to superhero fatigue. 92% on Rotten Tomatoes and not to be missed on the big screen – especially as it almost didn’t make it to our cinemas!
“When a downtrodden janitor, Winston Gooze, is exposed to a catastrophic toxic accident, he’s transformed into a new kind of hero: The Toxic Avenger. Now, Toxie must rise from outcast to saviour, taking on ruthless corporate overlords and corrupt forces who threaten his son, his friends, and his community. In a world where greed runs rampant … justice is best served radioactive.”

events.venue: TBD Horowhenua, TBD
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: Bakery & Brewery-Dough Bakery HQ, 12 Railway Avenue-WOAP
events.name: Bakery & Brewery
events.venue: Dough Bakery HQ, 12 Railway Avenue
events.long_description:
Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!

events.name: A Night on the Orient Express
events.venue: The Botanist, 219 Onepu Rd
events.long_description:
All aboard as The Botanist turns into The Orient Express. Your tasty train journey will begin in Paris, heading to Istanbul via Germany, Austria, Serbia, Hungary and Bulgaria. The 7-course menu features modern plant-based takes on traditional dishes from each country’s cuisine, such as French crepes with vegan duck a l'orange, coconut-crusted parsnip Austrian schnitzel and Bulgarian kashkaval house-made cultured cashew cheese and spinach pastry; paired with creative cocktails, live music and some iconic Orient Express touches.
 
7-course tasting menu. Matched cocktails (alcoholic or non-alchoholic) can be added to your ticket.

events.id: Sweet Sensations-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Sweet Sensations
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description: Noble Rot wants to sing the praises of sweet wines and help you to learn that they aren't just one note. They'll showcase a range of wines from around the world that lean towards the sweeter side without leaving a cloying sensation on your palate, enhanced by a specially-curated five-course degustation menu from entree to dessert. If you would like to explore your favourite level of sweetness in wine, this event is for you. The knowledgeable Noble Rot team are here to show you that sweetness is one of wine’s most versatile assets, as well-balanced sweetness in wine can be delicate, elegant and complementary to both sweet and savoury dishes. Discover how some grape varieties are more suited to producing sweeter wines and how their level of sweetness is achieved. If you're into the sweeter things in life, this one is for you.

events.description:
Testimonies are emerging from churches across Aotearoa of an openness to faith, responses from people previously not interested in church, and a curiosity about Christ and Christianity among non-believers, particularly young people.
As church and Christian leaders in Aotearoa New Zealand, how might we respond in our contexts?
Session Two: Stories of Renewal In this panel discussion, local pastors and leaders share stories of how they are seeing that God has been moving — stirring renewal and hope, unexpected shifts in discipleship and salvations, and how they are responding.
Session Four: Renewal Conversations What does it look like to steward renewal in our churches?
This session focuses on practical responses to renewal and discussion around how the Church in Aotearoa can partner with what the Spirit is doing.

events.id: Songs for my Chatbot-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Songs for my Chatbot
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Generative AI is everywhere.
Each campaign presents it as an efficiency fix, often for problems it invented.
Yet efficiency collapses in fields that thrive on the very search for problems.
In the creative arts, including music, the goal usually is not to solve problems; it’s to seek them, wrestle with them and forge novel, unexpected forms of expression.
That clash between algorithmic speed, and the creative value of exploration sets the stage for this session.

events.id: He Waka Eke Noa: Reflections-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: He Waka Eke Noa: Reflections
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai, Join us for the final panel discussion for Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, where we discuss the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of The Waitangi Tribunal, held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
Here to discuss the future of Te Tiriti are a panel of outspoken young leaders, chaired by veteran Māori lawyer Annette Sykes, as we ask, ‘What will be the mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal in 2075?’ and ‘How can we uphold the mana of Te Tiriti ourselves to ensure mana motuhake for our mokopuna, and secure a just and equitable Aotearoa for all future generations of New Zealanders?’ Tickets are $35 per session, or $25 for students and SuperGold Card holders, and include one drink and light kai.
She has also been involved in the Waitangi Tribunal Claims and is an adjunct professor at the Faculty of Law at Auckland University, as part of a commitment to ensuring the reclaiming of Māori law, Tikanga Māori as the first law of this nation.
Luke’s research and teaching interests are centred on Te Tiriti o Waitangi, Family Law, Child Protection and Children’s Rights.
Tamatha is the first ever Māori MP for Wellington Central, as well as the youngest MP for the Green Party.

events.name: Roger Hall's Easy Money
events.venue: Mana Little Theatre, 9 Sunset Parade, Plimmerton, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)
Directed by Teresa Sullivan

events.venue: Nelson Street Georgetown Invercargill,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.

events.id: Always a Bridesmaid-Zephyr Cafe, 217 Wakefield Street-WOAP
events.name: Always a Bridesmaid
events.venue: Zephyr Cafe, 217 Wakefield Street
events.long_description:
Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.

events.id: Cognac vs Armagnac-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Cognac vs Armagnac
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description: Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.

But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly.

events.long_description: Young Flame is a dining experience inspired by fire. QT Wellington’s Executive Chef, Antoine Collet, delivers a bold three-course chef’s tasting menu that’s as deliciously playful as it is refined. Young Flame promises an evening steeped in elemental elegance.

✅ Google My Business as a Social Platform – Maximizing this underutilized tool for engagement and SEO.
✅ Writing Business Posts That Connect – Creating content that will help you actually keep, gain and attract business not just likes & followers ✅ Social Media & Search Visibility – How consistent posting helps customers find your business.

events.id: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses-102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses
events.venue: 102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
More people are using AI, without understanding how it works, without telling their employers that they are using it, without considering the implications, and without knowing how to get the most from the tools they’re using.
This is where AI literacy becomes essential - it’s not just knowing how to use AI tools, it’s about understanding what’s possible, and knowing you don’t need to be technically savvy to use it well.
This practical two-hour in-person workshop is for real people in real businesses; who want to use AI to do more with the resources and tools they already have.
No tech jargon.
I’ve spent my career helping teams work smarter, minimise risks and leverage opportunities that come from doing business in our fast-changing world.

events.description:
What does it take to lead under pressure — and come out stronger?
In today’s fast-changing business world, resilience isn’t just a nice-to-have — it’s a must.
And few people understand that better than Richie McCaw.
Widely regarded as one of New Zealand’s greatest rugby players, Richie brings hard-earned insight into leading high-performing teams, staying grounded under pressure, and bouncing back from setbacks — lessons that resonate well beyond the field.

events.name: Perfect Days
events.venue: Embassy of Japan, Level 18, 100 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come along to our free Japanese Film night, co-organised with the Japan Foundation, Sydney!

Synopsis
Hirayama seems utterly content with his simple life as a cleaner of toilets in Tokyo. Outside of his very structured everyday routine he enjoys his passion for music and for books. And he loves trees and takes photos of them. A series of unexpected encounters gradually reveal more of his past. A deeply moving and poetic reflection on finding beauty in the everyday world around us.
Director: Wim Wenders / Classification: M / Year: 2023 / Genre: Drama
Language: Japanese with English subtitles

Copyright:© 2023 Master Mind Ltd.

Whether you're a seasoned chef or just getting started, The Food Show is your ticket to discovering the best in food, flavour, and fun.

events.id: Dragons Is My Uso-Dragons Chinese Restaurant, 25 Tory St-WOAP
events.name: Dragons Is My Uso
events.venue: Dragons Chinese Restaurant, 25 Tory St
events.long_description:
Chef Jessica Tang and legendary home chefs Litia Lefaoseu and Iutita Mallon are drawing on the century long fusion of Chinese and Samoan cuisine and the way food expresses love, ai, and alofa. In the late 1800s, small numbers of Chinese settled in Samoa and became part of a growing multicultural community. There they influenced local customs, made an enduring contribution to Samoan cuisine introducing contemporary favourites such as sapasui (chop suey), keke pua‘a (pork buns) and of course laisa (rice). 

Dragons celebrate this cultural and culinary fusion by showcasing these favourites and presenting new dishes highlighting the shared love of culinary staples such as taro and noodles, rice, fish, and pork, the magnificent spectrum of Chinese herbs, spices and flavours. Through cooking and sharing food together the chefs honour their culinary heritage, strengthen our connections to one another and celebrate the big and little moments in life. This is a shared-style meal, served banquet style on lazy Susan turntables. 
Dragons is My Uso was one of the sell-out hits of the 2024 festival - don't miss out!

Discounted tables for 10 available for $1000, so get the whole aiga together!

events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers.
Fronted by singer and ukelele player Mo Blishen, and filled out with Kent Hogan on guitar, Nik Straughier on bass and Sam King on drums, Agatha Pantha is the product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the every day.
Joining them are fellow Wellington Band BDSN, fronted by Nigel Parry.
Satirical songs with a hard edge and soft centre, a bit like a box of chocolates.
Joined by Scott Pilgrim, Darrel Greaney and Ben McHardy.

events.id: CMNZ Series Takács Quartet-Public Trust Hall, 131-135, Lambton Quay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: CMNZ Series Takács Quartet
events.venue: Public Trust Hall, 131-135, Lambton Quay, Wellington
events.description:
Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s 'String Quartets', the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op.
74, No.
3, known as 'The Rider' – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No.
59 No.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work – 'Flow' by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.

events.venue: 87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
Once each season, our beautifully historic local church is transformed into an intimate haven, softly illuminated by the glow of 200 flickering candles and a gentle wash of laser light.
The result?
Guest Artists: The Kugels Take two former New Zealand Symphony Orchestra players, a virtuoso accordionist, and a renowned bass player — and you have The Kugels!
After nationwide tours with Arts on Tour NZ and Chamber Music New Zealand, and performances at major festivals, The Kugels continue to enchant and inspire wherever they play.

events.id: Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI-34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI
events.venue: 34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Claudio in his Mexican project called Xochipilli´s Eye. Xochipilli (Pronounce: Zo-chee-pee-lee) is the Mexica god of music, flowers, arts, and sacred plants.
Claudio´s last trip home to Mexico was full of inspiration, reconnecting him to his ancestral roots in Mexico City. He was fortunate to meet a prehispanic musician and instrument maker who plays and crafts beautiful traditional instruments. Claudio returned to NZ with many special new instruments; and continues to be inspired and guided by the cultural wealth, wisdom, and knowledge of the ancient cultures of the Americas.
This event will be extraordinary and unique. You will learn about Mexican prehispanic cosmology and spirituality. Experience simple and powerful rituals together with unique musical instruments used by Olmecs, Toltecs, Aztecs, and Mayans. The instruments include clay flutes, clay drums, medicine drums, ocarinas, wooden flutes, shells, and shakers skilfully arranged to create magical shamanic atmospheres.
We will be sharing Cacao which is an energetic traditional Mexican prehispanic drinks that help open the heart, reconnect with the earth element, ignite your fire, and get you up and moving.
What to expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
Talk about the use of music in the ancient times.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions.
Cacao ceremony: Claudio will offer the cacao drink as a connection with the earth, to yourself, and the moment.
Live music that invokes many emotions and imagery, from contemplative natural and mystical environments to uplifting and empowering rhythms. You are free to project and explore within and/ or express and liberate projecting outwards.
We will finish with a shamanic atmosphere relaxation and close the event with a traditional chant.
No previous experience is required.
What to bring:
Wear comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and a mind ready to learn and receive. You are also welcome to bring a fruit and or a flower to contribute to the altar.
Date & Time: Saturday, April 13th, 6-7:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment: $55

events.id: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
Let the emotional knowledge you gain inform not only how you live your life but also how you feel about living it.
To do this you’ll identify your values hierarchy and learn about how this framework can inform how you live your life.
Once you can apply a spirit of consistency to your self-identified larger purpose, as well as your needs, then your life’s purpose, emotional needs and core values, will align.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Develop a Life Purpose Statement Perform an Emotional Needs Self-Assessment Elicit Your Core Values Align your goals with your life purpose, emotional needs and core values Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

We’ll cover what to look out for when things start to wear out, and how to check for problems, so you can be confident your bicycle is safe to ride.
Those who feel intimidated in bike shops are especially welcome in this course.
Regardless of whether your bike is in pristine condition, or desperately in need of TLC, it is welcome on the course – bikes showing a bit more wear can be useful for the learning of the whole group.
If you have the following, please bring them as well:  A multi-tool and pump; chain oil and rag; lightweight close-fitting gardening or rubber gloves.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Name most parts of a bicycle correctly - Perform a quick safety check on any bicycle - Fix a flat tyre - Adjust your bike to fit your body - Oil and clean your chain - Identify and fix some common brake problems Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

Have you always wanted to try stand-up comedy?
Or do you just want to learn how to be a funnier, more confident speaker?
Let's get you started in this fun, interactive one-day workshop.
No experience, preparation, or talents required!
In this class you will learn to: Develop creative practices to generate and explore comedic ideas Craft your ideas into standup comedy jokes and routines Maximize laughter with great delivery Overcome your stage fright and become a more confident presenter During class, we’ll write together, craft bits, play games, share material, and give you some fun, low-pressure practice on the mic.

events.name: Knitting - Next Level
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Knitting - Next Level Build on your learning from the Beginner’s Knitting class.
Learn how to read a knitting ball band and knitting pattern as well as gain a basic understanding of knitting abbreviations.
You will have practiced the wraps per inch method, practiced a couple of techniques as outlined by knitting abbreviations and understand tension as both a principle and practical guide in the craft of knitting.
By the end of the session you’ll be able to: Read a knitting ball band Know how to determine yarn weight using the wraps per inch method Read a basic knitting pattern Run through of basic knitting abbreviations (reference sheet provided) Understand tension: what is it, why you make tension swatches and how to alter tension as needed.
Explore the rules of substituting yarn Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Oil Painting Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Oil Painting Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Oil Painting Workshop In this course we will learn about painting with oils: one of the oldest and most interesting mediums, and one which has an undeserved reputation for being slow or intimidating!
In this workshop we will learn some quick methods for getting started in oils, using “alla prima” (wet on wet) methods to develop an understanding of the painting process.
In addition to learning about the practical side of the medium, there will also be opportunities to learn a bit about the extraordinary history of painting in oils.
Basic paint colours provided, you're welcome to bring along any that you may already have at home.
- Develop transparent glazes and washes over your painting.

events.id: Women's Health and Aging Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Women's Health and Aging Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $109 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women.
Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed.
-The importance of the diaphragm and breathing well will also be discussed to enhance optimal movement and function for women.
Please wear comfortable clothes and socks as this is an interactive workshop, and bring a yoga mat or beach towel.

events.name: Zine Making - Introduction
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Zine Making - Introduction In this workshop you will be guided in making a classic cut and fold 8-page zine from a standard A4 sheet of paper - this is a clever design you can easily photocopy and reproduce later!
You will be introduced to a range of techniques and approaches such as cut and paste photos and text, collage and drawing on paper.
Paper, newspapers, magazines and basic drawing materials will be provided.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Cut and fold a classic 8-page zine format from a single sheet of paper Brainstorm content ideas for your personalised zine publications Arrange & compose text and images to fit a classic 8-page zine layout Combine cut & paste magazine content with hand drawn/ written content Create a draft zine of your personal interests Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Creative Power - Nelson Workshop NEW DATE-Main Road Stoke Nelson, Nelson Region-Event Brite
events.name: Creative Power - Nelson Workshop NEW DATE
events.venue: Main Road Stoke Nelson, Nelson Region
events.description:
This is more than a workshop – it’s a chance to connect, learn, and be part of the movement.
The Creative Power workshop series is travelling across Aotearoa to bring together Writers, Directors, Editors and Performers to unpack the Screen Industry Workers Act (SIWA), share knowledge, and build stronger screen careers — together.
Delivered in partnership with NZWG, DEGANZ and Equity NZ, these free workshops offer the tools and insights you need to feel confident in your work and your rights.
What we’ll cover:🛠️ Practical tools for getting contracts right now📜 The story behind SIWA – how we got here and why it matters💬 Demystifying bargaining – what it means for you🧠 Discussion, questions and shared experiences🍷 Drinks, nibbles, and the chance to connect with your creative whānau You won’t want to miss this.
Whether you’re just starting out or a seasoned pro, this is your chance to get informed, feel empowered, and spend time with fellow creatives who get it.

events.name: Wellington Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds

events.description:
Build a relationship with a natural world that is overflowing with abundant, wild, edible, nutritious, medicinal plants.
By the end of the workshop you will: - understand the basic principles of foraging, including sustainable harvesting - feel confident in identifying 10-15 wild edible plants - know about their nutritional & medicinal benefits - know about common toxic/dangerous plants to avoid when foraging - know about the best ways to prepare your foraged greens for maximum nutritional benefit & flavor - feel empowered to include foraged greens in your everyday diet Walk away with hands on, practical skills & knowledge that you can use in your own life.
Investment includes hands on wild weed walk & discussion, cup of foraged herbal tea & wildly delicious foraged snack.
To learn more about Felicity and her offerings, visit @wildbotanica.nz on social media or www.wildbotanica.co.nz.
For any queries, please email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
